Bug Summary

File:screen.c
Location:line 277, column 7
Description:Null pointer passed as an argument to a 'nonnull' parameter

Annotated Source Code

1/*
2 * VIM - Vi IMproved by Bram Moolenaar
3 *
4 * Do ":help uganda" in Vim to read copying and usage conditions.
5 * Do ":help credits" in Vim to see a list of people who contributed.
6 * See README.txt for an overview of the Vim source code.

8
9/*
10 * screen.c: code for displaying on the screen
11 *
12 * Output to the screen (console, terminal emulator or GUI window) is minimized
13 * by remembering what is already on the screen, and only updating the parts
14 * that changed.
15 *
16 * ScreenLines[off] Contains a copy of the whole screen, as it is currently
17 * displayed (excluding text written by external commands).
18 * ScreenAttrs[off] Contains the associated attributes.
19 * LineOffset[row] Contains the offset into ScreenLines*[] and ScreenAttrs[]
20 * for each line.
21 * LineWraps[row] Flag for each line whether it wraps to the next line.
22 *
23 * For double-byte characters, two consecutive bytes in ScreenLines[] can form
24 * one character which occupies two display cells.
25 * For UTF-8 a multi-byte character is converted to Unicode and stored in
26 * ScreenLinesUC[]. ScreenLines[] contains the first byte only. For an ASCII
27 * character without composing chars ScreenLinesUC[] will be 0 and
28 * ScreenLinesC[][] is not used. When the character occupies two display
29 * cells the next byte in ScreenLines[] is 0.
30 * ScreenLinesC[][] contain up to 'maxcombine' composing characters
31 * (drawn on top of the first character). There is 0 after the last one used.
32 * ScreenLines2[] is only used for euc-jp to store the second byte if the
33 * first byte is 0x8e (single-width character).
34 *
35 * The screen_*() functions write to the screen and handle updating
36 * ScreenLines[].
37 *
38 * update_screen() is the function that updates all windows and status lines.
39 * It is called form the main loop when must_redraw is non-zero. It may be
40 * called from other places when an immediate screen update is needed.
41 *
42 * The part of the buffer that is displayed in a window is set with:
43 * - w_topline (first buffer line in window)
44 * - w_topfill (filler lines above the first line)
45 * - w_leftcol (leftmost window cell in window),
46 * - w_skipcol (skipped window cells of first line)
47 *
48 * Commands that only move the cursor around in a window, do not need to take
49 * action to update the display. The main loop will check if w_topline is
50 * valid and update it (scroll the window) when needed.
51 *
52 * Commands that scroll a window change w_topline and must call
53 * check_cursor() to move the cursor into the visible part of the window, and
54 * call redraw_later(VALID) to have the window displayed by update_screen()
55 * later.
56 *
57 * Commands that change text in the buffer must call changed_bytes() or
58 * changed_lines() to mark the area that changed and will require updating
59 * later. The main loop will call update_screen(), which will update each
60 * window that shows the changed buffer. This assumes text above the change
61 * can remain displayed as it is. Text after the change may need updating for
62 * scrolling, folding and syntax highlighting.
63 *
64 * Commands that change how a window is displayed (e.g., setting 'list') or
65 * invalidate the contents of a window in another way (e.g., change fold
66 * settings), must call redraw_later(NOT_VALID) to have the whole window
67 * redisplayed by update_screen() later.
68 *
69 * Commands that change how a buffer is displayed (e.g., setting 'tabstop')
70 * must call redraw_curbuf_later(NOT_VALID) to have all the windows for the
71 * buffer redisplayed by update_screen() later.
72 *
73 * Commands that change highlighting and possibly cause a scroll too must call
74 * redraw_later(SOME_VALID) to update the whole window but still use scrolling
75 * to avoid redrawing everything. But the length of displayed lines must not
76 * change, use NOT_VALID then.
77 *
78 * Commands that move the window position must call redraw_later(NOT_VALID).
79 * TODO: should minimize redrawing by scrolling when possible.
80 *
81 * Commands that change everything (e.g., resizing the screen) must call
82 * redraw_all_later(NOT_VALID) or redraw_all_later(CLEAR).
83 *
84 * Things that are handled indirectly:
85 * - When messages scroll the screen up, msg_scrolled will be set and
86 * update_screen() called to redraw.
87 */
88
89#include <errno(*__errno_location ()).h>
90#include <inttypes.h>
91#include <stdbool.h>
92#include <string.h>

137#define MB_FILLER_CHAR'<' '<' /* character used when a double-width character
138 * doesn't fit. */
139#define W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) (wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width)
140
141/*
142 * The attributes that are actually active for writing to the screen.
143 */
144static int screen_attr = 0;
145
146/*
147 * Positioning the cursor is reduced by remembering the last position.
148 * Mostly used by windgoto() and screen_char().
149 */
150static int screen_cur_row, screen_cur_col; /* last known cursor position */
151
152static match_T search_hl; /* used for 'hlsearch' highlight matching */
153
154static foldinfo_T win_foldinfo; /* info for 'foldcolumn' */
155
156/*
157 * Buffer for one screen line (characters and attributes).
158 */
159static schar_T *current_ScreenLine;
160
161# define SCREEN_LINE(r, o, e, c, rl)screen_line((r), (o), (e), (c), (rl)) screen_line((r), (o), (e), (c), (rl))
162#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
163# include "screen.c.generated.h"
164#endif
165#define SEARCH_HL_PRIORITY0 0
166
167//signs column
168
169/* Ugly global: overrule attribute used by screen_char() */
170static int screen_char_attr = 0;
171
172/*
173 * Redraw the current window later, with update_screen(type).
174 * Set must_redraw only if not already set to a higher value.
175 * e.g. if must_redraw is CLEAR, type NOT_VALID will do nothing.
176 */
177void redraw_later(int type)
178{
179 redraw_win_later(curwin, type);
180}
181
182void redraw_win_later(win_T *wp, int type)
183{
184 if (wp->w_redr_type < type) {
185 wp->w_redr_type = type;
186 if (type >= NOT_VALID40)
187 wp->w_lines_valid = 0;
188 if (must_redraw < type) /* must_redraw is the maximum of all windows */
189 must_redraw = type;
190 }
191}
192
193/*
194 * Force a complete redraw later. Also resets the highlighting. To be used
195 * after executing a shell command that messes up the screen.
196 */
197void redraw_later_clear(void)
198{
199 redraw_all_later(CLEAR50);
200 /* Use attributes that is very unlikely to appear in text. */
201 screen_attr = HL_BOLD0x02 | HL_UNDERLINE0x08 | HL_INVERSE0x01;
202}
203
204/*
205 * Mark all windows to be redrawn later.
206 */
207void redraw_all_later(int type)
208{
209 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
210 redraw_win_later(wp, type);
211 }
212}
213
214/*
215 * Mark all windows that are editing the current buffer to be updated later.
216 */
217void redraw_curbuf_later(int type)
218{
219 redraw_buf_later(curbuf, type);
220}
221
222void redraw_buf_later(buf_T *buf, int type)
223{
224 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
225 if (wp->w_buffer == buf) {
226 redraw_win_later(wp, type);
227 }
228 }
229}
230
231/*
232 * Redraw as soon as possible. When the command line is not scrolled redraw
233 * right away and restore what was on the command line.
234 * Return a code indicating what happened.
235 */
236int redraw_asap(int type)
237{
238 int rows;
239 int r;
240 int ret = 0;
241 schar_T *screenline; /* copy from ScreenLines[] */
242 sattr_T *screenattr; /* copy from ScreenAttrs[] */
243 int i;
244 u8char_T *screenlineUC = NULL((void*)0); /* copy from ScreenLinesUC[] */
245 u8char_T *screenlineC[MAX_MCO6]; /* copy from ScreenLinesC[][] */
246 schar_T *screenline2 = NULL((void*)0); /* copy from ScreenLines2[] */
247
248 redraw_later(type);
249 if (msg_scrolled || (State != NORMAL0x01 && State != NORMAL_BUSY(0x100 + 0x01)))
1
Assuming 'State' is equal to 1
→
250 return ret;
251
252 /* Allocate space to save the text displayed in the command line area. */
253 rows = Rows - cmdline_row;
254 screenline = xmalloc((size_t)(rows * Columns * sizeof(schar_T)));
255 screenattr = xmalloc((size_t)(rows * Columns * sizeof(sattr_T)));
256
257 if (enc_utf8) {

←
Assuming 'enc_utf8' is 0
→
3
←

→

262 }
263 }

Assuming 'r' is < 'rows'

Loop condition is true. Entering loop body

272 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(schar_T));

287 ScreenLines2 + LineOffset[cmdline_row + r],
288 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(schar_T));
289 }
290
291 update_screen(0);
292 ret = 3;
293
294 if (must_redraw == 0) {
295 int off = (int)(current_ScreenLine - ScreenLines);
296
297 /* Restore the text displayed in the command line area. */
298 for (r = 0; r < rows; ++r) {
299 memmove(current_ScreenLine,
300 screenline + r * Columns,
301 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(schar_T));
302 memmove(ScreenAttrs + off,
303 screenattr + r * Columns,
304 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(sattr_T));
305 if (enc_utf8) {
306 memmove(ScreenLinesUC + off,
307 screenlineUC + r * Columns,
308 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(u8char_T));
309 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
310 memmove(ScreenLinesC[i] + off,
311 screenlineC[i] + r * Columns,
312 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(u8char_T));
313 }
314 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932)
315 memmove(ScreenLines2 + off,
316 screenline2 + r * Columns,
317 (size_t)Columns * sizeof(schar_T));
318 SCREEN_LINE(cmdline_row + r, 0, Columns, Columns, FALSE)screen_line((cmdline_row + r), (0), (Columns), (Columns), (0)
);
319 }
320 ret = 4;
321 }
322
323 free(screenline);
324 free(screenattr);
325 if (enc_utf8) {
326 free(screenlineUC);
327 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
328 free(screenlineC[i]);
329 }
330 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932)
331 free(screenline2);
332
333 /* Show the intro message when appropriate. */
334 maybe_intro_message();
335
336 setcursor();
337
338 return ret;
339}
340
341/*
342 * Changed something in the current window, at buffer line "lnum", that
343 * requires that line and possibly other lines to be redrawn.
344 * Used when entering/leaving Insert mode with the cursor on a folded line.
345 * Used to remove the "$" from a change command.
346 * Note that when also inserting/deleting lines w_redraw_top and w_redraw_bot
347 * may become invalid and the whole window will have to be redrawn.
348 */
349void
350redrawWinline (
351 linenr_T lnum,
352 int invalid /* window line height is invalid now */
353)
354{
355 int i;
356
357 if (curwin->w_redraw_top == 0 || curwin->w_redraw_top > lnum)
358 curwin->w_redraw_top = lnum;
359 if (curwin->w_redraw_bot == 0 || curwin->w_redraw_bot < lnum)
360 curwin->w_redraw_bot = lnum;
361 redraw_later(VALID10);
362
363 if (invalid) {
364 /* A w_lines[] entry for this lnum has become invalid. */
365 i = find_wl_entry(curwin, lnum);
366 if (i >= 0)
367 curwin->w_lines[i].wl_valid = FALSE0;
368 }
369}
370
371/*
372 * update all windows that are editing the current buffer
373 */
374void update_curbuf(int type)
375{
376 redraw_curbuf_later(type);
377 update_screen(type);
378}
379
380/*
381 * update_screen()
382 *
383 * Based on the current value of curwin->w_topline, transfer a screenfull
384 * of stuff from Filemem to ScreenLines[], and update curwin->w_botline.
385 */
386void update_screen(int type)
387{
388 static int did_intro = FALSE0;
389 int did_one;
390
391 /* Don't do anything if the screen structures are (not yet) valid. */
392 if (!screen_valid(TRUE1))
393 return;
394
395 if (must_redraw) {
396 if (type < must_redraw) /* use maximal type */
397 type = must_redraw;
398
399 /* must_redraw is reset here, so that when we run into some weird
400 * reason to redraw while busy redrawing (e.g., asynchronous
401 * scrolling), or update_topline() in win_update() will cause a
402 * scroll, the screen will be redrawn later or in win_update(). */
403 must_redraw = 0;
404 }
405
406 /* Need to update w_lines[]. */
407 if (curwin->w_lines_valid == 0 && type < NOT_VALID40)
408 type = NOT_VALID40;
409
410 /* Postpone the redrawing when it's not needed and when being called
411 * recursively. */
412 if (!redrawing() || updating_screen) {
413 redraw_later(type); /* remember type for next time */
414 must_redraw = type;
415 if (type > INVERTED_ALL25)
416 curwin->w_lines_valid = 0; /* don't use w_lines[].wl_size now */
417 return;
418 }
419
420 updating_screen = TRUE1;
421 ++display_tick; /* let syntax code know we're in a next round of
422 * display updating */
423
424 /*
425 * if the screen was scrolled up when displaying a message, scroll it down
426 */
427 if (msg_scrolled) {
428 clear_cmdline = TRUE1;
429 if (msg_scrolled > Rows - 5) /* clearing is faster */
430 type = CLEAR50;
431 else if (type != CLEAR50) {
432 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
433 if (screen_ins_lines(0, 0, msg_scrolled, (int)Rows, NULL((void*)0)) == FAIL0)
434 type = CLEAR50;
435 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
436 if (wp->w_winrow < msg_scrolled) {
437 if (wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height > msg_scrolled
438 && wp->w_redr_type < REDRAW_TOP30
439 && wp->w_lines_valid > 0
440 && wp->w_topline == wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum) {
441 wp->w_upd_rows = msg_scrolled - wp->w_winrow;
442 wp->w_redr_type = REDRAW_TOP30;
443 } else {
444 wp->w_redr_type = NOT_VALID40;
445 if (wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height + wp->w_status_height
446 <= msg_scrolled) {
447 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
448 }
449 }
450 }
451 }
452 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
453 redraw_tabline = TRUE1;
454 }
455 msg_scrolled = 0;
456 need_wait_return = FALSE0;
457 }
458
459 /* reset cmdline_row now (may have been changed temporarily) */
460 compute_cmdrow();
461
462 /* Check for changed highlighting */
463 if (need_highlight_changed)
464 highlight_changed();
465
466 if (type == CLEAR50) { /* first clear screen */
467 screenclear(); /* will reset clear_cmdline */
468 type = NOT_VALID40;
469 }
470
471 if (clear_cmdline) /* going to clear cmdline (done below) */
472 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
473
474 /* Force redraw when width of 'number' or 'relativenumber' column
475 * changes. */
476 if (curwin->w_redr_type < NOT_VALID40
477 && curwin->w_nrwidth != ((curwin->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu || curwin->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
478 ? number_width(curwin) : 0))
479 curwin->w_redr_type = NOT_VALID40;
480
481 /*
482 * Only start redrawing if there is really something to do.
483 */
484 if (type == INVERTED20)
485 update_curswant();
486 if (curwin->w_redr_type < type
487 && !((type == VALID10
488 && curwin->w_lines[0].wl_valid
489 && curwin->w_topfill == curwin->w_old_topfill
490 && curwin->w_botfill == curwin->w_old_botfill
491 && curwin->w_topline == curwin->w_lines[0].wl_lnum)
492 || (type == INVERTED20
493 && VIsual_active
494 && curwin->w_old_cursor_lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum
495 && curwin->w_old_visual_mode == VIsual_mode
496 && (curwin->w_valid & VALID_VIRTCOL0x04)
497 && curwin->w_old_curswant == curwin->w_curswant)
498 ))
499 curwin->w_redr_type = type;
500
501 /* Redraw the tab pages line if needed. */
502 if (redraw_tabline || type >= NOT_VALID40)
503 draw_tabline();
504
505 /*
506 * Correct stored syntax highlighting info for changes in each displayed
507 * buffer. Each buffer must only be done once.
508 */
509 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
510 if (wp->w_buffer->b_mod_set) {
511 win_T *wwp;
512
513 /* Check if we already did this buffer. */
514 for (wwp = firstwin; wwp != wp; wwp = wwp->w_next)
515 if (wwp->w_buffer == wp->w_buffer)
516 break;
517 if (
518 wwp == wp &&
519 syntax_present(wp))
520 syn_stack_apply_changes(wp->w_buffer);
521 }
522 }
523
524 /*
525 * Go from top to bottom through the windows, redrawing the ones that need
526 * it.
527 */
528 did_one = FALSE0;
529 search_hl.rm.regprog = NULL((void*)0);
530 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
531 if (wp->w_redr_type != 0) {
532 cursor_off();
533 if (!did_one) {
534 did_one = TRUE1;
535 start_search_hl();
536 }
537 win_update(wp);
538 }
539
540 /* redraw status line after the window to minimize cursor movement */
541 if (wp->w_redr_status) {
542 cursor_off();
543 win_redr_status(wp);
544 }
545 }
546 end_search_hl();
547 /* May need to redraw the popup menu. */
548 if (pum_visible())
549 pum_redraw();
550
551 /* Reset b_mod_set flags. Going through all windows is probably faster
552 * than going through all buffers (there could be many buffers). */
553 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
554 wp->w_buffer->b_mod_set = FALSE0;
555 }
556
557 updating_screen = FALSE0;
558
559 /* Clear or redraw the command line. Done last, because scrolling may
560 * mess up the command line. */
561 if (clear_cmdline || redraw_cmdline)
562 showmode();
563
564 /* May put up an introductory message when not editing a file */
565 if (!did_intro)
566 maybe_intro_message();
567 did_intro = TRUE1;
568
569}
570
571/*
572 * Return TRUE if the cursor line in window "wp" may be concealed, according
573 * to the 'concealcursor' option.
574 */
575int conceal_cursor_line(win_T *wp)
576{
577 int c;
578
579 if (*wp->w_p_cocuw_onebuf_opt.wo_cocu == NUL'\000')
580 return FALSE0;
581 if (get_real_state() & VISUAL0x02)
582 c = 'v';
583 else if (State & INSERT0x10)
584 c = 'i';
585 else if (State & NORMAL0x01)
586 c = 'n';
587 else if (State & CMDLINE0x08)
588 c = 'c';
589 else
590 return FALSE0;
591 return vim_strchr(wp->w_p_cocuw_onebuf_opt.wo_cocu, c) != NULL((void*)0);
592}
593
594/*
595 * Check if the cursor line needs to be redrawn because of 'concealcursor'.
596 */
597void conceal_check_cursur_line(void)
598{
599 if (curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole > 0 && conceal_cursor_line(curwin)) {
600 need_cursor_line_redraw = TRUE1;
601 /* Need to recompute cursor column, e.g., when starting Visual mode
602 * without concealing. */
603 curs_columns(TRUE1);
604 }
605}
606
607void update_single_line(win_T *wp, linenr_T lnum)
608{
609 int row;
610 int j;
611
612 if (lnum >= wp->w_topline && lnum < wp->w_botline
613 && foldedCount(wp, lnum, &win_foldinfo) == 0) {
614 row = 0;
615 for (j = 0; j < wp->w_lines_valid; ++j) {
616 if (lnum == wp->w_lines[j].wl_lnum) {
617 screen_start(); /* not sure of screen cursor */
618 init_search_hl(wp);
619 start_search_hl();
620 prepare_search_hl(wp, lnum);
621 win_line(wp, lnum, row, row + wp->w_lines[j].wl_size, false0);
622 end_search_hl();
623 break;
624 }
625 row += wp->w_lines[j].wl_size;
626 }
627 }
628 need_cursor_line_redraw = FALSE0;
629}
630
631
632/*
633 * Prepare for updating one or more windows.
634 * Caller must check for "updating_screen" already set to avoid recursiveness.
635 */
636static void update_prepare(void)
637{
638 cursor_off();
639 updating_screen = TRUE1;
640 start_search_hl();
641}
642
643/*
644 * Finish updating one or more windows.
645 */
646static void update_finish(void)
647{
648 if (redraw_cmdline) {
649 showmode();
650 }
651
652 end_search_hl();
653 updating_screen = FALSE0;
654}
655
656void update_debug_sign(buf_T *buf, linenr_T lnum)
657{
658 int doit = FALSE0;
659 win_foldinfo.fi_level = 0;
660
661 /* update/delete a specific mark */
662 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
663 if (buf != NULL((void*)0) && lnum > 0) {
664 if (wp->w_buffer == buf && lnum >= wp->w_topline
665 && lnum < wp->w_botline) {
666 if (wp->w_redraw_top == 0 || wp->w_redraw_top > lnum) {
667 wp->w_redraw_top = lnum;
668 }
669 if (wp->w_redraw_bot == 0 || wp->w_redraw_bot < lnum) {
670 wp->w_redraw_bot = lnum;
671 }
672 redraw_win_later(wp, VALID10);
673 }
674 } else {
675 redraw_win_later(wp, VALID10);
676 }
677 if (wp->w_redr_type != 0) {
678 doit = TRUE1;
679 }
680 }
681
682 /* Return when there is nothing to do, screen updating is already
683 * happening (recursive call) or still starting up. */
684 if (!doit || updating_screen || starting) {
685 return;
686 }
687
688 /* update all windows that need updating */
689 update_prepare();
690
691 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
692 if (wp->w_redr_type != 0) {
693 win_update(wp);
694 }
695 if (wp->w_redr_status) {
696 win_redr_status(wp);
697 }
698 }
699
700 update_finish();
701}
702
703/*
704 * Return TRUE when window "wp" has a column to draw signs in.
705 */
706static int draw_signcolumn(win_T *wp)
707{
708 return (wp->w_buffer->b_signlist != NULL((void*)0));
709}
710
711
712/*
713 * Update a single window.
714 *
715 * This may cause the windows below it also to be redrawn (when clearing the
716 * screen or scrolling lines).
717 *
718 * How the window is redrawn depends on wp->w_redr_type. Each type also
719 * implies the one below it.
720 * NOT_VALID redraw the whole window
721 * SOME_VALID redraw the whole window but do scroll when possible
722 * REDRAW_TOP redraw the top w_upd_rows window lines, otherwise like VALID
723 * INVERTED redraw the changed part of the Visual area
724 * INVERTED_ALL redraw the whole Visual area
725 * VALID 1. scroll up/down to adjust for a changed w_topline
726 * 2. update lines at the top when scrolled down
727 * 3. redraw changed text:
728 * - if wp->w_buffer->b_mod_set set, update lines between
729 * b_mod_top and b_mod_bot.
730 * - if wp->w_redraw_top non-zero, redraw lines between
731 * wp->w_redraw_top and wp->w_redr_bot.
732 * - continue redrawing when syntax status is invalid.
733 * 4. if scrolled up, update lines at the bottom.
734 * This results in three areas that may need updating:
735 * top: from first row to top_end (when scrolled down)
736 * mid: from mid_start to mid_end (update inversion or changed text)
737 * bot: from bot_start to last row (when scrolled up)
738 */
739static void win_update(win_T *wp)
740{
741 buf_T *buf = wp->w_buffer;
742 int type;
743 int top_end = 0; /* Below last row of the top area that needs
744 updating. 0 when no top area updating. */
745 int mid_start = 999; /* first row of the mid area that needs
746 updating. 999 when no mid area updating. */
747 int mid_end = 0; /* Below last row of the mid area that needs
748 updating. 0 when no mid area updating. */
749 int bot_start = 999; /* first row of the bot area that needs
750 updating. 999 when no bot area updating */
751 int scrolled_down = FALSE0; /* TRUE when scrolled down when
752 w_topline got smaller a bit */
753 matchitem_T *cur; /* points to the match list */
754 int top_to_mod = FALSE0; /* redraw above mod_top */
755
756 int row; /* current window row to display */
757 linenr_T lnum; /* current buffer lnum to display */
758 int idx; /* current index in w_lines[] */
759 int srow; /* starting row of the current line */
760
761 int eof = FALSE0; /* if TRUE, we hit the end of the file */
762 int didline = FALSE0; /* if TRUE, we finished the last line */
763 int i;
764 long j;
765 static int recursive = FALSE0; /* being called recursively */
766 int old_botline = wp->w_botline;
767 long fold_count;
768 /* remember what happened to the previous line, to know if
769 * check_visual_highlight() can be used */
770#define DID_NONE1 1 /* didn't update a line */
771#define DID_LINE2 2 /* updated a normal line */
772#define DID_FOLD3 3 /* updated a folded line */
773 int did_update = DID_NONE1;
774 linenr_T syntax_last_parsed = 0; /* last parsed text line */
775 linenr_T mod_top = 0;
776 linenr_T mod_bot = 0;
777 int save_got_int;
778
779 type = wp->w_redr_type;
780
781 if (type == NOT_VALID40) {
782 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
783 wp->w_lines_valid = 0;
784 }
785
786 /* Window is zero-height: nothing to draw. */
787 if (wp->w_height == 0) {
788 wp->w_redr_type = 0;
789 return;
790 }
791
792 /* Window is zero-width: Only need to draw the separator. */
793 if (wp->w_width == 0) {
794 /* draw the vertical separator right of this window */
795 draw_vsep_win(wp, 0);
796 wp->w_redr_type = 0;
797 return;
798 }
799
800 init_search_hl(wp);
801
802 /* Force redraw when width of 'number' or 'relativenumber' column
803 * changes. */
804 i = (wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu || wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu) ? number_width(wp) : 0;
805 if (wp->w_nrwidth != i) {
806 type = NOT_VALID40;
807 wp->w_nrwidth = i;
808 } else if (buf->b_mod_set && buf->b_mod_xlines != 0 && wp->w_redraw_top != 0) {
809 /*
810 * When there are both inserted/deleted lines and specific lines to be
811 * redrawn, w_redraw_top and w_redraw_bot may be invalid, just redraw
812 * everything (only happens when redrawing is off for while).
813 */
814 type = NOT_VALID40;
815 } else {
816 /*
817 * Set mod_top to the first line that needs displaying because of
818 * changes. Set mod_bot to the first line after the changes.
819 */
820 mod_top = wp->w_redraw_top;
821 if (wp->w_redraw_bot != 0)
822 mod_bot = wp->w_redraw_bot + 1;
823 else
824 mod_bot = 0;
825 wp->w_redraw_top = 0; /* reset for next time */
826 wp->w_redraw_bot = 0;
827 if (buf->b_mod_set) {
828 if (mod_top == 0 || mod_top > buf->b_mod_top) {
829 mod_top = buf->b_mod_top;
830 /* Need to redraw lines above the change that may be included
831 * in a pattern match. */
832 if (syntax_present(wp)) {
833 mod_top -= buf->b_s.b_syn_sync_linebreaks;
834 if (mod_top < 1)
835 mod_top = 1;
836 }
837 }
838 if (mod_bot == 0 || mod_bot < buf->b_mod_bot)
839 mod_bot = buf->b_mod_bot;
840
841 /* When 'hlsearch' is on and using a multi-line search pattern, a
842 * change in one line may make the Search highlighting in a
843 * previous line invalid. Simple solution: redraw all visible
844 * lines above the change.
845 * Same for a match pattern.
846 */
847 if (search_hl.rm.regprog != NULL((void*)0)
848 && re_multiline(search_hl.rm.regprog))
849 top_to_mod = TRUE1;
850 else {
851 cur = wp->w_match_head;
852 while (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
853 if (cur->match.regprog != NULL((void*)0)
854 && re_multiline(cur->match.regprog)) {
855 top_to_mod = TRUE1;
856 break;
857 }
858 cur = cur->next;
859 }
860 }
861 }
862 if (mod_top != 0 && hasAnyFolding(wp)) {
863 linenr_T lnumt, lnumb;
864
865 /*
866 * A change in a line can cause lines above it to become folded or
867 * unfolded. Find the top most buffer line that may be affected.
868 * If the line was previously folded and displayed, get the first
869 * line of that fold. If the line is folded now, get the first
870 * folded line. Use the minimum of these two.
871 */
872
873 /* Find last valid w_lines[] entry above mod_top. Set lnumt to
874 * the line below it. If there is no valid entry, use w_topline.
875 * Find the first valid w_lines[] entry below mod_bot. Set lnumb
876 * to this line. If there is no valid entry, use MAXLNUM. */
877 lnumt = wp->w_topline;
878 lnumb = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
879 for (i = 0; i < wp->w_lines_valid; ++i)
880 if (wp->w_lines[i].wl_valid) {
881 if (wp->w_lines[i].wl_lastlnum < mod_top)
882 lnumt = wp->w_lines[i].wl_lastlnum + 1;
883 if (lnumb == MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL) && wp->w_lines[i].wl_lnum >= mod_bot) {
884 lnumb = wp->w_lines[i].wl_lnum;
885 /* When there is a fold column it might need updating
886 * in the next line ("J" just above an open fold). */
887 if (wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc > 0)
888 ++lnumb;
889 }
890 }
891
892 (void)hasFoldingWin(wp, mod_top, &mod_top, NULL((void*)0), TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
893 if (mod_top > lnumt)
894 mod_top = lnumt;
895
896 /* Now do the same for the bottom line (one above mod_bot). */
897 --mod_bot;
898 (void)hasFoldingWin(wp, mod_bot, NULL((void*)0), &mod_bot, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
899 ++mod_bot;
900 if (mod_bot < lnumb)
901 mod_bot = lnumb;
902 }
903
904 /* When a change starts above w_topline and the end is below
905 * w_topline, start redrawing at w_topline.
906 * If the end of the change is above w_topline: do like no change was
907 * made, but redraw the first line to find changes in syntax. */
908 if (mod_top != 0 && mod_top < wp->w_topline) {
909 if (mod_bot > wp->w_topline)
910 mod_top = wp->w_topline;
911 else if (syntax_present(wp))
912 top_end = 1;
913 }
914
915 /* When line numbers are displayed need to redraw all lines below
916 * inserted/deleted lines. */
917 if (mod_top != 0 && buf->b_mod_xlines != 0 && wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu)
918 mod_bot = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
919 }
920
921 /*
922 * When only displaying the lines at the top, set top_end. Used when
923 * window has scrolled down for msg_scrolled.
924 */
925 if (type == REDRAW_TOP30) {
926 j = 0;
927 for (i = 0; i < wp->w_lines_valid; ++i) {
928 j += wp->w_lines[i].wl_size;
929 if (j >= wp->w_upd_rows) {
930 top_end = j;
931 break;
932 }
933 }
934 if (top_end == 0)
935 /* not found (cannot happen?): redraw everything */
936 type = NOT_VALID40;
937 else
938 /* top area defined, the rest is VALID */
939 type = VALID10;
940 }
941
942 /* Trick: we want to avoid clearing the screen twice. screenclear() will
943 * set "screen_cleared" to TRUE. The special value MAYBE (which is still
944 * non-zero and thus not FALSE) will indicate that screenclear() was not
945 * called. */
946 if (screen_cleared)
947 screen_cleared = MAYBE2;
948
949 /*
950 * If there are no changes on the screen that require a complete redraw,
951 * handle three cases:
952 * 1: we are off the top of the screen by a few lines: scroll down
953 * 2: wp->w_topline is below wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum: may scroll up
954 * 3: wp->w_topline is wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum: find first entry in
955 * w_lines[] that needs updating.
956 */
957 if ((type == VALID10 || type == SOME_VALID35
958 || type == INVERTED20 || type == INVERTED_ALL25)
959 && !wp->w_botfill && !wp->w_old_botfill
960 ) {
961 if (mod_top != 0 && wp->w_topline == mod_top) {
962 /*
963 * w_topline is the first changed line, the scrolling will be done
964 * further down.
965 */
966 } else if (wp->w_lines[0].wl_valid
967 && (wp->w_topline < wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum
968 || (wp->w_topline == wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum
969 && wp->w_topfill > wp->w_old_topfill)
970 )) {
971 /*
972 * New topline is above old topline: May scroll down.
973 */
974 if (hasAnyFolding(wp)) {
975 linenr_T ln;
976
977 /* count the number of lines we are off, counting a sequence
978 * of folded lines as one */
979 j = 0;
980 for (ln = wp->w_topline; ln < wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum; ++ln) {
981 ++j;
982 if (j >= wp->w_height - 2)
983 break;
984 (void)hasFoldingWin(wp, ln, NULL((void*)0), &ln, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
985 }
986 } else
987 j = wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum - wp->w_topline;
988 if (j < wp->w_height - 2) { /* not too far off */
989 i = plines_m_win(wp, wp->w_topline, wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum - 1);
990 /* insert extra lines for previously invisible filler lines */
991 if (wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum != wp->w_topline)
992 i += diff_check_fill(wp, wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum)
993 - wp->w_old_topfill;
994 if (i < wp->w_height - 2) { /* less than a screen off */
995 /*
996 * Try to insert the correct number of lines.
997 * If not the last window, delete the lines at the bottom.
998 * win_ins_lines may fail when the terminal can't do it.
999 */
1000 if (i > 0)
1001 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
1002 if (win_ins_lines(wp, 0, i, FALSE0, wp == firstwin) == OK1) {
1003 if (wp->w_lines_valid != 0) {
1004 /* Need to update rows that are new, stop at the
1005 * first one that scrolled down. */
1006 top_end = i;
1007 scrolled_down = TRUE1;
1008
1009 /* Move the entries that were scrolled, disable
1010 * the entries for the lines to be redrawn. */
1011 if ((wp->w_lines_valid += j) > wp->w_height)
1012 wp->w_lines_valid = wp->w_height;
1013 for (idx = wp->w_lines_valid; idx - j >= 0; idx--)
1014 wp->w_lines[idx] = wp->w_lines[idx - j];
1015 while (idx >= 0)
1016 wp->w_lines[idx--].wl_valid = FALSE0;
1017 }
1018 } else
1019 mid_start = 0; /* redraw all lines */
1020 } else
1021 mid_start = 0; /* redraw all lines */
1022 } else
1023 mid_start = 0; /* redraw all lines */
1024 } else {
1025 /*
1026 * New topline is at or below old topline: May scroll up.
1027 * When topline didn't change, find first entry in w_lines[] that
1028 * needs updating.
1029 */
1030
1031 /* try to find wp->w_topline in wp->w_lines[].wl_lnum */
1032 j = -1;
1033 row = 0;
1034 for (i = 0; i < wp->w_lines_valid; i++) {
1035 if (wp->w_lines[i].wl_valid
1036 && wp->w_lines[i].wl_lnum == wp->w_topline) {
1037 j = i;
1038 break;
1039 }
1040 row += wp->w_lines[i].wl_size;
1041 }
1042 if (j == -1) {
1043 /* if wp->w_topline is not in wp->w_lines[].wl_lnum redraw all
1044 * lines */
1045 mid_start = 0;
1046 } else {
1047 /*
1048 * Try to delete the correct number of lines.
1049 * wp->w_topline is at wp->w_lines[i].wl_lnum.
1050 */
1051 /* If the topline didn't change, delete old filler lines,
1052 * otherwise delete filler lines of the new topline... */
1053 if (wp->w_lines[0].wl_lnum == wp->w_topline)
1054 row += wp->w_old_topfill;
1055 else
1056 row += diff_check_fill(wp, wp->w_topline);
1057 /* ... but don't delete new filler lines. */
1058 row -= wp->w_topfill;
1059 if (row > 0) {
1060 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
1061 if (win_del_lines(wp, 0, row, FALSE0, wp == firstwin) == OK1)
1062 bot_start = wp->w_height - row;
1063 else
1064 mid_start = 0; /* redraw all lines */
1065 }
1066 if ((row == 0 || bot_start < 999) && wp->w_lines_valid != 0) {
1067 /*
1068 * Skip the lines (below the deleted lines) that are still
1069 * valid and don't need redrawing. Copy their info
1070 * upwards, to compensate for the deleted lines. Set
1071 * bot_start to the first row that needs redrawing.
1072 */
1073 bot_start = 0;
1074 idx = 0;
1075 for (;; ) {
1076 wp->w_lines[idx] = wp->w_lines[j];
1077 /* stop at line that didn't fit, unless it is still
1078 * valid (no lines deleted) */
1079 if (row > 0 && bot_start + row
1080 + (int)wp->w_lines[j].wl_size > wp->w_height) {
1081 wp->w_lines_valid = idx + 1;
1082 break;
1083 }
1084 bot_start += wp->w_lines[idx++].wl_size;
1085
1086 /* stop at the last valid entry in w_lines[].wl_size */
1087 if (++j >= wp->w_lines_valid) {
1088 wp->w_lines_valid = idx;
1089 break;
1090 }
1091 }
1092 /* Correct the first entry for filler lines at the top
1093 * when it won't get updated below. */
1094 if (wp->w_p_diffw_onebuf_opt.wo_diff && bot_start > 0)
1095 wp->w_lines[0].wl_size =
1096 plines_win_nofill(wp, wp->w_topline, TRUE1)
1097 + wp->w_topfill;
1098 }
1099 }
1100 }
1101
1102 /* When starting redraw in the first line, redraw all lines. When
1103 * there is only one window it's probably faster to clear the screen
1104 * first. */
1105 if (mid_start == 0) {
1106 mid_end = wp->w_height;
1107 if (lastwin == firstwin) {
1108 /* Clear the screen when it was not done by win_del_lines() or
1109 * win_ins_lines() above, "screen_cleared" is FALSE or MAYBE
1110 * then. */
1111 if (screen_cleared != TRUE1)
1112 screenclear();
1113 /* The screen was cleared, redraw the tab pages line. */
1114 if (redraw_tabline)
1115 draw_tabline();
1116 }
1117 }
1118
1119 /* When win_del_lines() or win_ins_lines() caused the screen to be
1120 * cleared (only happens for the first window) or when screenclear()
1121 * was called directly above, "must_redraw" will have been set to
1122 * NOT_VALID, need to reset it here to avoid redrawing twice. */
1123 if (screen_cleared == TRUE1)
1124 must_redraw = 0;
1125 } else {
1126 /* Not VALID or INVERTED: redraw all lines. */
1127 mid_start = 0;
1128 mid_end = wp->w_height;
1129 }
1130
1131 if (type == SOME_VALID35) {
1132 /* SOME_VALID: redraw all lines. */
1133 mid_start = 0;
1134 mid_end = wp->w_height;
1135 type = NOT_VALID40;
1136 }
1137
1138 /* check if we are updating or removing the inverted part */
1139 if ((VIsual_active && buf == curwin->w_buffer)
1140 || (wp->w_old_cursor_lnum != 0 && type != NOT_VALID40)) {
1141 linenr_T from, to;
1142
1143 if (VIsual_active) {
1144 if (VIsual_active
1145 && (VIsual_mode != wp->w_old_visual_mode
1146 || type == INVERTED_ALL25)) {
1147 /*
1148 * If the type of Visual selection changed, redraw the whole
1149 * selection. Also when the ownership of the X selection is
1150 * gained or lost.
1151 */
1152 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum < VIsual.lnum) {
1153 from = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
1154 to = VIsual.lnum;
1155 } else {
1156 from = VIsual.lnum;
1157 to = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
1158 }
1159 /* redraw more when the cursor moved as well */
1160 if (wp->w_old_cursor_lnum < from)
1161 from = wp->w_old_cursor_lnum;
1162 if (wp->w_old_cursor_lnum > to)
1163 to = wp->w_old_cursor_lnum;
1164 if (wp->w_old_visual_lnum < from)
1165 from = wp->w_old_visual_lnum;
1166 if (wp->w_old_visual_lnum > to)
1167 to = wp->w_old_visual_lnum;
1168 } else {
1169 /*
1170 * Find the line numbers that need to be updated: The lines
1171 * between the old cursor position and the current cursor
1172 * position. Also check if the Visual position changed.
1173 */
1174 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum < wp->w_old_cursor_lnum) {
1175 from = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
1176 to = wp->w_old_cursor_lnum;
1177 } else {
1178 from = wp->w_old_cursor_lnum;
1179 to = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
1180 if (from == 0) /* Visual mode just started */
1181 from = to;
1182 }
1183
1184 if (VIsual.lnum != wp->w_old_visual_lnum
1185 || VIsual.col != wp->w_old_visual_col) {
1186 if (wp->w_old_visual_lnum < from
1187 && wp->w_old_visual_lnum != 0)
1188 from = wp->w_old_visual_lnum;
1189 if (wp->w_old_visual_lnum > to)
1190 to = wp->w_old_visual_lnum;
1191 if (VIsual.lnum < from)
1192 from = VIsual.lnum;
1193 if (VIsual.lnum > to)
1194 to = VIsual.lnum;
1195 }
1196 }
1197
1198 /*
1199 * If in block mode and changed column or curwin->w_curswant:
1200 * update all lines.
1201 * First compute the actual start and end column.
1202 */
1203 if (VIsual_mode == Ctrl_V22) {
1204 colnr_T fromc, toc;
1205
1206 getvcols(wp, &VIsual, &curwin->w_cursor, &fromc, &toc);
1207 ++toc;
1208 if (curwin->w_curswant == MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL))
1209 toc = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
1210
1211 if (fromc != wp->w_old_cursor_fcol
1212 || toc != wp->w_old_cursor_lcol) {
1213 if (from > VIsual.lnum)
1214 from = VIsual.lnum;
1215 if (to < VIsual.lnum)
1216 to = VIsual.lnum;
1217 }
1218 wp->w_old_cursor_fcol = fromc;
1219 wp->w_old_cursor_lcol = toc;
1220 }
1221 } else {
1222 /* Use the line numbers of the old Visual area. */
1223 if (wp->w_old_cursor_lnum < wp->w_old_visual_lnum) {
1224 from = wp->w_old_cursor_lnum;
1225 to = wp->w_old_visual_lnum;
1226 } else {
1227 from = wp->w_old_visual_lnum;
1228 to = wp->w_old_cursor_lnum;
1229 }
1230 }
1231
1232 /*
1233 * There is no need to update lines above the top of the window.
1234 */
1235 if (from < wp->w_topline)
1236 from = wp->w_topline;
1237
1238 /*
1239 * If we know the value of w_botline, use it to restrict the update to
1240 * the lines that are visible in the window.
1241 */
1242 if (wp->w_valid & VALID_BOTLINE0x20) {
1243 if (from >= wp->w_botline)
1244 from = wp->w_botline - 1;
1245 if (to >= wp->w_botline)
1246 to = wp->w_botline - 1;
1247 }
1248
1249 /*
1250 * Find the minimal part to be updated.
1251 * Watch out for scrolling that made entries in w_lines[] invalid.
1252 * E.g., CTRL-U makes the first half of w_lines[] invalid and sets
1253 * top_end; need to redraw from top_end to the "to" line.
1254 * A middle mouse click with a Visual selection may change the text
1255 * above the Visual area and reset wl_valid, do count these for
1256 * mid_end (in srow).
1257 */
1258 if (mid_start > 0) {
1259 lnum = wp->w_topline;
1260 idx = 0;
1261 srow = 0;
1262 if (scrolled_down)
1263 mid_start = top_end;
1264 else
1265 mid_start = 0;
1266 while (lnum < from && idx < wp->w_lines_valid) { /* find start */
1267 if (wp->w_lines[idx].wl_valid)
1268 mid_start += wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size;
1269 else if (!scrolled_down)
1270 srow += wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size;
1271 ++idx;
1272 if (idx < wp->w_lines_valid && wp->w_lines[idx].wl_valid)
1273 lnum = wp->w_lines[idx].wl_lnum;
1274 else
1275 ++lnum;
1276 }
1277 srow += mid_start;
1278 mid_end = wp->w_height;
1279 for (; idx < wp->w_lines_valid; ++idx) { /* find end */
1280 if (wp->w_lines[idx].wl_valid
1281 && wp->w_lines[idx].wl_lnum >= to + 1) {
1282 /* Only update until first row of this line */
1283 mid_end = srow;
1284 break;
1285 }
1286 srow += wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size;
1287 }
1288 }
1289 }
1290
1291 if (VIsual_active && buf == curwin->w_buffer) {
1292 wp->w_old_visual_mode = VIsual_mode;
1293 wp->w_old_cursor_lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
1294 wp->w_old_visual_lnum = VIsual.lnum;
1295 wp->w_old_visual_col = VIsual.col;
1296 wp->w_old_curswant = curwin->w_curswant;
1297 } else {
1298 wp->w_old_visual_mode = 0;
1299 wp->w_old_cursor_lnum = 0;
1300 wp->w_old_visual_lnum = 0;
1301 wp->w_old_visual_col = 0;
1302 }
1303
1304 /* reset got_int, otherwise regexp won't work */
1305 save_got_int = got_int;
1306 got_int = 0;
1307 win_foldinfo.fi_level = 0;
1308
1309 /*
1310 * Update all the window rows.
1311 */
1312 idx = 0; /* first entry in w_lines[].wl_size */
1313 row = 0;
1314 srow = 0;
1315 lnum = wp->w_topline; /* first line shown in window */
1316 for (;; ) {
1317 /* stop updating when reached the end of the window (check for _past_
1318 * the end of the window is at the end of the loop) */
1319 if (row == wp->w_height) {
1320 didline = TRUE1;
1321 break;
1322 }
1323
1324 /* stop updating when hit the end of the file */
1325 if (lnum > buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
1326 eof = TRUE1;
1327 break;
1328 }
1329
1330 /* Remember the starting row of the line that is going to be dealt
1331 * with. It is used further down when the line doesn't fit. */
1332 srow = row;
1333
1334 /*
1335 * Update a line when it is in an area that needs updating, when it
1336 * has changes or w_lines[idx] is invalid.
1337 * bot_start may be halfway a wrapped line after using
1338 * win_del_lines(), check if the current line includes it.
1339 * When syntax folding is being used, the saved syntax states will
1340 * already have been updated, we can't see where the syntax state is
1341 * the same again, just update until the end of the window.
1342 */
1343 if (row < top_end
1344 || (row >= mid_start && row < mid_end)
1345 || top_to_mod
1346 || idx >= wp->w_lines_valid
1347 || (row + wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size > bot_start)
1348 || (mod_top != 0
1349 && (lnum == mod_top
1350 || (lnum >= mod_top
1351 && (lnum < mod_bot
1352 || did_update == DID_FOLD3
1353 || (did_update == DID_LINE2
1354 && syntax_present(wp)
1355 && (
1356 (foldmethodIsSyntax(wp)
1357 && hasAnyFolding(wp)) ||
1358 syntax_check_changed(lnum)))
1359 // match in fixed position might need redraw
1360 // if lines were inserted or deleted
1361 || (wp->w_match_head != NULL((void*)0) && buf->b_mod_xlines != 0)
1362 ))))) {
1363 if (lnum == mod_top)
1364 top_to_mod = FALSE0;
1365
1366 /*
1367 * When at start of changed lines: May scroll following lines
1368 * up or down to minimize redrawing.
1369 * Don't do this when the change continues until the end.
1370 * Don't scroll when dollar_vcol >= 0, keep the "$".
1371 */
1372 if (lnum == mod_top
1373 && mod_bot != MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL)
1374 && !(dollar_vcol >= 0 && mod_bot == mod_top + 1)) {
1375 int old_rows = 0;
1376 int new_rows = 0;
1377 int xtra_rows;
1378 linenr_T l;
1379
1380 /* Count the old number of window rows, using w_lines[], which
1381 * should still contain the sizes for the lines as they are
1382 * currently displayed. */
1383 for (i = idx; i < wp->w_lines_valid; ++i) {
1384 /* Only valid lines have a meaningful wl_lnum. Invalid
1385 * lines are part of the changed area. */
1386 if (wp->w_lines[i].wl_valid
1387 && wp->w_lines[i].wl_lnum == mod_bot)
1388 break;
1389 old_rows += wp->w_lines[i].wl_size;
1390 if (wp->w_lines[i].wl_valid
1391 && wp->w_lines[i].wl_lastlnum + 1 == mod_bot) {
1392 /* Must have found the last valid entry above mod_bot.
1393 * Add following invalid entries. */
1394 ++i;
1395 while (i < wp->w_lines_valid
1396 && !wp->w_lines[i].wl_valid)
1397 old_rows += wp->w_lines[i++].wl_size;
1398 break;
1399 }
1400 }
1401
1402 if (i >= wp->w_lines_valid) {
1403 /* We can't find a valid line below the changed lines,
1404 * need to redraw until the end of the window.
1405 * Inserting/deleting lines has no use. */
1406 bot_start = 0;
1407 } else {
1408 /* Able to count old number of rows: Count new window
1409 * rows, and may insert/delete lines */
1410 j = idx;
1411 for (l = lnum; l < mod_bot; ++l) {
1412 if (hasFoldingWin(wp, l, NULL((void*)0), &l, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0)))
1413 ++new_rows;
1414 else if (l == wp->w_topline)
1415 new_rows += plines_win_nofill(wp, l, TRUE1)
1416 + wp->w_topfill;
1417 else
1418 new_rows += plines_win(wp, l, TRUE1);
1419 ++j;
1420 if (new_rows > wp->w_height - row - 2) {
1421 /* it's getting too much, must redraw the rest */
1422 new_rows = 9999;
1423 break;
1424 }
1425 }
1426 xtra_rows = new_rows - old_rows;
1427 if (xtra_rows < 0) {
1428 /* May scroll text up. If there is not enough
1429 * remaining text or scrolling fails, must redraw the
1430 * rest. If scrolling works, must redraw the text
1431 * below the scrolled text. */
1432 if (row - xtra_rows >= wp->w_height - 2)
1433 mod_bot = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
1434 else {
1435 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
1436 if (win_del_lines(wp, row,
1437 -xtra_rows, FALSE0, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
1438 mod_bot = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
1439 else
1440 bot_start = wp->w_height + xtra_rows;
1441 }
1442 } else if (xtra_rows > 0) {
1443 /* May scroll text down. If there is not enough
1444 * remaining text of scrolling fails, must redraw the
1445 * rest. */
1446 if (row + xtra_rows >= wp->w_height - 2)
1447 mod_bot = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
1448 else {
1449 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
1450 if (win_ins_lines(wp, row + old_rows,
1451 xtra_rows, FALSE0, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
1452 mod_bot = MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL);
1453 else if (top_end > row + old_rows)
1454 /* Scrolled the part at the top that requires
1455 * updating down. */
1456 top_end += xtra_rows;
1457 }
1458 }
1459
1460 /* When not updating the rest, may need to move w_lines[]
1461 * entries. */
1462 if (mod_bot != MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL) && i != j) {
1463 if (j < i) {
1464 int x = row + new_rows;
1465
1466 /* move entries in w_lines[] upwards */
1467 for (;; ) {
1468 /* stop at last valid entry in w_lines[] */
1469 if (i >= wp->w_lines_valid) {
1470 wp->w_lines_valid = j;
1471 break;
1472 }
1473 wp->w_lines[j] = wp->w_lines[i];
1474 /* stop at a line that won't fit */
1475 if (x + (int)wp->w_lines[j].wl_size
1476 > wp->w_height) {
1477 wp->w_lines_valid = j + 1;
1478 break;
1479 }
1480 x += wp->w_lines[j++].wl_size;
1481 ++i;
1482 }
1483 if (bot_start > x)
1484 bot_start = x;
1485 } else { /* j > i */
1486 /* move entries in w_lines[] downwards */
1487 j -= i;
1488 wp->w_lines_valid += j;
1489 if (wp->w_lines_valid > wp->w_height)
1490 wp->w_lines_valid = wp->w_height;
1491 for (i = wp->w_lines_valid; i - j >= idx; --i)
1492 wp->w_lines[i] = wp->w_lines[i - j];
1493
1494 /* The w_lines[] entries for inserted lines are
1495 * now invalid, but wl_size may be used above.
1496 * Reset to zero. */
1497 while (i >= idx) {
1498 wp->w_lines[i].wl_size = 0;
1499 wp->w_lines[i--].wl_valid = FALSE0;
1500 }
1501 }
1502 }
1503 }
1504 }
1505
1506 /*
1507 * When lines are folded, display one line for all of them.
1508 * Otherwise, display normally (can be several display lines when
1509 * 'wrap' is on).
1510 */
1511 fold_count = foldedCount(wp, lnum, &win_foldinfo);
1512 if (fold_count != 0) {
1513 fold_line(wp, fold_count, &win_foldinfo, lnum, row);
1514 ++row;
1515 --fold_count;
1516 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_folded = TRUE1;
1517 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_lastlnum = lnum + fold_count;
1518 did_update = DID_FOLD3;
1519 } else if (idx < wp->w_lines_valid
1520 && wp->w_lines[idx].wl_valid
1521 && wp->w_lines[idx].wl_lnum == lnum
1522 && lnum > wp->w_topline
1523 && !(dy_flags & DY_LASTLINE0x001)
1524 && srow + wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size > wp->w_height
1525 && diff_check_fill(wp, lnum) == 0
1526 ) {
1527 /* This line is not going to fit. Don't draw anything here,
1528 * will draw "@ " lines below. */
1529 row = wp->w_height + 1;
1530 } else {
1531 prepare_search_hl(wp, lnum);
1532 /* Let the syntax stuff know we skipped a few lines. */
1533 if (syntax_last_parsed != 0 && syntax_last_parsed + 1 < lnum
1534 && syntax_present(wp))
1535 syntax_end_parsing(syntax_last_parsed + 1);
1536
1537 /*
1538 * Display one line.
1539 */
1540 row = win_line(wp, lnum, srow, wp->w_height, mod_top == 0);
1541
1542 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_folded = FALSE0;
1543 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_lastlnum = lnum;
1544 did_update = DID_LINE2;
1545 syntax_last_parsed = lnum;
1546 }
1547
1548 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_lnum = lnum;
1549 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_valid = TRUE1;
1550 if (row > wp->w_height) { /* past end of screen */
1551 /* we may need the size of that too long line later on */
1552 if (dollar_vcol == -1)
1553 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size = plines_win(wp, lnum, TRUE1);
1554 ++idx;
1555 break;
1556 }
1557 if (dollar_vcol == -1)
1558 wp->w_lines[idx].wl_size = row - srow;
1559 ++idx;
1560 lnum += fold_count + 1;
1561 } else {
1562 /* This line does not need updating, advance to the next one */
1563 row += wp->w_lines[idx++].wl_size;
1564 if (row > wp->w_height) /* past end of screen */
1565 break;
1566 lnum = wp->w_lines[idx - 1].wl_lastlnum + 1;
1567 did_update = DID_NONE1;
1568 }
1569
1570 if (lnum > buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
1571 eof = TRUE1;
1572 break;
1573 }
1574 }
1575 /*
1576 * End of loop over all window lines.
1577 */
1578
1579
1580 if (idx > wp->w_lines_valid)
1581 wp->w_lines_valid = idx;
1582
1583 /*
1584 * Let the syntax stuff know we stop parsing here.
1585 */
1586 if (syntax_last_parsed != 0 && syntax_present(wp))
1587 syntax_end_parsing(syntax_last_parsed + 1);
1588
1589 /*
1590 * If we didn't hit the end of the file, and we didn't finish the last
1591 * line we were working on, then the line didn't fit.
1592 */
1593 wp->w_empty_rows = 0;
1594 wp->w_filler_rows = 0;
1595 if (!eof && !didline) {
1596 if (lnum == wp->w_topline) {
1597 /*
1598 * Single line that does not fit!
1599 * Don't overwrite it, it can be edited.
1600 */
1601 wp->w_botline = lnum + 1;
1602 } else if (diff_check_fill(wp, lnum) >= wp->w_height - srow) {
1603 /* Window ends in filler lines. */
1604 wp->w_botline = lnum;
1605 wp->w_filler_rows = wp->w_height - srow;
1606 } else if (dy_flags & DY_LASTLINE0x001) { /* 'display' has "lastline" */
1607 /*
1608 * Last line isn't finished: Display "@@@" at the end.
1609 */
1610 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height - 1,
1611 wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height,
1612 (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - 3, (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width),
1613 '@', '@', hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)]);
1614 set_empty_rows(wp, srow);
1615 wp->w_botline = lnum;
1616 } else {
1617 win_draw_end(wp, '@', ' ', srow, wp->w_height, HLF_AT);
1618 wp->w_botline = lnum;
1619 }
1620 } else {
1621 draw_vsep_win(wp, row);
1622 if (eof) { /* we hit the end of the file */
1623 wp->w_botline = buf->b_ml.ml_line_count + 1;
1624 j = diff_check_fill(wp, wp->w_botline);
1625 if (j > 0 && !wp->w_botfill) {
1626 /*
1627 * Display filler lines at the end of the file
1628 */
1629 if (char2cells(fill_diff) > 1)
1630 i = '-';
1631 else
1632 i = fill_diff;
1633 if (row + j > wp->w_height)
1634 j = wp->w_height - row;
1635 win_draw_end(wp, i, i, row, row + (int)j, HLF_DED);
1636 row += j;
1637 }
1638 } else if (dollar_vcol == -1)
1639 wp->w_botline = lnum;
1640
1641 /* make sure the rest of the screen is blank */
1642 /* put '~'s on rows that aren't part of the file. */
1643 win_draw_end(wp, '~', ' ', row, wp->w_height, HLF_AT);
1644 }
1645
1646 /* Reset the type of redrawing required, the window has been updated. */
1647 wp->w_redr_type = 0;
1648 wp->w_old_topfill = wp->w_topfill;
1649 wp->w_old_botfill = wp->w_botfill;
1650
1651 if (dollar_vcol == -1) {
1652 /*
1653 * There is a trick with w_botline. If we invalidate it on each
1654 * change that might modify it, this will cause a lot of expensive
1655 * calls to plines() in update_topline() each time. Therefore the
1656 * value of w_botline is often approximated, and this value is used to
1657 * compute the value of w_topline. If the value of w_botline was
1658 * wrong, check that the value of w_topline is correct (cursor is on
1659 * the visible part of the text). If it's not, we need to redraw
1660 * again. Mostly this just means scrolling up a few lines, so it
1661 * doesn't look too bad. Only do this for the current window (where
1662 * changes are relevant).
1663 */
1664 wp->w_valid |= VALID_BOTLINE0x20;
1665 if (wp == curwin && wp->w_botline != old_botline && !recursive) {
1666 recursive = TRUE1;
1667 curwin->w_valid &= ~VALID_TOPLINE0x80;
1668 update_topline(); /* may invalidate w_botline again */
1669 if (must_redraw != 0) {
1670 /* Don't update for changes in buffer again. */
1671 i = curbuf->b_mod_set;
1672 curbuf->b_mod_set = FALSE0;
1673 win_update(curwin);
1674 must_redraw = 0;
1675 curbuf->b_mod_set = i;
1676 }
1677 recursive = FALSE0;
1678 }
1679 }
1680
1681 /* restore got_int, unless CTRL-C was hit while redrawing */
1682 if (!got_int)
1683 got_int = save_got_int;
1684}
1685
1686
1687/*
1688 * Clear the rest of the window and mark the unused lines with "c1". use "c2"
1689 * as the filler character.
1690 */
1691static void win_draw_end(win_T *wp, int c1, int c2, int row, int endrow, hlf_T hl)
1692{
1693 int n = 0;
1694# define FDC_OFFn n
1695
1696 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
1697 /* No check for cmdline window: should never be right-left. */
1698 n = wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc;
1699
1700 if (n > 0) {
1701 /* draw the fold column at the right */
1702 if (n > wp->w_width)
1703 n = wp->w_width;
1704 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1705 W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - n, (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width),
1706 ' ', ' ', hl_attr(HLF_FC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FC)]);
1707 }
1708
1709 if (draw_signcolumn(wp)) {
1710 int nn = n + 2;
1711
1712 /* draw the sign column left of the fold column */
1713 if (nn > wp->w_width) {
1714 nn = wp->w_width;
1715 }
1716 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1717 W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - nn, (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - n,
1718 ' ', ' ', hl_attr(HLF_SC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_SC)]);
1719 n = nn;
1720 }
1721
1722 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1723 wp->w_wincol, W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - 1 - FDC_OFFn,
1724 c2, c2, hl_attr(hl)highlight_attr[(int)(hl)]);
1725 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1726 W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - 1 - FDC_OFFn, W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) - FDC_OFFn,
1727 c1, c2, hl_attr(hl)highlight_attr[(int)(hl)]);
1728 } else {
1729 if (cmdwin_type != 0 && wp == curwin) {
1730 /* draw the cmdline character in the leftmost column */
1731 n = 1;
1732 if (n > wp->w_width)
1733 n = wp->w_width;
1734 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1735 wp->w_wincol, wp->w_wincol + n,
1736 cmdwin_type, ' ', hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)]);
1737 }
1738 if (wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc > 0) {
1739 int nn = n + wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc;
1740
1741 /* draw the fold column at the left */
1742 if (nn > wp->w_width)
1743 nn = wp->w_width;
1744 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1745 wp->w_wincol + n, wp->w_wincol + nn,
1746 ' ', ' ', hl_attr(HLF_FC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FC)]);
1747 n = nn;
1748 }
1749
1750 if (draw_signcolumn(wp))
1751 {
1752 int nn = n + 2;
1753
1754 /* draw the sign column after the fold column */
1755 if (nn > wp->w_width) {
1756 nn = wp->w_width;
1757 }
1758 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1759 wp->w_wincol + n, wp->w_wincol + nn,
1760 ' ', ' ', hl_attr(HLF_SC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_SC)]);
1761 n = nn;
1762 }
1763
1764 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + endrow,
1765 wp->w_wincol + FDC_OFFn, (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width),
1766 c1, c2, hl_attr(hl)highlight_attr[(int)(hl)]);
1767 }
1768 set_empty_rows(wp, row);
1769}
1770
1771
1772/*
1773 * Advance **color_cols and return TRUE when there are columns to draw.
1774 */
1775static int advance_color_col(int vcol, int **color_cols)
1776{
1777 while (**color_cols >= 0 && vcol > **color_cols)
1778 ++*color_cols;
1779 return **color_cols >= 0;
1780}
1781
1782/*
1783 * Display one folded line.
1784 */
1785static void fold_line(win_T *wp, long fold_count, foldinfo_T *foldinfo, linenr_T lnum, int row)
1786{
1787 char_u buf[51];
1788 pos_T *top, *bot;
1789 linenr_T lnume = lnum + fold_count - 1;
1790 int len;
1791 char_u *text;
1792 int fdc;
1793 int col;
1794 int txtcol;
1795 int off = (int)(current_ScreenLine - ScreenLines);
1796 int ri;
1797
1798 /* Build the fold line:
1799 * 1. Add the cmdwin_type for the command-line window
1800 * 2. Add the 'foldcolumn'
1801 * 3. Add the 'number' or 'relativenumber' column
1802 * 4. Compose the text
1803 * 5. Add the text
1804 * 6. set highlighting for the Visual area an other text
1805 */
1806 col = 0;
1807
1808 /*
1809 * 1. Add the cmdwin_type for the command-line window
1810 * Ignores 'rightleft', this window is never right-left.
1811 */
1812 if (cmdwin_type != 0 && wp == curwin) {
1813 ScreenLines[off] = cmdwin_type;
1814 ScreenAttrs[off] = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
1815 if (enc_utf8)
1816 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
1817 ++col;
1818 }
1819
1820 /*
1821 * 2. Add the 'foldcolumn'
1822 */
1823 fdc = wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc;
1824 if (fdc > wp->w_width - col)
1825 fdc = wp->w_width - col;
1826 if (fdc > 0) {
1827 fill_foldcolumn(buf, wp, TRUE1, lnum);
1828 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
1829 int i;
1830
1831 copy_text_attr(off + wp->w_width - fdc - col, buf, fdc,
1832 hl_attr(HLF_FC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FC)]);
1833 /* reverse the fold column */
1834 for (i = 0; i < fdc; ++i)
1835 ScreenLines[off + wp->w_width - i - 1 - col] = buf[i];
1836 } else
1837 copy_text_attr(off + col, buf, fdc, hl_attr(HLF_FC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FC)]);
1838 col += fdc;
1839 }
1840
1841# define RL_MEMSET(p, v, l)if (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) for (ri = 0; ri < l; ++ri) ScreenAttrs
[off + (wp->w_width - (p) - (l)) + ri] = v; else for (ri =
0; ri < l; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[off + (p) + ri] = v if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) \
1842 for (ri = 0; ri < l; ++ri) \
1843 ScreenAttrs[off + (wp->w_width - (p) - (l)) + ri] = v; \
1844 else \
1845 for (ri = 0; ri < l; ++ri) \
1846 ScreenAttrs[off + (p) + ri] = v
1847
1848 /* Set all attributes of the 'number' or 'relativenumber' column and the
1849 * text */
1850 RL_MEMSET(col, hl_attr(HLF_FL), wp->w_width - col)if (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) for (ri = 0; ri < wp->w_width
- col; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[off + (wp->w_width - (col) - (wp
->w_width - col)) + ri] = highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FL)]; else
for (ri = 0; ri < wp->w_width - col; ++ri) ScreenAttrs
[off + (col) + ri] = highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FL)];
1851
1852 /* If signs are being displayed, add two spaces. */
1853 if (draw_signcolumn(wp)) {
1854 len = wp->w_width - col;
1855 if (len > 0) {
1856 if (len > 2) {
1857 len = 2;
1858 }
1859 copy_text_attr(off + col, (char_u *)" ", len, hl_attr(HLF_FL)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FL)]);
1860 col += len;
1861 }
1862 }
1863
1864 /*
1865 * 3. Add the 'number' or 'relativenumber' column
1866 */
1867 if (wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu || wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu) {
1868 len = wp->w_width - col;
1869 if (len > 0) {
1870 int w = number_width(wp);
1871 long num;
1872 char *fmt = "%*ld ";
1873
1874 if (len > w + 1)
1875 len = w + 1;
1876
1877 if (wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu && !wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
1878 /* 'number' + 'norelativenumber' */
1879 num = (long)lnum;
1880 else {
1881 /* 'relativenumber', don't use negative numbers */
1882 num = labs((long)get_cursor_rel_lnum(wp, lnum));
1883 if (num == 0 && wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu && wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu) {
1884 /* 'number' + 'relativenumber': cursor line shows absolute
1885 * line number */
1886 num = lnum;
1887 fmt = "%-*ld ";
1888 }
1889 }
1890
1891 sprintf((char *)buf, fmt, w, num);
1892 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
1893 /* the line number isn't reversed */
1894 copy_text_attr(off + wp->w_width - len - col, buf, len,
1895 hl_attr(HLF_FL)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FL)]);
1896 else
1897 copy_text_attr(off + col, buf, len, hl_attr(HLF_FL)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FL)]);
1898 col += len;
1899 }
1900 }
1901
1902 /*
1903 * 4. Compose the folded-line string with 'foldtext', if set.
1904 */
1905 text = get_foldtext(wp, lnum, lnume, foldinfo, buf);
1906
1907 txtcol = col; /* remember where text starts */
1908
1909 /*
1910 * 5. move the text to current_ScreenLine. Fill up with "fill_fold".
1911 * Right-left text is put in columns 0 - number-col, normal text is put
1912 * in columns number-col - window-width.
1913 */
1914 if (has_mbyte) {
1915 int cells;
1916 int u8c, u8cc[MAX_MCO6];
1917 int i;
1918 int idx;
1919 int c_len;
1920 char_u *p;
1921 int prev_c = 0; /* previous Arabic character */
1922 int prev_c1 = 0; /* first composing char for prev_c */
1923
1924 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
1925 idx = off;
1926 else
1927 idx = off + col;
1928
1929 /* Store multibyte characters in ScreenLines[] et al. correctly. */
1930 for (p = text; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
1931 cells = (*mb_ptr2cells)(p);
1932 c_len = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
1933 if (col + cells > wp->w_width
1934 - (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? col : 0)
1935 )
1936 break;
1937 ScreenLines[idx] = *p;
1938 if (enc_utf8) {
1939 u8c = utfc_ptr2char(p, u8cc);
1940 if (*p < 0x80 && u8cc[0] == 0) {
1941 ScreenLinesUC[idx] = 0;
1942 prev_c = u8c;
1943 } else {
1944 if (p_arshape && !p_tbidi && arabic_char(u8c)) {
1945 /* Do Arabic shaping. */
1946 int pc, pc1, nc;
1947 int pcc[MAX_MCO6];
1948 int firstbyte = *p;
1949
1950 /* The idea of what is the previous and next
1951 * character depends on 'rightleft'. */
1952 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
1953 pc = prev_c;
1954 pc1 = prev_c1;
1955 nc = utf_ptr2char(p + c_len);
1956 prev_c1 = u8cc[0];
1957 } else {
1958 pc = utfc_ptr2char(p + c_len, pcc);
1959 nc = prev_c;
1960 pc1 = pcc[0];
1961 }
1962 prev_c = u8c;
1963
1964 u8c = arabic_shape(u8c, &firstbyte, &u8cc[0],
1965 pc, pc1, nc);
1966 ScreenLines[idx] = firstbyte;
1967 } else
1968 prev_c = u8c;
1969 /* Non-BMP character: display as ? or fullwidth ?. */
1970#ifdef UNICODE16
1971 if (u8c >= 0x10000)
1972 ScreenLinesUC[idx] = (cells == 2) ? 0xff1f : (int)'?';
1973 else
1974#endif
1975 ScreenLinesUC[idx] = u8c;
1976 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i) {
1977 ScreenLinesC[i][idx] = u8cc[i];
1978 if (u8cc[i] == 0)
1979 break;
1980 }
1981 }
1982 if (cells > 1)
1983 ScreenLines[idx + 1] = 0;
1984 } else if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && *p == 0x8e)
1985 /* double-byte single width character */
1986 ScreenLines2[idx] = p[1];
1987 else if (cells > 1)
1988 /* double-width character */
1989 ScreenLines[idx + 1] = p[1];
1990 col += cells;
1991 idx += cells;
1992 p += c_len;
1993 }
1994 } else {
1995 len = (int)STRLEN(text)strlen((char *)(text));
1996 if (len > wp->w_width - col)
1997 len = wp->w_width - col;
1998 if (len > 0) {
1999 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
2000 STRNCPY(current_ScreenLine, text, len)strncpy((char *)(current_ScreenLine), (char *)(text), (size_t
)(len));
2001 else
2002 STRNCPY(current_ScreenLine + col, text, len)strncpy((char *)(current_ScreenLine + col), (char *)(text), (
size_t)(len));
2003 col += len;
2004 }
2005 }
2006
2007 /* Fill the rest of the line with the fold filler */
2008 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
2009 col -= txtcol;
2010 while (col < wp->w_width
2011 - (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? txtcol : 0)
2012 ) {
2013 if (enc_utf8) {
2014 if (fill_fold >= 0x80) {
2015 ScreenLinesUC[off + col] = fill_fold;
2016 ScreenLinesC[0][off + col] = 0;
2017 } else
2018 ScreenLinesUC[off + col] = 0;
2019 }
2020 ScreenLines[off + col++] = fill_fold;
2021 }
2022
2023 if (text != buf)
2024 free(text);
2025
2026 /*
2027 * 6. set highlighting for the Visual area an other text.
2028 * If all folded lines are in the Visual area, highlight the line.
2029 */
2030 if (VIsual_active && wp->w_buffer == curwin->w_buffer) {
2031 if (ltoreq(curwin->w_cursor, VIsual)((((curwin->w_cursor).lnum != (VIsual).lnum) ? (curwin->
w_cursor).lnum < (VIsual).lnum : (curwin->w_cursor).col
!= (VIsual).col ? (curwin->w_cursor).col < (VIsual).col
: (curwin->w_cursor).coladd < (VIsual).coladd) || (((curwin
->w_cursor).lnum == (VIsual).lnum) && ((curwin->
w_cursor).col == (VIsual).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (VIsual).coladd)))) {
2032 /* Visual is after curwin->w_cursor */
2033 top = &curwin->w_cursor;
2034 bot = &VIsual;
2035 } else {
2036 /* Visual is before curwin->w_cursor */
2037 top = &VIsual;
2038 bot = &curwin->w_cursor;
2039 }
2040 if (lnum >= top->lnum
2041 && lnume <= bot->lnum
2042 && (VIsual_mode != 'v'
2043 || ((lnum > top->lnum
2044 || (lnum == top->lnum
2045 && top->col == 0))
2046 && (lnume < bot->lnum
2047 || (lnume == bot->lnum
2048 && (bot->col - (*p_sel == 'e'))
2049 >= (colnr_T)STRLEN(ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnume,strlen((char *)(ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnume, 0)))
2050 FALSE))strlen((char *)(ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnume, 0)))))))) {
2051 if (VIsual_mode == Ctrl_V22) {
2052 /* Visual block mode: highlight the chars part of the block */
2053 if (wp->w_old_cursor_fcol + txtcol < (colnr_T)wp->w_width) {
2054 if (wp->w_old_cursor_lcol != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
2055 && wp->w_old_cursor_lcol + txtcol
2056 < (colnr_T)wp->w_width)
2057 len = wp->w_old_cursor_lcol;
2058 else
2059 len = wp->w_width - txtcol;
2060 RL_MEMSET(wp->w_old_cursor_fcol + txtcol, hl_attr(HLF_V),if (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) for (ri = 0; ri < len - (int
)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[off + (wp->w_width
- (wp->w_old_cursor_fcol + txtcol) - (len - (int)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol
)) + ri] = highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_V)]; else for (ri = 0; ri
< len - (int)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[
off + (wp->w_old_cursor_fcol + txtcol) + ri] = highlight_attr
[(int)(HLF_V)]
2061 len - (int)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol)if (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) for (ri = 0; ri < len - (int
)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[off + (wp->w_width
- (wp->w_old_cursor_fcol + txtcol) - (len - (int)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol
)) + ri] = highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_V)]; else for (ri = 0; ri
< len - (int)wp->w_old_cursor_fcol; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[
off + (wp->w_old_cursor_fcol + txtcol) + ri] = highlight_attr
[(int)(HLF_V)];
2062 }
2063 } else {
2064 /* Set all attributes of the text */
2065 RL_MEMSET(txtcol, hl_attr(HLF_V), wp->w_width - txtcol)if (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) for (ri = 0; ri < wp->w_width
- txtcol; ++ri) ScreenAttrs[off + (wp->w_width - (txtcol)
- (wp->w_width - txtcol)) + ri] = highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_V
)]; else for (ri = 0; ri < wp->w_width - txtcol; ++ri) ScreenAttrs
[off + (txtcol) + ri] = highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_V)];
2066 }
2067 }
2068 }
2069
2070 /* Show 'cursorcolumn' in the fold line. */
2071 if (wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc) {
2072 txtcol += wp->w_virtcol;
2073 if (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap)
2074 txtcol -= wp->w_skipcol;
2075 else
2076 txtcol -= wp->w_leftcol;
2077 if (txtcol >= 0 && txtcol < wp->w_width)
2078 ScreenAttrs[off + txtcol] = hl_combine_attr(
2079 ScreenAttrs[off + txtcol], hl_attr(HLF_CUC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CUC)]);
2080 }
2081
2082 SCREEN_LINE(row + wp->w_winrow, wp->w_wincol, wp->w_width,screen_line((row + wp->w_winrow), (wp->w_wincol), (wp->
w_width), (wp->w_width), (0))
2083 wp->w_width, FALSE)screen_line((row + wp->w_winrow), (wp->w_wincol), (wp->
w_width), (wp->w_width), (0));
2084
2085 /*
2086 * Update w_cline_height and w_cline_folded if the cursor line was
2087 * updated (saves a call to plines() later).
2088 */
2089 if (wp == curwin
2090 && lnum <= curwin->w_cursor.lnum
2091 && lnume >= curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
2092 curwin->w_cline_row = row;
2093 curwin->w_cline_height = 1;
2094 curwin->w_cline_folded = TRUE1;
2095 curwin->w_valid |= (VALID_CHEIGHT0x08|VALID_CROW0x10);
2096 }
2097}
2098
2099/*
2100 * Copy "buf[len]" to ScreenLines["off"] and set attributes to "attr".
2101 */
2102static void copy_text_attr(int off, char_u *buf, int len, int attr)
2103{
2104 int i;
2105
2106 memmove(ScreenLines + off, buf, (size_t)len);
2107 if (enc_utf8)
2108 memset(ScreenLinesUC + off, 0, sizeof(u8char_T) * (size_t)len);
2109 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
2110 ScreenAttrs[off + i] = attr;
2111}
2112
2113/*
2114 * Fill the foldcolumn at "p" for window "wp".
2115 * Only to be called when 'foldcolumn' > 0.
2116 */
2117static void
2118fill_foldcolumn (
2119 char_u *p,
2120 win_T *wp,
2121 int closed, /* TRUE of FALSE */
2122 linenr_T lnum /* current line number */
2123)
2124{
2125 int i = 0;
2126 int level;
2127 int first_level;
2128 int empty;
2129
2130 /* Init to all spaces. */
2131 copy_spaces(p, (size_t)wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc);
2132
2133 level = win_foldinfo.fi_level;
2134 if (level > 0) {
2135 /* If there is only one column put more info in it. */
2136 empty = (wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc == 1) ? 0 : 1;
2137
2138 /* If the column is too narrow, we start at the lowest level that
2139 * fits and use numbers to indicated the depth. */
2140 first_level = level - wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc - closed + 1 + empty;
2141 if (first_level < 1)
2142 first_level = 1;
2143
2144 for (i = 0; i + empty < wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc; ++i) {
2145 if (win_foldinfo.fi_lnum == lnum
2146 && first_level + i >= win_foldinfo.fi_low_level)
2147 p[i] = '-';
2148 else if (first_level == 1)
2149 p[i] = '|';
2150 else if (first_level + i <= 9)
2151 p[i] = '0' + first_level + i;
2152 else
2153 p[i] = '>';
2154 if (first_level + i == level)
2155 break;
2156 }
2157 }
2158 if (closed)
2159 p[i >= wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc ? i - 1 : i] = '+';
2160}
2161
2162/*
2163 * Display line "lnum" of window 'wp' on the screen.
2164 * Start at row "startrow", stop when "endrow" is reached.
2165 * wp->w_virtcol needs to be valid.
2166 *
2167 * Return the number of last row the line occupies.
2168 */
2169static int
2170win_line (
2171 win_T *wp,
2172 linenr_T lnum,
2173 int startrow,
2174 int endrow,
2175 bool_Bool nochange /* not updating for changed text */
2176)
2177{
2178 int col; /* visual column on screen */
2179 unsigned off; /* offset in ScreenLines/ScreenAttrs */
2180 int c = 0; /* init for GCC */
2181 long vcol = 0; /* virtual column (for tabs) */
2182 long vcol_prev = -1; /* "vcol" of previous character */
2183 char_u *line; /* current line */
2184 char_u *ptr; /* current position in "line" */
2185 int row; /* row in the window, excl w_winrow */
2186 int screen_row; /* row on the screen, incl w_winrow */
2187
2188 char_u extra[18]; /* line number and 'fdc' must fit in here */
2189 int n_extra = 0; /* number of extra chars */
2190 char_u *p_extra = NULL((void*)0); /* string of extra chars, plus NUL */
2191 char_u *p_extra_free = NULL((void*)0); /* p_extra needs to be freed */
2192 int c_extra = NUL'\000'; /* extra chars, all the same */
2193 int extra_attr = 0; /* attributes when n_extra != 0 */
2194 static char_u *at_end_str = (char_u *)""; /* used for p_extra when
2195 displaying lcs_eol at end-of-line */
2196 int lcs_eol_one = lcs_eol; /* lcs_eol until it's been used */
2197 int lcs_prec_todo = lcs_prec; /* lcs_prec until it's been used */
2198
2199 /* saved "extra" items for when draw_state becomes WL_LINE (again) */
2200 int saved_n_extra = 0;
2201 char_u *saved_p_extra = NULL((void*)0);
2202 int saved_c_extra = 0;
2203 int saved_char_attr = 0;
2204
2205 int n_attr = 0; /* chars with special attr */
2206 int saved_attr2 = 0; /* char_attr saved for n_attr */
2207 int n_attr3 = 0; /* chars with overruling special attr */
2208 int saved_attr3 = 0; /* char_attr saved for n_attr3 */
2209
2210 int n_skip = 0; /* nr of chars to skip for 'nowrap' */
2211
2212 int fromcol, tocol; /* start/end of inverting */
2213 int fromcol_prev = -2; /* start of inverting after cursor */
2214 int noinvcur = FALSE0; /* don't invert the cursor */
2215 pos_T *top, *bot;
2216 int lnum_in_visual_area = FALSE0;
2217 pos_T pos;
2218 long v;
2219
2220 int char_attr = 0; /* attributes for next character */
2221 int attr_pri = FALSE0; /* char_attr has priority */
2222 int area_highlighting = FALSE0; /* Visual or incsearch highlighting
2223 in this line */
2224 int attr = 0; /* attributes for area highlighting */
2225 int area_attr = 0; /* attributes desired by highlighting */
2226 int search_attr = 0; /* attributes desired by 'hlsearch' */
2227 int vcol_save_attr = 0; /* saved attr for 'cursorcolumn' */
2228 int syntax_attr = 0; /* attributes desired by syntax */
2229 int has_syntax = FALSE0; /* this buffer has syntax highl. */
2230 int save_did_emsg;
2231 int eol_hl_off = 0; /* 1 if highlighted char after EOL */
2232 int draw_color_col = FALSE0; /* highlight colorcolumn */
2233 int *color_cols = NULL((void*)0); /* pointer to according columns array */
2234 bool_Bool has_spell = false0; /* this buffer has spell checking */
2235# define SPWORDLEN150 150
2236 char_u nextline[SPWORDLEN150 * 2]; /* text with start of the next line */
2237 int nextlinecol = 0; /* column where nextline[] starts */
2238 int nextline_idx = 0; /* index in nextline[] where next line
2239 starts */
2240 int spell_attr = 0; /* attributes desired by spelling */
2241 int word_end = 0; /* last byte with same spell_attr */
2242 static linenr_T checked_lnum = 0; /* line number for "checked_col" */
2243 static int checked_col = 0; /* column in "checked_lnum" up to which
2244 * there are no spell errors */
2245 static int cap_col = -1; /* column to check for Cap word */
2246 static linenr_T capcol_lnum = 0; /* line number where "cap_col" used */
2247 int cur_checked_col = 0; /* checked column for current line */
2248 int extra_check; /* has syntax or linebreak */
2249 int multi_attr = 0; /* attributes desired by multibyte */
2250 int mb_l = 1; /* multi-byte byte length */
2251 int mb_c = 0; /* decoded multi-byte character */
2252 int mb_utf8 = FALSE0; /* screen char is UTF-8 char */
2253 int u8cc[MAX_MCO6]; /* composing UTF-8 chars */
2254 int filler_lines; /* nr of filler lines to be drawn */
2255 int filler_todo; /* nr of filler lines still to do + 1 */
2256 hlf_T diff_hlf = (hlf_T)0; /* type of diff highlighting */
2257 int change_start = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL); /* first col of changed area */
2258 int change_end = -1; /* last col of changed area */
2259 colnr_T trailcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL); /* start of trailing spaces */
2260 int need_showbreak = FALSE0;
2261 int line_attr = 0; /* attribute for the whole line */
2262 matchitem_T *cur; /* points to the match list */
2263 match_T *shl; /* points to search_hl or a match */
2264 int shl_flag; /* flag to indicate whether search_hl
2265 has been processed or not */
2266 int prevcol_hl_flag; /* flag to indicate whether prevcol
2267 equals startcol of search_hl or one
2268 of the matches */
2269 int prev_c = 0; /* previous Arabic character */
2270 int prev_c1 = 0; /* first composing char for prev_c */
2271 int did_line_attr = 0;
2272
2273 /* draw_state: items that are drawn in sequence: */
2274#define WL_START0 0 /* nothing done yet */
2275# define WL_CMDLINE0 + 1 WL_START0 + 1 /* cmdline window column */
2276# define WL_FOLD0 + 1 + 1 WL_CMDLINE0 + 1 + 1 /* 'foldcolumn' */
2277# define WL_SIGN0 + 1 + 1 + 1 WL_FOLD0 + 1 + 1 + 1 /* column for signs */
2278#define WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 WL_SIGN0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 /* line number */
2279# define WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 /* 'breakindent' */
2280# define WL_SBR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 /* 'showbreak' or 'diff' */
2281#define WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 WL_SBR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 /* text in the line */
2282 int draw_state = WL_START0; /* what to draw next */
2283
2284 int syntax_flags = 0;
2285 int syntax_seqnr = 0;
2286 int prev_syntax_id = 0;
2287 int conceal_attr = hl_attr(HLF_CONCEAL)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CONCEAL)];
2288 int is_concealing = FALSE0;
2289 int boguscols = 0; /* nonexistent columns added to force
2290 wrapping */
2291 int vcol_off = 0; /* offset for concealed characters */
2292 int did_wcol = FALSE0;
2293# define VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) (vcol - vcol_off)
2294# define FIX_FOR_BOGUSCOLS{ n_extra += vcol_off; vcol -= vcol_off; vcol_off = 0; col -=
boguscols; boguscols = 0; } \
2295 { \
2296 n_extra += vcol_off; \
2297 vcol -= vcol_off; \
2298 vcol_off = 0; \
2299 col -= boguscols; \
2300 boguscols = 0; \
2301 }
2302
2303 if (startrow > endrow) /* past the end already! */
2304 return startrow;
2305
2306 row = startrow;
2307 screen_row = row + wp->w_winrow;
2308
2309 /*
2310 * To speed up the loop below, set extra_check when there is linebreak,
2311 * trailing white space and/or syntax processing to be done.
2312 */
2313 extra_check = wp->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr;
2314 if (syntax_present(wp) && !wp->w_s->b_syn_error) {
2315 /* Prepare for syntax highlighting in this line. When there is an
2316 * error, stop syntax highlighting. */
2317 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
2318 did_emsg = FALSE0;
2319 syntax_start(wp, lnum);
2320 if (did_emsg)
2321 wp->w_s->b_syn_error = TRUE1;
2322 else {
2323 did_emsg = save_did_emsg;
2324 has_syntax = TRUE1;
2325 extra_check = TRUE1;
2326 }
2327 }
2328
2329 /* Check for columns to display for 'colorcolumn'. */
2330 color_cols = wp->w_p_cc_cols;
2331 if (color_cols != NULL((void*)0))
2332 draw_color_col = advance_color_col(VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off), &color_cols);
2333
2334 if (wp->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell
2335 && *wp->w_s->b_p_spl != NUL'\000'
2336 && !GA_EMPTY(&wp->w_s->b_langp)((&wp->w_s->b_langp)->ga_len <= 0)
2337 && *(char **)(wp->w_s->b_langp.ga_data) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2338 /* Prepare for spell checking. */
2339 has_spell = true1;
2340 extra_check = TRUE1;
2341
2342 /* Get the start of the next line, so that words that wrap to the next
2343 * line are found too: "et<line-break>al.".
2344 * Trick: skip a few chars for C/shell/Vim comments */
2345 nextline[SPWORDLEN150] = NUL'\000';
2346 if (lnum < wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
2347 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum + 1, FALSE0);
2348 spell_cat_line(nextline + SPWORDLEN150, line, SPWORDLEN150);
2349 }
2350
2351 /* When a word wrapped from the previous line the start of the current
2352 * line is valid. */
2353 if (lnum == checked_lnum)
2354 cur_checked_col = checked_col;
2355 checked_lnum = 0;
2356
2357 /* When there was a sentence end in the previous line may require a
2358 * word starting with capital in this line. In line 1 always check
2359 * the first word. */
2360 if (lnum != capcol_lnum)
2361 cap_col = -1;
2362 if (lnum == 1)
2363 cap_col = 0;
2364 capcol_lnum = 0;
2365 }
2366
2367 /*
2368 * handle visual active in this window
2369 */
2370 fromcol = -10;
2371 tocol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2372 if (VIsual_active && wp->w_buffer == curwin->w_buffer) {
2373 /* Visual is after curwin->w_cursor */
2374 if (ltoreq(curwin->w_cursor, VIsual)((((curwin->w_cursor).lnum != (VIsual).lnum) ? (curwin->
w_cursor).lnum < (VIsual).lnum : (curwin->w_cursor).col
!= (VIsual).col ? (curwin->w_cursor).col < (VIsual).col
: (curwin->w_cursor).coladd < (VIsual).coladd) || (((curwin
->w_cursor).lnum == (VIsual).lnum) && ((curwin->
w_cursor).col == (VIsual).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (VIsual).coladd)))) {
2375 top = &curwin->w_cursor;
2376 bot = &VIsual;
2377 } else { /* Visual is before curwin->w_cursor */
2378 top = &VIsual;
2379 bot = &curwin->w_cursor;
2380 }
2381 lnum_in_visual_area = (lnum >= top->lnum && lnum <= bot->lnum);
2382 if (VIsual_mode == Ctrl_V22) { /* block mode */
2383 if (lnum_in_visual_area) {
2384 fromcol = wp->w_old_cursor_fcol;
2385 tocol = wp->w_old_cursor_lcol;
2386 }
2387 } else { /* non-block mode */
2388 if (lnum > top->lnum && lnum <= bot->lnum)
2389 fromcol = 0;
2390 else if (lnum == top->lnum) {
2391 if (VIsual_mode == 'V') /* linewise */
2392 fromcol = 0;
