2393 else {
2394 getvvcol(wp, top, (colnr_T *)&fromcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
2395 if (gchar_pos(top) == NUL'\000')
2396 tocol = fromcol + 1;
2397 }
2398 }
2399 if (VIsual_mode != 'V' && lnum == bot->lnum) {
2400 if (*p_sel == 'e' && bot->col == 0
2401 && bot->coladd == 0
2402 ) {
2403 fromcol = -10;
2404 tocol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2405 } else if (bot->col == MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL))
2406 tocol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2407 else {
2408 pos = *bot;
2409 if (*p_sel == 'e')
2410 getvvcol(wp, &pos, (colnr_T *)&tocol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
2411 else {
2412 getvvcol(wp, &pos, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), (colnr_T *)&tocol);
2413 ++tocol;
2414 }
2415 }
2416 }
2417 }
2418
2419 /* Check if the character under the cursor should not be inverted */
2420 if (!highlight_match && lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum && wp == curwin
2421 )
2422 noinvcur = TRUE1;
2423
2424 /* if inverting in this line set area_highlighting */
2425 if (fromcol >= 0) {
2426 area_highlighting = TRUE1;
2427 attr = hl_attr(HLF_V)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_V)];
2428 }
2429 }
2430 /*
2431 * handle 'incsearch' and ":s///c" highlighting
2432 */
2433 else if (highlight_match
2434 && wp == curwin
2435 && lnum >= curwin->w_cursor.lnum
2436 && lnum <= curwin->w_cursor.lnum + search_match_lines) {
2437 if (lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum)
2438 getvcol(curwin, &(curwin->w_cursor),
2439 (colnr_T *)&fromcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
2440 else
2441 fromcol = 0;
2442 if (lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum + search_match_lines) {
2443 pos.lnum = lnum;
2444 pos.col = search_match_endcol;
2445 getvcol(curwin, &pos, (colnr_T *)&tocol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
2446 } else
2447 tocol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2448 /* do at least one character; happens when past end of line */
2449 if (fromcol == tocol)
2450 tocol = fromcol + 1;
2451 area_highlighting = TRUE1;
2452 attr = hl_attr(HLF_I)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_I)];
2453 }
2454
2455 filler_lines = diff_check(wp, lnum);
2456 if (filler_lines < 0) {
2457 if (filler_lines == -1) {
2458 if (diff_find_change(wp, lnum, &change_start, &change_end))
2459 diff_hlf = HLF_ADD; /* added line */
2460 else if (change_start == 0)
2461 diff_hlf = HLF_TXD; /* changed text */
2462 else
2463 diff_hlf = HLF_CHD; /* changed line */
2464 } else
2465 diff_hlf = HLF_ADD; /* added line */
2466 filler_lines = 0;
2467 area_highlighting = TRUE1;
2468 }
2469 if (lnum == wp->w_topline)
2470 filler_lines = wp->w_topfill;
2471 filler_todo = filler_lines;
2472
2473 /* If this line has a sign with line highlighting set line_attr. */
2474 v = buf_getsigntype(wp->w_buffer, lnum, SIGN_LINEHL1);
2475 if (v != 0)
2476 line_attr = sign_get_attr((int)v, TRUE1);
2477
2478 /* Highlight the current line in the quickfix window. */
2479 if (bt_quickfix(wp->w_buffer) && qf_current_entry(wp) == lnum)
2480 line_attr = hl_attr(HLF_L)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_L)];
2481 if (line_attr != 0)
2482 area_highlighting = TRUE1;
2483
2484 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0);
2485 ptr = line;
2486
2487 if (has_spell) {
2488 /* For checking first word with a capital skip white space. */
2489 if (cap_col == 0)
2490 cap_col = (int)(skipwhite(line) - line);
2491
2492 /* To be able to spell-check over line boundaries copy the end of the
2493 * current line into nextline[]. Above the start of the next line was
2494 * copied to nextline[SPWORDLEN]. */
2495 if (nextline[SPWORDLEN150] == NUL'\000') {
2496 /* No next line or it is empty. */
2497 nextlinecol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2498 nextline_idx = 0;
2499 } else {
2500 v = (long)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line));
2501 if (v < SPWORDLEN150) {
2502 /* Short line, use it completely and append the start of the
2503 * next line. */
2504 nextlinecol = 0;
2505 memmove(nextline, line, (size_t)v);
2506 STRMOVE(nextline + v, nextline + SPWORDLEN)memmove((nextline + v), (nextline + 150), strlen((char *)(nextline
+ 150)) + 1);
2507 nextline_idx = v + 1;
2508 } else {
2509 /* Long line, use only the last SPWORDLEN bytes. */
2510 nextlinecol = v - SPWORDLEN150;
2511 memmove(nextline, line + nextlinecol, SPWORDLEN150);
2512 nextline_idx = SPWORDLEN150 + 1;
2513 }
2514 }
2515 }
2516
2517 /* find start of trailing whitespace */
2518 if (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && lcs_trail) {
2519 trailcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
2520 while (trailcol > (colnr_T)0 && vim_iswhite(ptr[trailcol - 1])((ptr[trailcol - 1]) == ' ' || (ptr[trailcol - 1]) == '\t'))
2521 --trailcol;
2522 trailcol += (colnr_T) (ptr - line);
2523 extra_check = TRUE1;
2524 }
2525
2526 /*
2527 * 'nowrap' or 'wrap' and a single line that doesn't fit: Advance to the
2528 * first character to be displayed.
2529 */
2530 if (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap)
2531 v = wp->w_skipcol;
2532 else
2533 v = wp->w_leftcol;
2534 if (v > 0) {
2535 char_u *prev_ptr = ptr;
2536 while (vcol < v && *ptr != NUL'\000') {
2537 c = win_lbr_chartabsize(wp, line, ptr, (colnr_T)vcol, NULL((void*)0));
2538 vcol += c;
2539 prev_ptr = ptr;
2540 mb_ptr_adv(ptr)ptr += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr) : 1;
2541 }
2542
2543 /* When:
2544 * - 'cuc' is set, or
2545 * - 'colorcolumn' is set, or
2546 * - 'virtualedit' is set, or
2547 * - the visual mode is active,
2548 * the end of the line may be before the start of the displayed part.
2549 */
2550 if (vcol < v && (
2551 wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc
2552 || draw_color_col
2553 ||
2554 virtual_active()
2555 ||
2556 (VIsual_active && wp->w_buffer == curwin->w_buffer)
2557 )) {
2558 vcol = v;
2559 }
2560
2561 /* Handle a character that's not completely on the screen: Put ptr at
2562 * that character but skip the first few screen characters. */
2563 if (vcol > v) {
2564 vcol -= c;
2565 ptr = prev_ptr;
2566 n_skip = v - vcol;
2567 }
2568
2569 /*
2570 * Adjust for when the inverted text is before the screen,
2571 * and when the start of the inverted text is before the screen.
2572 */
2573 if (tocol <= vcol)
2574 fromcol = 0;
2575 else if (fromcol >= 0 && fromcol < vcol)
2576 fromcol = vcol;
2577
2578 /* When w_skipcol is non-zero, first line needs 'showbreak' */
2579 if (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap)
2580 need_showbreak = TRUE1;
2581 /* When spell checking a word we need to figure out the start of the
2582 * word and if it's badly spelled or not. */
2583 if (has_spell) {
2584 int len;
2585 colnr_T linecol = (colnr_T)(ptr - line);
2586 hlf_T spell_hlf = HLF_COUNT;
2587
2588 pos = wp->w_cursor;
2589 wp->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
2590 wp->w_cursor.col = linecol;
2591 len = spell_move_to(wp, FORWARD1, TRUE1, TRUE1, &spell_hlf);
2592
2593 /* spell_move_to() may call ml_get() and make "line" invalid */
2594 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0);
2595 ptr = line + linecol;
2596
2597 if (len == 0 || (int)wp->w_cursor.col > ptr - line) {
2598 /* no bad word found at line start, don't check until end of a
2599 * word */
2600 spell_hlf = HLF_COUNT;
2601 word_end = (int)(spell_to_word_end(ptr, wp) - line + 1);
2602 } else {
2603 /* bad word found, use attributes until end of word */
2604 word_end = wp->w_cursor.col + len + 1;
2605
2606 /* Turn index into actual attributes. */
2607 if (spell_hlf != HLF_COUNT)
2608 spell_attr = highlight_attr[spell_hlf];
2609 }
2610 wp->w_cursor = pos;
2611
2612 /* Need to restart syntax highlighting for this line. */
2613 if (has_syntax)
2614 syntax_start(wp, lnum);
2615 }
2616 }
2617
2618 /*
2619 * Correct highlighting for cursor that can't be disabled.
2620 * Avoids having to check this for each character.
2621 */
2622 if (fromcol >= 0) {
2623 if (noinvcur) {
2624 if ((colnr_T)fromcol == wp->w_virtcol) {
2625 /* highlighting starts at cursor, let it start just after the
2626 * cursor */
2627 fromcol_prev = fromcol;
2628 fromcol = -1;
2629 } else if ((colnr_T)fromcol < wp->w_virtcol)
2630 /* restart highlighting after the cursor */
2631 fromcol_prev = wp->w_virtcol;
2632 }
2633 if (fromcol >= tocol)
2634 fromcol = -1;
2635 }
2636
2637 /*
2638 * Handle highlighting the last used search pattern and matches.
2639 * Do this for both search_hl and the match list.
2640 */
2641 cur = wp->w_match_head;
2642 shl_flag = FALSE0;
2643 while (cur != NULL((void*)0) || shl_flag == FALSE0) {
2644 if (shl_flag == FALSE0) {
2645 shl = &search_hl;
2646 shl_flag = TRUE1;
2647 } else
2648 shl = &cur->hl;
2649 shl->startcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2650 shl->endcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2651 shl->attr_cur = 0;
2652 v = (long)(ptr - line);
2653 if (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
2654 cur->pos.cur = 0;
2655 }
2656 next_search_hl(wp, shl, lnum, (colnr_T)v, cur);
2657
2658 // Need to get the line again, a multi-line regexp may have made it
2659 // invalid.
2660 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, false0);
2661 ptr = line + v;
2662
2663 if (shl->lnum != 0 && shl->lnum <= lnum) {
2664 if (shl->lnum == lnum) {
2665 shl->startcol = shl->rm.startpos[0].col;
2666 } else {
2667 shl->startcol = 0;
2668 }
2669 if (lnum == shl->lnum + shl->rm.endpos[0].lnum
2670 - shl->rm.startpos[0].lnum) {
2671 shl->endcol = shl->rm.endpos[0].col;
2672 } else {
2673 shl->endcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2674 }
2675 // Highlight one character for an empty match.
2676 if (shl->startcol == shl->endcol) {
2677 if (has_mbyte && line[shl->endcol] != NUL'\000') {
2678 shl->endcol += (*mb_ptr2len)(line + shl->endcol);
2679 } else {
2680 ++shl->endcol;
2681 }
2682 }
2683 if ((long)shl->startcol < v) { // match at leftcol
2684 shl->attr_cur = shl->attr;
2685 search_attr = shl->attr;
2686 }
2687 area_highlighting = true1;
2688 }
2689 if (shl != &search_hl && cur != NULL((void*)0))
2690 cur = cur->next;
2691 }
2692
2693 /* Cursor line highlighting for 'cursorline' in the current window. Not
2694 * when Visual mode is active, because it's not clear what is selected
2695 * then. */
2696 if (wp->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum
2697 && !(wp == curwin && VIsual_active)) {
2698 line_attr = hl_attr(HLF_CUL)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CUL)];
2699 area_highlighting = true1;
2700 }
2701
2702 off = (unsigned)(current_ScreenLine - ScreenLines);
2703 col = 0;
2704 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
2705 /* Rightleft window: process the text in the normal direction, but put
2706 * it in current_ScreenLine[] from right to left. Start at the
2707 * rightmost column of the window. */
2708 col = wp->w_width - 1;
2709 off += col;
2710 }
2711
2712 /*
2713 * Repeat for the whole displayed line.
2714 */
2715 for (;; ) {
2716 /* Skip this quickly when working on the text. */
2717 if (draw_state != WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1) {
2718 if (draw_state == WL_CMDLINE0 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2719 draw_state = WL_CMDLINE0 + 1;
2720 if (cmdwin_type != 0 && wp == curwin) {
2721 /* Draw the cmdline character. */
2722 n_extra = 1;
2723 c_extra = cmdwin_type;
2724 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
2725 }
2726 }
2727
2728 if (draw_state == WL_FOLD0 + 1 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2729 draw_state = WL_FOLD0 + 1 + 1;
2730 if (wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc > 0) {
2731 /* Draw the 'foldcolumn'. */
2732 fill_foldcolumn(extra, wp, FALSE0, lnum);
2733 n_extra = wp->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc;
2734 p_extra = extra;
2735 p_extra[n_extra] = NUL'\000';
2736 c_extra = NUL'\000';
2737 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_FC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_FC)];
2738 }
2739 }
2740
2741 //sign column
2742 if (draw_state == WL_SIGN0 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2743 draw_state = WL_SIGN0 + 1 + 1 + 1;
2744 /* Show the sign column when there are any signs in this
2745 * buffer or when using Netbeans. */
2746 if (draw_signcolumn(wp)) {
2747 int text_sign;
2748 /* Draw two cells with the sign value or blank. */
2749 c_extra = ' ';
2750 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_SC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_SC)];
2751 n_extra = 2;
2752
2753 if (row == startrow + filler_lines && filler_todo <= 0) {
2754 text_sign = buf_getsigntype(wp->w_buffer, lnum, SIGN_TEXT3);
2755 if (text_sign != 0) {
2756 p_extra = sign_get_text(text_sign);
2757 if (p_extra != NULL((void*)0)) {
2758 c_extra = NUL'\000';
2759 n_extra = (int)STRLEN(p_extra)strlen((char *)(p_extra));
2760 }
2761 char_attr = sign_get_attr(text_sign, FALSE0);
2762 }
2763 }
2764 }
2765 }
2766
2767 if (draw_state == WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2768 draw_state = WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1;
2769 /* Display the absolute or relative line number. After the
2770 * first fill with blanks when the 'n' flag isn't in 'cpo' */
2771 if ((wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu || wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
2772 && (row == startrow
2773 + filler_lines
2774 || vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_NUMCOL'n') == NULL((void*)0))) {
2775 /* Draw the line number (empty space after wrapping). */
2776 if (row == startrow
2777 + filler_lines
2778 ) {
2779 long num;
2780 char *fmt = "%*ld ";
2781
2782 if (wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu && !wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
2783 /* 'number' + 'norelativenumber' */
2784 num = (long)lnum;
2785 else {
2786 /* 'relativenumber', don't use negative numbers */
2787 num = labs((long)get_cursor_rel_lnum(wp, lnum));
2788 if (num == 0 && wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu && wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu) {
2789 /* 'number' + 'relativenumber' */
2790 num = lnum;
2791 fmt = "%-*ld ";
2792 }
2793 }
2794
2795 sprintf((char *)extra, fmt,
2796 number_width(wp), num);
2797 if (wp->w_skipcol > 0)
2798 for (p_extra = extra; *p_extra == ' '; ++p_extra)
2799 *p_extra = '-';
2800 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) /* reverse line numbers */
2801 rl_mirror(extra);
2802 p_extra = extra;
2803 c_extra = NUL'\000';
2804 } else
2805 c_extra = ' ';
2806 n_extra = number_width(wp) + 1;
2807 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_N)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_N)];
2808 /* When 'cursorline' is set highlight the line number of
2809 * the current line differently.
2810 * TODO: Can we use CursorLine instead of CursorLineNr
2811 * when CursorLineNr isn't set? */
2812 if ((wp->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul || wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
2813 && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum)
2814 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_CLN)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CLN)];
2815 }
2816 }
2817
2818 if (wp->w_p_brisbr && draw_state == WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1
2819 && n_extra == 0 && *p_sbr != NUL'\000') {
2820 // draw indent after showbreak value
2821 draw_state = WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1;
2822 } else if (wp->w_p_brisbr && draw_state == WL_SBR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2823 // after the showbreak, draw the breakindent
2824 draw_state = WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1;
2825 }
2826
2827 // draw 'breakindent': indent wrapped text accodringly
2828 if (draw_state == WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2829 draw_state = WL_BRI0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1;
2830 if (wp->w_p_briw_onebuf_opt.wo_bri && n_extra == 0 && row != startrow && filler_lines == 0) {
2831 char_attr = 0; // was: hl_attr(HLF_AT);
2832
2833 if (diff_hlf != (hlf_T)0)
2834 char_attr = hl_attr(diff_hlf)highlight_attr[(int)(diff_hlf)];
2835
2836 p_extra = NULL((void*)0);
2837 c_extra = ' ';
2838 n_extra = get_breakindent_win(wp, ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0));
2839 /* Correct end of highlighted area for 'breakindent',
2840 required wen 'linebreak' is also set. */
2841 if (tocol == vcol)
2842 tocol += n_extra;
2843 }
2844 }
2845
2846 if (draw_state == WL_SBR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2847 draw_state = WL_SBR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1;
2848 if (filler_todo > 0) {
2849 /* Draw "deleted" diff line(s). */
2850 if (char2cells(fill_diff) > 1)
2851 c_extra = '-';
2852 else
2853 c_extra = fill_diff;
2854 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
2855 n_extra = col + 1;
2856 else
2857 n_extra = wp->w_width - col;
2858 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_DED)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_DED)];
2859 }
2860 if (*p_sbr != NUL'\000' && need_showbreak) {
2861 /* Draw 'showbreak' at the start of each broken line. */
2862 p_extra = p_sbr;
2863 c_extra = NUL'\000';
2864 n_extra = (int)STRLEN(p_sbr)strlen((char *)(p_sbr));
2865 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
2866 need_showbreak = FALSE0;
2867 /* Correct end of highlighted area for 'showbreak',
2868 * required when 'linebreak' is also set. */
2869 if (tocol == vcol)
2870 tocol += n_extra;
2871 /* combine 'showbreak' with 'cursorline' */
2872 if (wp->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum)
2873 char_attr = hl_combine_attr(char_attr, HLF_CLN);
2874 }
2875 }
2876
2877 if (draw_state == WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 - 1 && n_extra == 0) {
2878 draw_state = WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1;
2879 if (saved_n_extra) {
2880 /* Continue item from end of wrapped line. */
2881 n_extra = saved_n_extra;
2882 c_extra = saved_c_extra;
2883 p_extra = saved_p_extra;
2884 char_attr = saved_char_attr;
2885 } else
2886 char_attr = 0;
2887 }
2888 }
2889
2890 /* When still displaying '$' of change command, stop at cursor */
2891 if (dollar_vcol >= 0 && wp == curwin
2892 && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum && vcol >= (long)wp->w_virtcol
2893 && filler_todo <= 0
2894 ) {
2895 SCREEN_LINE(screen_row, wp->w_wincol, col, -wp->w_width, wp->w_p_rl)screen_line((screen_row), (wp->w_wincol), (col), (-wp->
w_width), (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl));
2896 /* Pretend we have finished updating the window. Except when
2897 * 'cursorcolumn' is set. */
2898 if (wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc)
2899 row = wp->w_cline_row + wp->w_cline_height;
2900 else
2901 row = wp->w_height;
2902 break;
2903 }
2904
2905 if (draw_state == WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 && area_highlighting) {
2906 /* handle Visual or match highlighting in this line */
2907 if (vcol == fromcol
2908 || (has_mbyte && vcol + 1 == fromcol && n_extra == 0
2909 && (*mb_ptr2cells)(ptr) > 1)
2910 || ((int)vcol_prev == fromcol_prev
2911 && vcol_prev < vcol /* not at margin */
2912 && vcol < tocol))
2913 area_attr = attr; /* start highlighting */
2914 else if (area_attr != 0
2915 && (vcol == tocol
2916 || (noinvcur && (colnr_T)vcol == wp->w_virtcol)))
2917 area_attr = 0; /* stop highlighting */
2918
2919 if (!n_extra) {
2920 /*
2921 * Check for start/end of search pattern match.
2922 * After end, check for start/end of next match.
2923 * When another match, have to check for start again.
2924 * Watch out for matching an empty string!
2925 * Do this for 'search_hl' and the match list (ordered by
2926 * priority).
2927 */
2928 v = (long)(ptr - line);
2929 cur = wp->w_match_head;
2930 shl_flag = FALSE0;
2931 while (cur != NULL((void*)0) || shl_flag == FALSE0) {
2932 if (shl_flag == FALSE0
2933 && ((cur != NULL((void*)0)
2934 && cur->priority > SEARCH_HL_PRIORITY0)
2935 || cur == NULL((void*)0))) {
2936 shl = &search_hl;
2937 shl_flag = TRUE1;
2938 } else
2939 shl = &cur->hl;
2940 if (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
2941 cur->pos.cur = 0;
2942 }
2943 bool_Bool pos_inprogress = true1; // mark that a position match search is
2944 // in progress
2945 while (shl->rm.regprog != NULL((void*)0)
2946 || (cur != NULL((void*)0) && pos_inprogress)) {
2947 if (shl->startcol != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
2948 && v >= (long)shl->startcol
2949 && v < (long)shl->endcol) {
2950 shl->attr_cur = shl->attr;
2951 } else if (v >= (long)shl->endcol && shl->lnum == lnum) {
2952 shl->attr_cur = 0;
2953
2954 next_search_hl(wp, shl, lnum, (colnr_T)v, cur);
2955 pos_inprogress = !(cur == NULL((void*)0) || cur->pos.cur == 0);
2956
2957 /* Need to get the line again, a multi-line regexp
2958 * may have made it invalid. */
2959 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0);
2960 ptr = line + v;
2961
2962 if (shl->lnum == lnum) {
2963 shl->startcol = shl->rm.startpos[0].col;
2964 if (shl->rm.endpos[0].lnum == 0)
2965 shl->endcol = shl->rm.endpos[0].col;
2966 else
2967 shl->endcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
2968
2969 if (shl->startcol == shl->endcol) {
2970 /* highlight empty match, try again after
2971 * it */
2972 if (has_mbyte)
2973 shl->endcol += (*mb_ptr2len)(line
2974 + shl->endcol);
2975 else
2976 ++shl->endcol;
2977 }
2978
2979 /* Loop to check if the match starts at the
2980 * current position */
2981 continue;
2982 }
2983 }
2984 break;
2985 }
2986 if (shl != &search_hl && cur != NULL((void*)0))
2987 cur = cur->next;
2988 }
2989
2990 /* Use attributes from match with highest priority among
2991 * 'search_hl' and the match list. */
2992 search_attr = search_hl.attr_cur;
2993 cur = wp->w_match_head;
2994 shl_flag = FALSE0;
2995 while (cur != NULL((void*)0) || shl_flag == FALSE0) {
2996 if (shl_flag == FALSE0
2997 && ((cur != NULL((void*)0)
2998 && cur->priority > SEARCH_HL_PRIORITY0)
2999 || cur == NULL((void*)0))) {
3000 shl = &search_hl;
3001 shl_flag = TRUE1;
3002 } else
3003 shl = &cur->hl;
3004 if (shl->attr_cur != 0)
3005 search_attr = shl->attr_cur;
3006 if (shl != &search_hl && cur != NULL((void*)0))
3007 cur = cur->next;
3008 }
3009 }
3010
3011 if (diff_hlf != (hlf_T)0) {
3012 if (diff_hlf == HLF_CHD && ptr - line >= change_start
3013 && n_extra == 0)
3014 diff_hlf = HLF_TXD; /* changed text */
3015 if (diff_hlf == HLF_TXD && ptr - line > change_end
3016 && n_extra == 0)
3017 diff_hlf = HLF_CHD; /* changed line */
3018 line_attr = hl_attr(diff_hlf)highlight_attr[(int)(diff_hlf)];
3019 }
3020
3021 /* Decide which of the highlight attributes to use. */
3022 attr_pri = TRUE1;
3023 if (area_attr != 0)
3024 char_attr = area_attr;
3025 else if (search_attr != 0)
3026 char_attr = search_attr;
3027 /* Use line_attr when not in the Visual or 'incsearch' area
3028 * (area_attr may be 0 when "noinvcur" is set). */
3029 else if (line_attr != 0 && ((fromcol == -10 && tocol == MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL))
3030 || vcol < fromcol || vcol_prev < fromcol_prev
3031 || vcol >= tocol))
3032 char_attr = line_attr;
3033 else {
3034 attr_pri = FALSE0;
3035 if (has_syntax)
3036 char_attr = syntax_attr;
3037 else
3038 char_attr = 0;
3039 }
3040 }
3041
3042 /*
3043 * Get the next character to put on the screen.
3044 */
3045 /*
3046 * The "p_extra" points to the extra stuff that is inserted to
3047 * represent special characters (non-printable stuff) and other
3048 * things. When all characters are the same, c_extra is used.
3049 * "p_extra" must end in a NUL to avoid mb_ptr2len() reads past
3050 * "p_extra[n_extra]".
3051 * For the '$' of the 'list' option, n_extra == 1, p_extra == "".
3052 */
3053 if (n_extra > 0) {
3054 if (c_extra != NUL'\000') {
3055 c = c_extra;
3056 mb_c = c; /* doesn't handle non-utf-8 multi-byte! */
3057 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3058 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3059 u8cc[0] = 0;
3060 c = 0xc0;
3061 } else
3062 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3063 } else {
3064 c = *p_extra;
3065 if (has_mbyte) {
3066 mb_c = c;
3067 if (enc_utf8) {
3068 /* If the UTF-8 character is more than one byte:
3069 * Decode it into "mb_c". */
3070 mb_l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p_extra);
3071 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3072 if (mb_l > n_extra)
3073 mb_l = 1;
3074 else if (mb_l > 1) {
3075 mb_c = utfc_ptr2char(p_extra, u8cc);
3076 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3077 c = 0xc0;
3078 }
3079 } else {
3080 /* if this is a DBCS character, put it in "mb_c" */
3081 mb_l = MB_BYTE2LEN(c)mb_bytelen_tab[c];
3082 if (mb_l >= n_extra)
3083 mb_l = 1;
3084 else if (mb_l > 1)
3085 mb_c = (c << 8) + p_extra[1];
3086 }
3087 if (mb_l == 0) /* at the NUL at end-of-line */
3088 mb_l = 1;
3089
3090 /* If a double-width char doesn't fit display a '>' in the
3091 * last column. */
3092 if ((
3093 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? (col <= 0) :
3094 (col >= wp->w_width - 1))
3095 && (*mb_char2cells)(mb_c) == 2) {
3096 c = '>';
3097 mb_c = c;
3098 mb_l = 1;
3099 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3100 multi_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
3101 /* put the pointer back to output the double-width
3102 * character at the start of the next line. */
3103 ++n_extra;
3104 --p_extra;
3105 } else {
3106 n_extra -= mb_l - 1;
3107 p_extra += mb_l - 1;
3108 }
3109 }
3110 ++p_extra;
3111 }
3112 --n_extra;
3113 } else {
3114 if (p_extra_free != NULL((void*)0)) {
3115 free(p_extra_free);
3116 p_extra_free = NULL((void*)0);
3117 }
3118 /*
3119 * Get a character from the line itself.
3120 */
3121 c = *ptr;
3122 if (has_mbyte) {
3123 mb_c = c;
3124 if (enc_utf8) {
3125 /* If the UTF-8 character is more than one byte: Decode it
3126 * into "mb_c". */
3127 mb_l = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
3128 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3129 if (mb_l > 1) {
3130 mb_c = utfc_ptr2char(ptr, u8cc);
3131 /* Overlong encoded ASCII or ASCII with composing char
3132 * is displayed normally, except a NUL. */
3133 if (mb_c < 0x80)
3134 c = mb_c;
3135 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3136
3137 /* At start of the line we can have a composing char.
3138 * Draw it as a space with a composing char. */
3139 if (utf_iscomposing(mb_c)) {
3140 int i;
3141
3142 for (i = Screen_mco - 1; i > 0; --i)
3143 u8cc[i] = u8cc[i - 1];
3144 u8cc[0] = mb_c;
3145 mb_c = ' ';
3146 }
3147 }
3148
3149 if ((mb_l == 1 && c >= 0x80)
3150 || (mb_l >= 1 && mb_c == 0)
3151 || (mb_l > 1 && (!vim_isprintc(mb_c)
3152# ifdef UNICODE16
3153 || mb_c >= 0x10000
3154# endif
3155 ))) {
3156 /*
3157 * Illegal UTF-8 byte: display as <xx>.
3158 * Non-BMP character : display as ? or fullwidth ?.
3159 */
3160# ifdef UNICODE16
3161 if (mb_c < 0x10000)
3162# endif
3163 {
3164 transchar_hex(extra, mb_c);
3165 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) /* reverse */
3166 rl_mirror(extra);
3167 }
3168# ifdef UNICODE16
3169 else if (utf_char2cells(mb_c) != 2)
3170 STRCPY(extra, "?")strcpy((char *)(extra), (char *)("?"));
3171 else
3172 /* 0xff1f in UTF-8: full-width '?' */
3173 STRCPY(extra, "\357\274\237")strcpy((char *)(extra), (char *)("\357\274\237"));
3174# endif
3175
3176 p_extra = extra;
3177 c = *p_extra;
3178 mb_c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p_extra);
3179 mb_utf8 = (c >= 0x80);
3180 n_extra = (int)STRLEN(p_extra)strlen((char *)(p_extra));
3181 c_extra = NUL'\000';
3182 if (area_attr == 0 && search_attr == 0) {
3183 n_attr = n_extra + 1;
3184 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
3185 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3186 }
3187 } else if (mb_l == 0) /* at the NUL at end-of-line */
3188 mb_l = 1;
3189 else if (p_arshape && !p_tbidi && arabic_char(mb_c)) {
3190 /* Do Arabic shaping. */
3191 int pc, pc1, nc;
3192 int pcc[MAX_MCO6];
3193
3194 /* The idea of what is the previous and next
3195 * character depends on 'rightleft'. */
3196 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
3197 pc = prev_c;
3198 pc1 = prev_c1;
3199 nc = utf_ptr2char(ptr + mb_l);
3200 prev_c1 = u8cc[0];
3201 } else {
3202 pc = utfc_ptr2char(ptr + mb_l, pcc);
3203 nc = prev_c;
3204 pc1 = pcc[0];
3205 }
3206 prev_c = mb_c;
3207
3208 mb_c = arabic_shape(mb_c, &c, &u8cc[0], pc, pc1, nc);
3209 } else
3210 prev_c = mb_c;
3211 } else { /* enc_dbcs */
3212 mb_l = MB_BYTE2LEN(c)mb_bytelen_tab[c];
3213 if (mb_l == 0) /* at the NUL at end-of-line */
3214 mb_l = 1;
3215 else if (mb_l > 1) {
3216 /* We assume a second byte below 32 is illegal.
3217 * Hopefully this is OK for all double-byte encodings!
3218 */
3219 if (ptr[1] >= 32)
3220 mb_c = (c << 8) + ptr[1];
3221 else {
3222 if (ptr[1] == NUL'\000') {
3223 /* head byte at end of line */
3224 mb_l = 1;
3225 transchar_nonprint(extra, c);
3226 } else {
3227 /* illegal tail byte */
3228 mb_l = 2;
3229 STRCPY(extra, "XX")strcpy((char *)(extra), (char *)("XX"));
3230 }
3231 p_extra = extra;
3232 n_extra = (int)STRLEN(extra)strlen((char *)(extra)) - 1;
3233 c_extra = NUL'\000';
3234 c = *p_extra++;
3235 if (area_attr == 0 && search_attr == 0) {
3236 n_attr = n_extra + 1;
3237 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
3238 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3239 }
3240 mb_c = c;
3241 }
3242 }
3243 }
3244 /* If a double-width char doesn't fit display a '>' in the
3245 * last column; the character is displayed at the start of the
3246 * next line. */
3247 if ((
3248 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? (col <= 0) :
3249 (col >= wp->w_width - 1))
3250 && (*mb_char2cells)(mb_c) == 2) {
3251 c = '>';
3252 mb_c = c;
3253 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3254 mb_l = 1;
3255 multi_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
3256 /* Put pointer back so that the character will be
3257 * displayed at the start of the next line. */
3258 --ptr;
3259 } else if (*ptr != NUL'\000')
3260 ptr += mb_l - 1;
3261
3262 /* If a double-width char doesn't fit at the left side display
3263 * a '<' in the first column. Don't do this for unprintable
3264 * characters. */
3265 if (n_skip > 0 && mb_l > 1 && n_extra == 0) {
3266 n_extra = 1;
3267 c_extra = MB_FILLER_CHAR'<';
3268 c = ' ';
3269 if (area_attr == 0 && search_attr == 0) {
3270 n_attr = n_extra + 1;
3271 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
3272 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3273 }
3274 mb_c = c;
3275 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3276 mb_l = 1;
3277 }
3278
3279 }
3280 ++ptr;
3281
3282 /* 'list' : change char 160 to lcs_nbsp. */
3283 if (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && (c == 160
3284 || (mb_utf8 && mb_c == 160)
3285 ) && lcs_nbsp) {
3286 c = lcs_nbsp;
3287 if (area_attr == 0 && search_attr == 0) {
3288 n_attr = 1;
3289 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
3290 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3291 }
3292 mb_c = c;
3293 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3294 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3295 u8cc[0] = 0;
3296 c = 0xc0;
3297 } else
3298 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3299 }
3300
3301 if (extra_check) {
3302 bool_Bool can_spell = true1;
3303
3304 /* Get syntax attribute, unless still at the start of the line
3305 * (double-wide char that doesn't fit). */
3306 v = (long)(ptr - line);
3307 if (has_syntax && v > 0) {
3308 /* Get the syntax attribute for the character. If there
3309 * is an error, disable syntax highlighting. */
3310 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
3311 did_emsg = FALSE0;
3312
3313 syntax_attr = get_syntax_attr((colnr_T)v - 1,
3314 has_spell ? &can_spell :
3315 NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
3316
3317 if (did_emsg) {
3318 wp->w_s->b_syn_error = TRUE1;
3319 has_syntax = FALSE0;
3320 } else
3321 did_emsg = save_did_emsg;
3322
3323 /* Need to get the line again, a multi-line regexp may
3324 * have made it invalid. */
3325 line = ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, lnum, FALSE0);
3326 ptr = line + v;
3327
3328 if (!attr_pri)
3329 char_attr = syntax_attr;
3330 else
3331 char_attr = hl_combine_attr(syntax_attr, char_attr);
3332 /* no concealing past the end of the line, it interferes
3333 * with line highlighting */
3334 if (c == NUL'\000')
3335 syntax_flags = 0;
3336 else
3337 syntax_flags = get_syntax_info(&syntax_seqnr);
3338 }
3339
3340 /* Check spelling (unless at the end of the line).
3341 * Only do this when there is no syntax highlighting, the
3342 * @Spell cluster is not used or the current syntax item
3343 * contains the @Spell cluster. */
3344 if (has_spell && v >= word_end && v > cur_checked_col) {
3345 spell_attr = 0;
3346 if (!attr_pri)
3347 char_attr = syntax_attr;
3348 if (c != 0 && (
3349 !has_syntax ||
3350 can_spell)) {
3351 char_u *prev_ptr, *p;
3352 int len;
3353 hlf_T spell_hlf = HLF_COUNT;
3354 if (has_mbyte) {
3355 prev_ptr = ptr - mb_l;
3356 v -= mb_l - 1;
3357 } else
3358 prev_ptr = ptr - 1;
3359
3360 /* Use nextline[] if possible, it has the start of the
3361 * next line concatenated. */
3362 if ((prev_ptr - line) - nextlinecol >= 0)
3363 p = nextline + (prev_ptr - line) - nextlinecol;
3364 else
3365 p = prev_ptr;
3366 cap_col -= (int)(prev_ptr - line);
3367 len = spell_check(wp, p, &spell_hlf, &cap_col,
3368 nochange);
3369 word_end = v + len;
3370
3371 /* In Insert mode only highlight a word that
3372 * doesn't touch the cursor. */
3373 if (spell_hlf != HLF_COUNT
3374 && (State & INSERT0x10) != 0
3375 && wp->w_cursor.lnum == lnum
3376 && wp->w_cursor.col >=
3377 (colnr_T)(prev_ptr - line)
3378 && wp->w_cursor.col < (colnr_T)word_end) {
3379 spell_hlf = HLF_COUNT;
3380 spell_redraw_lnum = lnum;
3381 }
3382
3383 if (spell_hlf == HLF_COUNT && p != prev_ptr
3384 && (p - nextline) + len > nextline_idx) {
3385 /* Remember that the good word continues at the
3386 * start of the next line. */
3387 checked_lnum = lnum + 1;
3388 checked_col = (int)((p - nextline) + len - nextline_idx);
3389 }
3390
3391 /* Turn index into actual attributes. */
3392 if (spell_hlf != HLF_COUNT)
3393 spell_attr = highlight_attr[spell_hlf];
3394
3395 if (cap_col > 0) {
3396 if (p != prev_ptr
3397 && (p - nextline) + cap_col >= nextline_idx) {
3398 /* Remember that the word in the next line
3399 * must start with a capital. */
3400 capcol_lnum = lnum + 1;
3401 cap_col = (int)((p - nextline) + cap_col
3402 - nextline_idx);
3403 } else
3404 /* Compute the actual column. */
3405 cap_col += (int)(prev_ptr - line);
3406 }
3407 }
3408 }
3409 if (spell_attr != 0) {
3410 if (!attr_pri)
3411 char_attr = hl_combine_attr(char_attr, spell_attr);
3412 else
3413 char_attr = hl_combine_attr(spell_attr, char_attr);
3414 }
3415 /*
3416 * Found last space before word: check for line break.
3417 */
3418 if (wp->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr && vim_isbreak(c)(breakat_flags[(char_u)(c)]) && !vim_isbreak(*ptr)(breakat_flags[(char_u)(*ptr)])) {
3419 char_u *p = ptr - (
3420 has_mbyte ? mb_l :
3421 1);
3422 // TODO: is passing p for start of the line OK?
3423 n_extra = win_lbr_chartabsize(wp, line, p, (colnr_T)vcol, NULL((void*)0)) - 1;
3424 c_extra = ' ';
3425 if (vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')) {
3426 if (c == TAB'\011')
3427 /* See "Tab alignment" below. */
3428 FIX_FOR_BOGUSCOLS{ n_extra += vcol_off; vcol -= vcol_off; vcol_off = 0; col -=
boguscols; boguscols = 0; };
3429 if (!wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list) {
3430 c = ' ';
3431 }
3432 }
3433 }
3434
3435 if (trailcol != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL) && ptr > line + trailcol && c == ' ') {
3436 c = lcs_trail;
3437 if (!attr_pri) {
3438 n_attr = 1;
3439 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
3440 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3441 }
3442 mb_c = c;
3443 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3444 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3445 u8cc[0] = 0;
3446 c = 0xc0;
3447 } else
3448 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3449 }
3450 }
3451
3452 /*
3453 * Handling of non-printable characters.
3454 */
3455 if (!(chartab[c & 0xff] & CT_PRINT_CHAR0x10)) {
3456 /*
3457 * when getting a character from the file, we may have to
3458 * turn it into something else on the way to putting it
3459 * into "ScreenLines".
3460 */
3461 if (c == TAB'\011' && (!wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list || lcs_tab1)) {
3462 int tab_len = 0;
3463 /* tab amount depends on current column */
3464 tab_len = (int)wp->w_buffer->b_p_ts
3465 - vcol % (int)wp->w_buffer->b_p_ts - 1;
3466 if (!wp->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr || !wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list) {
3467 n_extra = tab_len;
3468 } else {
3469 char_u *p;
3470 int len = n_extra;
3471 int i;
3472 int saved_nextra = n_extra;
3473
3474 /* if n_extra > 0, it gives the number of chars to use for
3475 * a tab, else we need to calculate the width for a tab */
3476 len = (tab_len * mb_char2len(lcs_tab2));
3477 if (n_extra > 0) {
3478 len += n_extra - tab_len;
3479 }
3480 c = lcs_tab1;
3481 p = xmalloc(len + 1);
3482 memset(p, ' ', len);
3483 p[len] = NUL'\000';
3484 p_extra_free = p;
3485 for (i = 0; i < tab_len; i++) {
3486 mb_char2bytes(lcs_tab2, p);
3487 p += mb_char2len(lcs_tab2);
3488 n_extra += mb_char2len(lcs_tab2) - (saved_nextra > 0 ? 1: 0);
3489 }
3490 p_extra = p_extra_free;
3491 }
3492 /* Tab alignment should be identical regardless of
3493 * 'conceallevel' value. So tab compensates of all
3494 * previous concealed characters, and thus resets vcol_off
3495 * and boguscols accumulated so far in the line. Note that
3496 * the tab can be longer than 'tabstop' when there
3497 * are concealed characters. */
3498 FIX_FOR_BOGUSCOLS{ n_extra += vcol_off; vcol -= vcol_off; vcol_off = 0; col -=
boguscols; boguscols = 0; };
3499 mb_utf8 = FALSE0; /* don't draw as UTF-8 */
3500 if (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list) {
3501 c = lcs_tab1;
3502 if (wp->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr) {
3503 c_extra = NUL'\000'; /* using p_extra from above */
3504 } else {
3505 c_extra = lcs_tab2;
3506 }
3507 n_attr = tab_len + 1;
3508 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
3509 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3510 mb_c = c;
3511 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3512 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3513 u8cc[0] = 0;
3514 c = 0xc0;
3515 }
3516 } else {
3517 c_extra = ' ';
3518 c = ' ';
3519 }
3520 } else if (c == NUL'\000'
3521 && ((wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && lcs_eol > 0)
3522 || ((fromcol >= 0 || fromcol_prev >= 0)
3523 && tocol > vcol
3524 && VIsual_mode != Ctrl_V22
3525 && (
3526 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? (col >= 0) :
3527 (col < wp->w_width))
3528 && !(noinvcur
3529 && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum
3530 && (colnr_T)vcol == wp->w_virtcol)))
3531 && lcs_eol_one >= 0) {
3532 /* Display a '$' after the line or highlight an extra
3533 * character if the line break is included. */
3534 /* For a diff line the highlighting continues after the
3535 * "$". */
3536 if (diff_hlf == (hlf_T)0 && line_attr == 0) {
3537 /* In virtualedit, visual selections may extend
3538 * beyond end of line. */
3539 if (area_highlighting && virtual_active()
3540 && tocol != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL) && vcol < tocol)
3541 n_extra = 0;
3542 else {
3543 p_extra = at_end_str;
3544 n_extra = 1;
3545 c_extra = NUL'\000';
3546 }
3547 }
3548 if (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list)
3549 c = lcs_eol;
3550 else
3551 c = ' ';
3552 lcs_eol_one = -1;
3553 --ptr; /* put it back at the NUL */
3554 if (!attr_pri) {
3555 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
3556 n_attr = 1;
3557 }
3558 mb_c = c;
3559 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3560 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3561 u8cc[0] = 0;
3562 c = 0xc0;
3563 } else
3564 mb_utf8 = FALSE0; /* don't draw as UTF-8 */
3565 } else if (c != NUL'\000') {
3566 p_extra = transchar(c);
3567 if (n_extra == 0) {
3568 n_extra = byte2cells(c) - 1;
3569 }
3570 if ((dy_flags & DY_UHEX0x002) && wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
3571 rl_mirror(p_extra); /* reverse "<12>" */
3572 c_extra = NUL'\000';
3573 if (wp->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr) {
3574 char_u *p;
3575
3576 c = *p_extra;
3577 p = xmalloc(n_extra + 1);
3578 memset(p, ' ', n_extra);
3579 STRNCPY(p, p_extra + 1, STRLEN(p_extra) - 1)strncpy((char *)(p), (char *)(p_extra + 1), (size_t)(strlen((
char *)(p_extra)) - 1));
3580 p[n_extra] = NUL'\000';
3581 p_extra_free = p_extra = p;
3582 } else {
3583 n_extra = byte2cells(c) - 1;
3584 c = *p_extra++;
3585 }
3586 if (!attr_pri) {
3587 n_attr = n_extra + 1;
3588 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
3589 saved_attr2 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3590 }
3591 mb_utf8 = FALSE0; /* don't draw as UTF-8 */
3592 } else if (VIsual_active
3593 && (VIsual_mode == Ctrl_V22
3594 || VIsual_mode == 'v')
3595 && virtual_active()
3596 && tocol != MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
3597 && vcol < tocol
3598 && (
3599 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? (col >= 0) :
3600 (col < wp->w_width))) {
3601 c = ' ';
3602 --ptr; /* put it back at the NUL */
3603 } else if ((
3604 diff_hlf != (hlf_T)0 ||
3605 line_attr != 0
3606 ) && (
3607 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? (col >= 0) :
3608 (col
3609 - boguscols
3610 < wp->w_width))) {
3611 /* Highlight until the right side of the window */
3612 c = ' ';
3613 --ptr; /* put it back at the NUL */
3614
3615 /* Remember we do the char for line highlighting. */
3616 ++did_line_attr;
3617
3618 /* don't do search HL for the rest of the line */
3619 if (line_attr != 0 && char_attr == search_attr && col > 0)
3620 char_attr = line_attr;
3621 if (diff_hlf == HLF_TXD) {
3622 diff_hlf = HLF_CHD;
3623 if (attr == 0 || char_attr != attr)
3624 char_attr = hl_attr(diff_hlf)highlight_attr[(int)(diff_hlf)];
3625 }
3626 }
3627 }
3628
3629 if ( wp->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole > 0
3630 && (wp != curwin || lnum != wp->w_cursor.lnum ||
3631 conceal_cursor_line(wp))
3632 && (syntax_flags & HL_CONCEAL0x20000) != 0
3633 && !(lnum_in_visual_area
3634 && vim_strchr(wp->w_p_cocuw_onebuf_opt.wo_cocu, 'v') == NULL((void*)0))) {
3635 char_attr = conceal_attr;
3636 if (prev_syntax_id != syntax_seqnr
3637 && (syn_get_sub_char() != NUL'\000' || wp->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole == 1)
3638 && wp->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole != 3) {
3639 /* First time at this concealed item: display one
3640 * character. */
3641 if (syn_get_sub_char() != NUL'\000')
3642 c = syn_get_sub_char();
3643 else if (lcs_conceal != NUL'\000')
3644 c = lcs_conceal;
3645 else
3646 c = ' ';
3647
3648 prev_syntax_id = syntax_seqnr;
3649
3650 if (n_extra > 0)
3651 vcol_off += n_extra;
3652 vcol += n_extra;
3653 if (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap && n_extra > 0) {
3654 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
3655 col -= n_extra;
3656 boguscols -= n_extra;
3657 } else {
3658 boguscols += n_extra;
3659 col += n_extra;
3660 }
3661 }
3662 n_extra = 0;
3663 n_attr = 0;
3664 } else if (n_skip == 0) {
3665 is_concealing = TRUE1;
3666 n_skip = 1;
3667 }
3668 mb_c = c;
3669 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3670 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3671 u8cc[0] = 0;
3672 c = 0xc0;
3673 } else
3674 mb_utf8 = FALSE0; /* don't draw as UTF-8 */
3675 } else {
3676 prev_syntax_id = 0;
3677 is_concealing = FALSE0;
3678 }
3679 }
3680
3681 /* In the cursor line and we may be concealing characters: correct
3682 * the cursor column when we reach its position. */
3683 if (!did_wcol && draw_state == WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1
3684 && wp == curwin && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum
3685 && conceal_cursor_line(wp)
3686 && (int)wp->w_virtcol <= vcol + n_skip) {
3687 wp->w_wcol = col - boguscols;
3688 wp->w_wrow = row;
3689 did_wcol = TRUE1;
3690 }
3691
3692 /* Don't override visual selection highlighting. */
3693 if (n_attr > 0
3694 && draw_state == WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1
3695 && !attr_pri)
3696 char_attr = extra_attr;
3697
3698 /*
3699 * Handle the case where we are in column 0 but not on the first
3700 * character of the line and the user wants us to show us a
3701 * special character (via 'listchars' option "precedes:<char>".
3702 */
3703 if (lcs_prec_todo != NUL'\000'
3704 && (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap ? wp->w_skipcol > 0 : wp->w_leftcol > 0)
3705 && filler_todo <= 0
3706 && draw_state > WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1
3707 && c != NUL'\000') {
3708 c = lcs_prec;
3709 lcs_prec_todo = NUL'\000';
3710 if (has_mbyte && (*mb_char2cells)(mb_c) > 1) {
3711 /* Double-width character being overwritten by the "precedes"
3712 * character, need to fill up half the character. */
3713 c_extra = MB_FILLER_CHAR'<';
3714 n_extra = 1;
3715 n_attr = 2;
3716 extra_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
3717 }
3718 mb_c = c;
3719 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3720 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3721 u8cc[0] = 0;
3722 c = 0xc0;
3723 } else
3724 mb_utf8 = FALSE0; /* don't draw as UTF-8 */
3725 if (!attr_pri) {
3726 saved_attr3 = char_attr; /* save current attr */
3727 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)]; /* later copied to char_attr */
3728 n_attr3 = 1;
3729 }
3730 }
3731
3732 /*
3733 * At end of the text line or just after the last character.
3734 */
3735 if (c == NUL'\000' || did_line_attr == 1) {
3736 long prevcol = (long)(ptr - line) - (c == NUL'\000');
3737
3738 /* we're not really at that column when skipping some text */
3739 if ((long)(wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap ? wp->w_skipcol : wp->w_leftcol) > prevcol)
3740 ++prevcol;
3741
3742 /* Invert at least one char, used for Visual and empty line or
3743 * highlight match at end of line. If it's beyond the last
3744 * char on the screen, just overwrite that one (tricky!) Not
3745 * needed when a '$' was displayed for 'list'. */
3746 prevcol_hl_flag = FALSE0;
3747 if (prevcol == (long)search_hl.startcol)
3748 prevcol_hl_flag = TRUE1;
3749 else {
3750 cur = wp->w_match_head;
3751 while (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
3752 if (prevcol == (long)cur->hl.startcol) {
3753 prevcol_hl_flag = TRUE1;
3754 break;
3755 }
3756 cur = cur->next;
3757 }
3758 }
3759 if (lcs_eol == lcs_eol_one
3760 && ((area_attr != 0 && vcol == fromcol
3761 && (VIsual_mode != Ctrl_V22
3762 || lnum == VIsual.lnum
3763 || lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum)
3764 && c == NUL'\000')
3765 /* highlight 'hlsearch' match at end of line */
3766 || (prevcol_hl_flag == TRUE1 && did_line_attr <= 1)
3767 )) {
3768 int n = 0;
3769
3770 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
3771 if (col < 0)
3772 n = 1;
3773 } else {
3774 if (col >= wp->w_width)
3775 n = -1;
3776 }
3777 if (n != 0) {
3778 /* At the window boundary, highlight the last character
3779 * instead (better than nothing). */
3780 off += n;
3781 col += n;
3782 } else {
3783 /* Add a blank character to highlight. */
3784 ScreenLines[off] = ' ';
3785 if (enc_utf8)
3786 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
3787 }
3788 if (area_attr == 0) {
3789 /* Use attributes from match with highest priority among
3790 * 'search_hl' and the match list. */
3791 char_attr = search_hl.attr;
3792 cur = wp->w_match_head;
3793 shl_flag = FALSE0;
3794 while (cur != NULL((void*)0) || shl_flag == FALSE0) {
3795 if (shl_flag == FALSE0
3796 && ((cur != NULL((void*)0)
3797 && cur->priority > SEARCH_HL_PRIORITY0)
3798 || cur == NULL((void*)0))) {
3799 shl = &search_hl;
3800 shl_flag = TRUE1;
3801 } else
3802 shl = &cur->hl;
3803 if ((ptr - line) - 1 == (long)shl->startcol)
3804 char_attr = shl->attr;
3805 if (shl != &search_hl && cur != NULL((void*)0))
3806 cur = cur->next;
3807 }
3808 }
3809 ScreenAttrs[off] = char_attr;
3810 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
3811 --col;
3812 --off;
3813 } else {
3814 ++col;
3815 ++off;
3816 }
3817 ++vcol;
3818 eol_hl_off = 1;
3819 }
3820 }
3821
3822 /*
3823 * At end of the text line.
3824 */
3825 if (c == NUL'\000') {
3826 if (eol_hl_off > 0 && vcol - eol_hl_off == (long)wp->w_virtcol
3827 && lnum == wp->w_cursor.lnum) {
3828 /* highlight last char after line */
3829 --col;
3830 --off;
3831 --vcol;
3832 }
3833
3834 /* Highlight 'cursorcolumn' & 'colorcolumn' past end of the line. */
3835 if (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap)
3836 v = wp->w_skipcol;
3837 else
3838 v = wp->w_leftcol;
3839
3840 /* check if line ends before left margin */
3841 if (vcol < v + col - win_col_off(wp))
3842 vcol = v + col - win_col_off(wp);
3843 /* Get rid of the boguscols now, we want to draw until the right
3844 * edge for 'cursorcolumn'. */
3845 col -= boguscols;
3846 boguscols = 0;
3847
3848 if (draw_color_col)
3849 draw_color_col = advance_color_col(VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off), &color_cols);
3850
3851 if (((wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc
3852 && (int)wp->w_virtcol >= VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) - eol_hl_off
3853 && (int)wp->w_virtcol <
3854 wp->w_width * (row - startrow + 1) + v
3855 && lnum != wp->w_cursor.lnum)
3856 || draw_color_col)
3857 && !wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl
3858 ) {
3859 int rightmost_vcol = 0;
3860 int i;
3861
3862 if (wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc)
3863 rightmost_vcol = wp->w_virtcol;
3864 if (draw_color_col)
3865 /* determine rightmost colorcolumn to possibly draw */
3866 for (i = 0; color_cols[i] >= 0; ++i)
3867 if (rightmost_vcol < color_cols[i])
3868 rightmost_vcol = color_cols[i];
3869
3870 while (col < wp->w_width) {
3871 ScreenLines[off] = ' ';
3872 if (enc_utf8)
3873 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
3874 ++col;
3875 if (draw_color_col)
3876 draw_color_col = advance_color_col(VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off),
3877 &color_cols);
3878
3879 if (wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc && VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) == (long)wp->w_virtcol)
3880 ScreenAttrs[off++] = hl_attr(HLF_CUC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CUC)];
3881 else if (draw_color_col && VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) == *color_cols)
3882 ScreenAttrs[off++] = hl_attr(HLF_MC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_MC)];
3883 else
3884 ScreenAttrs[off++] = 0;
3885
3886 if (VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) >= rightmost_vcol)
3887 break;
3888
3889 ++vcol;
3890 }
3891 }
3892
3893 SCREEN_LINE(screen_row, wp->w_wincol, col, wp->w_width, wp->w_p_rl)screen_line((screen_row), (wp->w_wincol), (col), (wp->w_width
), (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl));
3894 row++;
3895
3896 /*
3897 * Update w_cline_height and w_cline_folded if the cursor line was
3898 * updated (saves a call to plines() later).
3899 */
3900 if (wp == curwin && lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
3901 curwin->w_cline_row = startrow;
3902 curwin->w_cline_height = row - startrow;
3903 curwin->w_cline_folded = FALSE0;
3904 curwin->w_valid |= (VALID_CHEIGHT0x08|VALID_CROW0x10);
3905 }
3906
3907 break;
3908 }
3909
3910 /* line continues beyond line end */
3911 if (lcs_ext
3912 && !wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap
3913 && filler_todo <= 0
3914 && (
3915 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? col == 0 :
3916 col == wp->w_width - 1)
3917 && (*ptr != NUL'\000'
3918 || (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && lcs_eol_one > 0)
3919 || (n_extra && (c_extra != NUL'\000' || *p_extra != NUL'\000')))) {
3920 c = lcs_ext;
3921 char_attr = hl_attr(HLF_AT)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_AT)];
3922 mb_c = c;
3923 if (enc_utf8 && (*mb_char2len)(c) > 1) {
3924 mb_utf8 = TRUE1;
3925 u8cc[0] = 0;
3926 c = 0xc0;
3927 } else
3928 mb_utf8 = FALSE0;
3929 }
3930
3931 /* advance to the next 'colorcolumn' */
3932 if (draw_color_col)
3933 draw_color_col = advance_color_col(VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off), &color_cols);
3934
3935 /* Highlight the cursor column if 'cursorcolumn' is set. But don't
3936 * highlight the cursor position itself.
3937 * Also highlight the 'colorcolumn' if it is different than
3938 * 'cursorcolumn' */
3939 vcol_save_attr = -1;
3940 if (draw_state == WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 && !lnum_in_visual_area) {
3941 if (wp->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc && VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) == (long)wp->w_virtcol
3942 && lnum != wp->w_cursor.lnum) {
3943 vcol_save_attr = char_attr;
3944 char_attr = hl_combine_attr(char_attr, hl_attr(HLF_CUC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CUC)]);
3945 } else if (draw_color_col && VCOL_HLC(vcol - vcol_off) == *color_cols) {
3946 vcol_save_attr = char_attr;
3947 char_attr = hl_combine_attr(char_attr, hl_attr(HLF_MC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_MC)]);
3948 }
3949 }
3950
3951 /*
3952 * Store character to be displayed.
3953 * Skip characters that are left of the screen for 'nowrap'.
3954 */
3955 vcol_prev = vcol;
3956 if (draw_state < WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 || n_skip <= 0) {
3957 /*
3958 * Store the character.
3959 */
3960 if (has_mbyte && wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl && (*mb_char2cells)(mb_c) > 1) {
3961 /* A double-wide character is: put first halve in left cell. */
3962 --off;
3963 --col;
3964 }
3965 ScreenLines[off] = c;
3966 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932) {
3967 if ((mb_c & 0xff00) == 0x8e00)
3968 ScreenLines[off] = 0x8e;
3969 ScreenLines2[off] = mb_c & 0xff;
3970 } else if (enc_utf8) {
3971 if (mb_utf8) {
3972 int i;
3973
3974 ScreenLinesUC[off] = mb_c;
3975 if ((c & 0xff) == 0)
3976 ScreenLines[off] = 0x80; /* avoid storing zero */
3977 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i) {
3978 ScreenLinesC[i][off] = u8cc[i];
3979 if (u8cc[i] == 0)
3980 break;
3981 }
3982 } else
3983 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
3984 }
3985 if (multi_attr) {
3986 ScreenAttrs[off] = multi_attr;
3987 multi_attr = 0;
3988 } else
3989 ScreenAttrs[off] = char_attr;
3990
3991 if (has_mbyte && (*mb_char2cells)(mb_c) > 1) {
3992 /* Need to fill two screen columns. */
3993 ++off;
3994 ++col;
3995 if (enc_utf8)
3996 /* UTF-8: Put a 0 in the second screen char. */
3997 ScreenLines[off] = 0;
3998 else
3999 /* DBCS: Put second byte in the second screen char. */
4000 ScreenLines[off] = mb_c & 0xff;
4001 ++vcol;
4002 /* When "tocol" is halfway a character, set it to the end of
4003 * the character, otherwise highlighting won't stop. */
4004 if (tocol == vcol)
4005 ++tocol;
4006 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
4007 /* now it's time to backup one cell */
4008 --off;
4009 --col;
4010 }
4011 }
4012 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
4013 --off;
4014 --col;
4015 } else {
4016 ++off;
4017 ++col;
4018 }
4019 } else if (wp->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole > 0 && is_concealing) {
4020 --n_skip;
4021 ++vcol_off;
4022 if (n_extra > 0)
4023 vcol_off += n_extra;
4024 if (wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap) {
4025 /*
4026 * Special voodoo required if 'wrap' is on.
4027 *
4028 * Advance the column indicator to force the line
4029 * drawing to wrap early. This will make the line
4030 * take up the same screen space when parts are concealed,
4031 * so that cursor line computations aren't messed up.
4032 *
4033 * To avoid the fictitious advance of 'col' causing
4034 * trailing junk to be written out of the screen line
4035 * we are building, 'boguscols' keeps track of the number
4036 * of bad columns we have advanced.
4037 */
4038 if (n_extra > 0) {
4039 vcol += n_extra;
4040 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
4041 col -= n_extra;
4042 boguscols -= n_extra;
4043 } else {
4044 col += n_extra;
4045 boguscols += n_extra;
4046 }
4047 n_extra = 0;
4048 n_attr = 0;
4049 }
4050
4051
4052 if (has_mbyte && (*mb_char2cells)(mb_c) > 1) {
4053 /* Need to fill two screen columns. */
4054 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
4055 --boguscols;
4056 --col;
4057 } else {
4058 ++boguscols;
4059 ++col;
4060 }
4061 }
4062
4063 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
4064 --boguscols;
4065 --col;
4066 } else {
4067 ++boguscols;
4068 ++col;
4069 }
4070 } else {
4071 if (n_extra > 0) {
4072 vcol += n_extra;
4073 n_extra = 0;
4074 n_attr = 0;
4075 }
4076 }
4077
4078 } else
4079 --n_skip;
4080
4081 /* Only advance the "vcol" when after the 'number' or 'relativenumber'
4082 * column. */
4083 if (draw_state > WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1
4084 && filler_todo <= 0
4085 )
4086 ++vcol;
4087
4088 if (vcol_save_attr >= 0)
4089 char_attr = vcol_save_attr;
4090
4091 /* restore attributes after "predeces" in 'listchars' */
4092 if (draw_state > WL_NR0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 && n_attr3 > 0 && --n_attr3 == 0)
4093 char_attr = saved_attr3;
4094
4095 /* restore attributes after last 'listchars' or 'number' char */
4096 if (n_attr > 0 && draw_state == WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 && --n_attr == 0)
4097 char_attr = saved_attr2;
4098
4099 /*
4100 * At end of screen line and there is more to come: Display the line
4101 * so far. If there is no more to display it is caught above.
4102 */
4103 if ((
4104 wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? (col < 0) :
4105 (col >= wp->w_width))
4106 && (*ptr != NUL'\000'
4107 || filler_todo > 0
4108 || (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && lcs_eol != NUL'\000' && p_extra != at_end_str)
4109 || (n_extra != 0 && (c_extra != NUL'\000' || *p_extra != NUL'\000')))
4110 ) {
4111 SCREEN_LINE(screen_row, wp->w_wincol, col - boguscols,screen_line((screen_row), (wp->w_wincol), (col - boguscols
), (wp->w_width), (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl))
4112 wp->w_width, wp->w_p_rl)screen_line((screen_row), (wp->w_wincol), (col - boguscols
), (wp->w_width), (wp->w_onebuf_opt.wo_rl));
4113 boguscols = 0;
4114 ++row;
4115 ++screen_row;
4116
4117 /* When not wrapping and finished diff lines, or when displayed
4118 * '$' and highlighting until last column, break here. */
4119 if ((!wp->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap
4120 && filler_todo <= 0
4121 ) || lcs_eol_one == -1)
4122 break;
4123
4124 /* When the window is too narrow draw all "@" lines. */
4125 if (draw_state != WL_LINE0 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1
4126 && filler_todo <= 0
4127 ) {
4128 win_draw_end(wp, '@', ' ', row, wp->w_height, HLF_AT);
4129 draw_vsep_win(wp, row);
4130 row = endrow;
4131 }
4132
4133 /* When line got too long for screen break here. */
4134 if (row == endrow) {
4135 ++row;
4136 break;
4137 }
4138
4139 if (screen_cur_row == screen_row - 1
4140 && filler_todo <= 0
4141 && wp->w_width == Columns) {
4142 /* Remember that the line wraps, used for modeless copy. */
4143 LineWraps[screen_row - 1] = TRUE1;
4144
4145 /*
4146 * Special trick to make copy/paste of wrapped lines work with
4147 * xterm/screen: write an extra character beyond the end of
4148 * the line. This will work with all terminal types
4149 * (regardless of the xn,am settings).
4150 * Only do this on a fast tty.
4151 * Only do this if the cursor is on the current line
4152 * (something has been written in it).
4153 * Don't do this for the GUI.
4154 * Don't do this for double-width characters.
4155 * Don't do this for a window not at the right screen border.
4156 */
4157 if (p_tf
4158 && !(has_mbyte
4159 && ((*mb_off2cells)(LineOffset[screen_row],
4160 LineOffset[screen_row] + screen_Columns)
4161 == 2
4162 || (*mb_off2cells)(LineOffset[screen_row - 1]
4163 + (int)Columns - 2,
4164 LineOffset[screen_row] + screen_Columns)
4165 == 2))
4166 ) {
4167 /* First make sure we are at the end of the screen line,
4168 * then output the same character again to let the
4169 * terminal know about the wrap. If the terminal doesn't
4170 * auto-wrap, we overwrite the character. */
4171 if (screen_cur_col != wp->w_width)
4172 screen_char(LineOffset[screen_row - 1]
4173 + (unsigned)Columns - 1,
4174 screen_row - 1, (int)(Columns - 1));
4175
4176 /* When there is a multi-byte character, just output a
4177 * space to keep it simple. */
4178 if (has_mbyte && MB_BYTE2LEN(ScreenLines[LineOffset[mb_bytelen_tab[ScreenLines[LineOffset[ screen_row - 1] + (Columns
- 1)]]
4179 screen_row -mb_bytelen_tab[ScreenLines[LineOffset[ screen_row - 1] + (Columns
- 1)]]
4180 1] + (Columns - 1)])mb_bytelen_tab[ScreenLines[LineOffset[ screen_row - 1] + (Columns
- 1)]] > 1)
4181 out_char(' ');
4182 else
4183 out_char(ScreenLines[LineOffset[screen_row - 1]
4184 + (Columns - 1)]);
4185 /* force a redraw of the first char on the next line */
4186 ScreenAttrs[LineOffset[screen_row]] = (sattr_T)-1;
4187 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
4188 }
4189 }
4190
4191 col = 0;
4192 off = (unsigned)(current_ScreenLine - ScreenLines);
4193 if (wp->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
4194 col = wp->w_width - 1; /* col is not used if breaking! */
4195 off += col;
4196 }
4197
4198 /* reset the drawing state for the start of a wrapped line */
4199 draw_state = WL_START0;
4200 saved_n_extra = n_extra;
4201 saved_p_extra = p_extra;
4202 saved_c_extra = c_extra;
4203 saved_char_attr = char_attr;
4204 n_extra = 0;
4205 lcs_prec_todo = lcs_prec;
4206 if (filler_todo <= 0)
4207 need_showbreak = TRUE1;
4208 --filler_todo;
4209 /* When the filler lines are actually below the last line of the
4210 * file, don't draw the line itself, break here. */
4211 if (filler_todo == 0 && wp->w_botfill)
4212 break;
4213 }
4214
4215 } /* for every character in the line */
4216
4217 /* After an empty line check first word for capital. */
4218 if (*skipwhite(line) == NUL'\000') {
4219 capcol_lnum = lnum + 1;
4220 cap_col = 0;
4221 }
4222
4223 return row;
4224}
4225
4226
4227/*
4228 * Return if the composing characters at "off_from" and "off_to" differ.
4229 * Only to be used when ScreenLinesUC[off_from] != 0.
4230 */
4231static int comp_char_differs(int off_from, int off_to)
4232{
4233 int i;
4234
4235 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i) {
4236 if (ScreenLinesC[i][off_from] != ScreenLinesC[i][off_to])
4237 return TRUE1;
4238 if (ScreenLinesC[i][off_from] == 0)
4239 break;
4240 }
4241 return FALSE0;
4242}
4243
4244/*
4245 * Check whether the given character needs redrawing:
4246 * - the (first byte of the) character is different
4247 * - the attributes are different
4248 * - the character is multi-byte and the next byte is different
4249 * - the character is two cells wide and the second cell differs.
4250 */
4251static int char_needs_redraw(int off_from, int off_to, int cols)
4252{
4253 if (cols > 0
4254 && ((ScreenLines[off_from] != ScreenLines[off_to]
4255 || ScreenAttrs[off_from] != ScreenAttrs[off_to])
4256
4257 || (enc_dbcs != 0
4258 && MB_BYTE2LEN(ScreenLines[off_from])mb_bytelen_tab[ScreenLines[off_from]] > 1
4259 && (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && ScreenLines[off_from] == 0x8e
4260 ? ScreenLines2[off_from] != ScreenLines2[off_to]
4261 : (cols > 1 && ScreenLines[off_from + 1]
4262 != ScreenLines[off_to + 1])))
4263 || (enc_utf8
4264 && (ScreenLinesUC[off_from] != ScreenLinesUC[off_to]
4265 || (ScreenLinesUC[off_from] != 0
4266 && comp_char_differs(off_from, off_to))
4267 || ((*mb_off2cells)(off_from, off_from + cols) > 1
4268 && ScreenLines[off_from + 1]
4269 != ScreenLines[off_to + 1])))
4270 ))
4271 return TRUE1;
4272 return FALSE0;
4273}
4274
4275/*
4276 * Move one "cooked" screen line to the screen, but only the characters that
4277 * have actually changed. Handle insert/delete character.
4278 * "coloff" gives the first column on the screen for this line.
4279 * "endcol" gives the columns where valid characters are.
4280 * "clear_width" is the width of the window. It's > 0 if the rest of the line
4281 * needs to be cleared, negative otherwise.
4282 * "rlflag" is TRUE in a rightleft window:
4283 * When TRUE and "clear_width" > 0, clear columns 0 to "endcol"
4284 * When FALSE and "clear_width" > 0, clear columns "endcol" to "clear_width"
4285 */
4286static void screen_line(int row, int coloff, int endcol, int clear_width, int rlflag)
4287{
4288 unsigned off_from;
4289 unsigned off_to;
4290 unsigned max_off_from;
4291 unsigned max_off_to;
4292 int col = 0;
4293 int hl;
4294 int force = FALSE0; /* force update rest of the line */
4295 int redraw_this /* bool: does character need redraw? */
4296 ;
4297 int redraw_next; /* redraw_this for next character */
4298 int clear_next = FALSE0;
4299 int char_cells; /* 1: normal char */
4300 /* 2: occupies two display cells */
4301# define CHAR_CELLSchar_cells char_cells
4302
4303 /* Check for illegal row and col, just in case. */
4304 if (row >= Rows)
4305 row = Rows - 1;
4306 if (endcol > Columns)
4307 endcol = Columns;
4308
4309
4310 off_from = (unsigned)(current_ScreenLine - ScreenLines);
4311 off_to = LineOffset[row] + coloff;
4312 max_off_from = off_from + screen_Columns;
4313 max_off_to = LineOffset[row] + screen_Columns;
4314
4315 if (rlflag) {
4316 /* Clear rest first, because it's left of the text. */
4317 if (clear_width > 0) {
4318 while (col <= endcol && ScreenLines[off_to] == ' '
4319 && ScreenAttrs[off_to] == 0
4320 && (!enc_utf8 || ScreenLinesUC[off_to] == 0)
4321 ) {
4322 ++off_to;
4323 ++col;
4324 }
4325 if (col <= endcol)
4326 screen_fill(row, row + 1, col + coloff,
4327 endcol + coloff + 1, ' ', ' ', 0);
4328 }
4329 col = endcol + 1;
4330 off_to = LineOffset[row] + col + coloff;
4331 off_from += col;
4332 endcol = (clear_width > 0 ? clear_width : -clear_width);
4333 }
4334
4335 redraw_next = char_needs_redraw(off_from, off_to, endcol - col);
4336
4337 while (col < endcol) {
4338 if (has_mbyte && (col + 1 < endcol))
4339 char_cells = (*mb_off2cells)(off_from, max_off_from);
4340 else
4341 char_cells = 1;
4342
4343 redraw_this = redraw_next;
4344 redraw_next = force || char_needs_redraw(off_from + CHAR_CELLSchar_cells,
4345 off_to + CHAR_CELLSchar_cells, endcol - col - CHAR_CELLSchar_cells);
4346
4347
4348 if (redraw_this) {
4349 /*
4350 * Special handling when 'xs' termcap flag set (hpterm):
4351 * Attributes for characters are stored at the position where the
4352 * cursor is when writing the highlighting code. The
4353 * start-highlighting code must be written with the cursor on the
4354 * first highlighted character. The stop-highlighting code must
4355 * be written with the cursor just after the last highlighted
4356 * character.
4357 * Overwriting a character doesn't remove it's highlighting. Need
4358 * to clear the rest of the line, and force redrawing it
4359 * completely.
4360 */
4361 if ( p_wiv
4362 && !force
4363 && ScreenAttrs[off_to] != 0
4364 && ScreenAttrs[off_from] != ScreenAttrs[off_to]) {
4365 /*
4366 * Need to remove highlighting attributes here.
4367 */
4368 windgoto(row, col + coloff);
4369 out_str(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)])); /* clear rest of this screen line */
4370 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
4371 force = TRUE1; /* force redraw of rest of the line */
4372 redraw_next = TRUE1; /* or else next char would miss out */
4373
4374 /*
4375 * If the previous character was highlighted, need to stop
4376 * highlighting at this character.
4377 */
4378 if (col + coloff > 0 && ScreenAttrs[off_to - 1] != 0) {
4379 screen_attr = ScreenAttrs[off_to - 1];
4380 term_windgoto(row, col + coloff);
4381 screen_stop_highlight();
4382 } else
4383 screen_attr = 0; /* highlighting has stopped */
4384 }
4385 if (enc_dbcs != 0) {
4386 /* Check if overwriting a double-byte with a single-byte or
4387 * the other way around requires another character to be
4388 * redrawn. For UTF-8 this isn't needed, because comparing
4389 * ScreenLinesUC[] is sufficient. */
4390 if (char_cells == 1
4391 && col + 1 < endcol
4392 && (*mb_off2cells)(off_to, max_off_to) > 1) {
4393 /* Writing a single-cell character over a double-cell
4394 * character: need to redraw the next cell. */
4395 ScreenLines[off_to + 1] = 0;
4396 redraw_next = TRUE1;
4397 } else if (char_cells == 2
4398 && col + 2 < endcol
4399 && (*mb_off2cells)(off_to, max_off_to) == 1
4400 && (*mb_off2cells)(off_to + 1, max_off_to) > 1) {
4401 /* Writing the second half of a double-cell character over
4402 * a double-cell character: need to redraw the second
4403 * cell. */
4404 ScreenLines[off_to + 2] = 0;
4405 redraw_next = TRUE1;
4406 }
4407
4408 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932)
4409 ScreenLines2[off_to] = ScreenLines2[off_from];
4410 }
4411 /* When writing a single-width character over a double-width
4412 * character and at the end of the redrawn text, need to clear out
4413 * the right halve of the old character.
4414 * Also required when writing the right halve of a double-width
4415 * char over the left halve of an existing one. */
4416 if (has_mbyte && col + char_cells == endcol
4417 && ((char_cells == 1
4418 && (*mb_off2cells)(off_to, max_off_to) > 1)
4419 || (char_cells == 2
4420 && (*mb_off2cells)(off_to, max_off_to) == 1
4421 && (*mb_off2cells)(off_to + 1, max_off_to) > 1)))
4422 clear_next = TRUE1;
4423
4424 ScreenLines[off_to] = ScreenLines[off_from];
4425 if (enc_utf8) {
4426 ScreenLinesUC[off_to] = ScreenLinesUC[off_from];
4427 if (ScreenLinesUC[off_from] != 0) {
4428 int i;
4429
4430 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i)
4431 ScreenLinesC[i][off_to] = ScreenLinesC[i][off_from];
4432 }
4433 }
4434 if (char_cells == 2)
4435 ScreenLines[off_to + 1] = ScreenLines[off_from + 1];
4436
4437#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(UNIX)
4438 /* The bold trick makes a single column of pixels appear in the
4439 * next character. When a bold character is removed, the next
4440 * character should be redrawn too. This happens for our own GUI
4441 * and for some xterms. */
4442 if (
4443# ifdef UNIX
4444 term_is_xterm
4445# endif
4446 ) {
4447 hl = ScreenAttrs[off_to];
4448 if (hl > HL_ALL0x3f)
4449 hl = syn_attr2attr(hl);
4450 if (hl & HL_BOLD0x02)
4451 redraw_next = TRUE1;
4452 }
4453#endif
4454 ScreenAttrs[off_to] = ScreenAttrs[off_from];
4455 /* For simplicity set the attributes of second half of a
4456 * double-wide character equal to the first half. */
4457 if (char_cells == 2)
4458 ScreenAttrs[off_to + 1] = ScreenAttrs[off_from];
4459
4460 if (enc_dbcs != 0 && char_cells == 2)
4461 screen_char_2(off_to, row, col + coloff);
4462 else
4463 screen_char(off_to, row, col + coloff);
4464 } else if ( p_wiv
4465 && col + coloff > 0) {
4466 if (ScreenAttrs[off_to] == ScreenAttrs[off_to - 1]) {
4467 /*
4468 * Don't output stop-highlight when moving the cursor, it will
4469 * stop the highlighting when it should continue.
4470 */
4471 screen_attr = 0;
4472 } else if (screen_attr != 0)
4473 screen_stop_highlight();
4474 }
4475
4476 off_to += CHAR_CELLSchar_cells;
4477 off_from += CHAR_CELLSchar_cells;
4478 col += CHAR_CELLSchar_cells;
4479 }
4480
4481 if (clear_next) {
4482 /* Clear the second half of a double-wide character of which the left
4483 * half was overwritten with a single-wide character. */
4484 ScreenLines[off_to] = ' ';
4485 if (enc_utf8)
4486 ScreenLinesUC[off_to] = 0;
4487 screen_char(off_to, row, col + coloff);
4488 }
4489
4490 if (clear_width > 0
4491 && !rlflag
4492 ) {
4493
4494 /* blank out the rest of the line */
4495 while (col < clear_width && ScreenLines[off_to] == ' '
4496 && ScreenAttrs[off_to] == 0
4497 && (!enc_utf8 || ScreenLinesUC[off_to] == 0)
4498 ) {
4499 ++off_to;
4500 ++col;
4501 }
4502 if (col < clear_width) {
4503 screen_fill(row, row + 1, col + coloff, clear_width + coloff,
4504 ' ', ' ', 0);
4505 off_to += clear_width - col;
4506 col = clear_width;
4507 }
4508 }
4509
4510 if (clear_width > 0) {
4511 /* For a window that's left of another, draw the separator char. */
4512 if (col + coloff < Columns) {
4513 int c;
4514
4515 c = fillchar_vsep(&hl);
4516 if (ScreenLines[off_to] != c
4517 || (enc_utf8 && (int)ScreenLinesUC[off_to]
4518 != (c >= 0x80 ? c : 0))
4519 || ScreenAttrs[off_to] != hl) {
4520 ScreenLines[off_to] = c;
4521 ScreenAttrs[off_to] = hl;
4522 if (enc_utf8) {
4523 if (c >= 0x80) {
4524 ScreenLinesUC[off_to] = c;
4525 ScreenLinesC[0][off_to] = 0;
4526 } else
4527 ScreenLinesUC[off_to] = 0;
4528 }
4529 screen_char(off_to, row, col + coloff);
4530 }
4531 } else
4532 LineWraps[row] = FALSE0;
4533 }
4534}
4535
4536/*
4537 * Mirror text "str" for right-left displaying.
4538 * Only works for single-byte characters (e.g., numbers).
4539 */
4540void rl_mirror(char_u *str)
4541{
4542 char_u *p1, *p2;
4543 int t;
4544
4545 for (p1 = str, p2 = str + STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str)) - 1; p1 < p2; ++p1, --p2) {
4546 t = *p1;
4547 *p1 = *p2;
4548 *p2 = t;
4549 }
4550}
4551
4552/*
4553 * mark all status lines for redraw; used after first :cd
4554 */
4555void status_redraw_all(void)
4556{
4557
4558 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
4559 if (wp->w_status_height) {
4560 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
4561 redraw_later(VALID10);
4562 }
4563 }
4564}
4565
4566/*
4567 * mark all status lines of the current buffer for redraw
4568 */
4569void status_redraw_curbuf(void)
4570{
4571 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
4572 if (wp->w_status_height != 0 && wp->w_buffer == curbuf) {
4573 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
4574 redraw_later(VALID10);
4575 }
4576 }
4577}
4578
4579/*
4580 * Redraw all status lines that need to be redrawn.
4581 */
4582void redraw_statuslines(void)
4583{
4584 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
4585 if (wp->w_redr_status) {
4586 win_redr_status(wp);
4587 }
4588 }
4589 if (redraw_tabline)
4590 draw_tabline();
4591}
4592
4593/*
4594 * Redraw all status lines at the bottom of frame "frp".
4595 */
4596void win_redraw_last_status(frame_T *frp)
4597{
4598 if (frp->fr_layout == FR_LEAF0)
4599 frp->fr_win->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
4600 else if (frp->fr_layout == FR_ROW1) {
4601 for (frp = frp->fr_child; frp != NULL((void*)0); frp = frp->fr_next)
4602 win_redraw_last_status(frp);
4603 } else { /* frp->fr_layout == FR_COL */
4604 frp = frp->fr_child;
4605 while (frp->fr_next != NULL((void*)0))
4606 frp = frp->fr_next;
4607 win_redraw_last_status(frp);
4608 }
4609}
4610
4611/*
4612 * Draw the verticap separator right of window "wp" starting with line "row".
4613 */
4614static void draw_vsep_win(win_T *wp, int row)
4615{
4616 int hl;
4617 int c;
4618
4619 if (wp->w_vsep_width) {
4620 /* draw the vertical separator right of this window */
4621 c = fillchar_vsep(&hl);
4622 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height,
4623 W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width), W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width) + 1,
4624 c, ' ', hl);
4625 }
4626}
4627
4628
4629/*
4630 * Get the length of an item as it will be shown in the status line.
4631 */
4632static int status_match_len(expand_T *xp, char_u *s)
4633{
4634 int len = 0;
4635
4636 int emenu = (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MENUS
4637 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MENUNAMES);
4638
4639 /* Check for menu separators - replace with '|'. */
4640 if (emenu && menu_is_separator(s))
4641 return 1;
4642
4643 while (*s != NUL'\000') {
4644 s += skip_status_match_char(xp, s);
4645 len += ptr2cells(s);
4646 mb_ptr_adv(s)s += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s) : 1;
4647 }
4648
4649 return len;
4650}
4651
4652/*
4653 * Return the number of characters that should be skipped in a status match.
4654 * These are backslashes used for escaping. Do show backslashes in help tags.
4655 */
4656static int skip_status_match_char(expand_T *xp, char_u *s)
4657{
4658 if ((rem_backslash(s) && xp->xp_context != EXPAND_HELP)
4659 || ((xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MENUS
4660 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MENUNAMES)
4661 && (s[0] == '\t' || (s[0] == '\\' && s[1] != NUL'\000')))
4662 ) {
4663#ifndef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4664 if (xp->xp_shell && csh_like_shell() && s[1] == '\\' && s[2] == '!')
4665 return 2;
4666#endif
4667 return 1;
4668 }
4669 return 0;
4670}
4671
4672/*
4673 * Show wildchar matches in the status line.
4674 * Show at least the "match" item.
4675 * We start at item 'first_match' in the list and show all matches that fit.
4676 *
4677 * If inversion is possible we use it. Else '=' characters are used.
4678 */
4679void
4680win_redr_status_matches (
4681 expand_T *xp,
4682 int num_matches,
4683 char_u **matches, /* list of matches */
4684 int match,
4685 int showtail
4686)
4687{
4688#define L_MATCH(m)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[m]) : matches[m]) (showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[m]) : matches[m])
4689 int row;
4690 char_u *buf;
4691 int len;
4692 int clen; /* length in screen cells */
4693 int fillchar;
4694 int attr;
4695 int i;
4696 int highlight = TRUE1;
4697 char_u *selstart = NULL((void*)0);
4698 int selstart_col = 0;
4699 char_u *selend = NULL((void*)0);
4700 static int first_match = 0;
4701 int add_left = FALSE0;
4702 char_u *s;
4703 int emenu;
4704 int l;
4705
4706 if (matches == NULL((void*)0)) /* interrupted completion? */
4707 return;
4708
4709 buf = xmalloc(has_mbyte ? Columns * MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1 : Columns + 1);
4710
4711 if (match == -1) { /* don't show match but original text */
4712 match = 0;
4713 highlight = FALSE0;
4714 }
4715 /* count 1 for the ending ">" */
4716 clen = status_match_len(xp, L_MATCH(match)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[match]) : matches[match])) + 3;
4717 if (match == 0)
4718 first_match = 0;
4719 else if (match < first_match) {
4720 /* jumping left, as far as we can go */
4721 first_match = match;
4722 add_left = TRUE1;
4723 } else {
4724 /* check if match fits on the screen */
4725 for (i = first_match; i < match; ++i)
4726 clen += status_match_len(xp, L_MATCH(i)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[i]) : matches[i])) + 2;
4727 if (first_match > 0)
4728 clen += 2;
4729 /* jumping right, put match at the left */
4730 if ((long)clen > Columns) {
4731 first_match = match;
4732 /* if showing the last match, we can add some on the left */
4733 clen = 2;
4734 for (i = match; i < num_matches; ++i) {
4735 clen += status_match_len(xp, L_MATCH(i)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[i]) : matches[i])) + 2;
4736 if ((long)clen >= Columns)
4737 break;
4738 }
4739 if (i == num_matches)
4740 add_left = TRUE1;
4741 }
4742 }
4743 if (add_left)
4744 while (first_match > 0) {
4745 clen += status_match_len(xp, L_MATCH(first_match - 1)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[first_match - 1]) : matches[first_match
- 1])) + 2;
4746 if ((long)clen >= Columns)
4747 break;
4748 --first_match;
4749 }
4750
4751 fillchar = fillchar_status(&attr, TRUE1);
4752
4753 if (first_match == 0) {
4754 *buf = NUL'\000';
4755 len = 0;
4756 } else {
4757 STRCPY(buf, "< ")strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)("< "));
4758 len = 2;
4759 }
4760 clen = len;
4761
4762 i = first_match;
4763 while ((long)(clen + status_match_len(xp, L_MATCH(i)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[i]) : matches[i])) + 2) < Columns) {
4764 if (i == match) {
4765 selstart = buf + len;
4766 selstart_col = clen;
4767 }
4768
4769 s = L_MATCH(i)(showtail ? sm_gettail(matches[i]) : matches[i]);
4770 /* Check for menu separators - replace with '|' */
4771 emenu = (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MENUS
4772 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MENUNAMES);
4773 if (emenu && menu_is_separator(s)) {
4774 STRCPY(buf + len, transchar('|'))strcpy((char *)(buf + len), (char *)(transchar('|')));
4775 l = (int)STRLEN(buf + len)strlen((char *)(buf + len));
4776 len += l;
4777 clen += l;
4778 } else
4779 for (; *s != NUL'\000'; ++s) {
4780 s += skip_status_match_char(xp, s);
4781 clen += ptr2cells(s);
4782 if (has_mbyte && (l = (*mb_ptr2len)(s)) > 1) {
4783 STRNCPY(buf + len, s, l)strncpy((char *)(buf + len), (char *)(s), (size_t)(l));
4784 s += l - 1;
4785 len += l;
4786 } else {
4787 STRCPY(buf + len, transchar_byte(*s))strcpy((char *)(buf + len), (char *)(transchar_byte(*s)));
4788 len += (int)STRLEN(buf + len)strlen((char *)(buf + len));
4789 }
4790 }
4791 if (i == match)
4792 selend = buf + len;
4793
4794 *(buf + len++) = ' ';
4795 *(buf + len++) = ' ';
4796 clen += 2;
4797 if (++i == num_matches)
4798 break;
4799 }
4800
4801 if (i != num_matches) {
4802 *(buf + len++) = '>';
4803 ++clen;
4804 }
4805
4806 buf[len] = NUL'\000';
4807
4808 row = cmdline_row - 1;
4809 if (row >= 0) {
4810 if (wild_menu_showing == 0) {
4811 if (msg_scrolled > 0) {
4812 /* Put the wildmenu just above the command line. If there is
4813 * no room, scroll the screen one line up. */
4814 if (cmdline_row == Rows - 1) {
4815 screen_del_lines(0, 0, 1, (int)Rows, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
4816 ++msg_scrolled;
4817 } else {
4818 ++cmdline_row;
4819 ++row;
4820 }
4821 wild_menu_showing = WM_SCROLLED2;
4822 } else {
4823 /* Create status line if needed by setting 'laststatus' to 2.
4824 * Set 'winminheight' to zero to avoid that the window is
4825 * resized. */
4826 if (lastwin->w_status_height == 0) {
4827 save_p_ls = p_ls;
4828 save_p_wmh = p_wmh;
4829 p_ls = 2;
4830 p_wmh = 0;
4831 last_status(FALSE0);
4832 }
4833 wild_menu_showing = WM_SHOWN1;
4834 }
4835 }
4836
4837 screen_puts(buf, row, 0, attr);
4838 if (selstart != NULL((void*)0) && highlight) {
4839 *selend = NUL'\000';
4840 screen_puts(selstart, row, selstart_col, hl_attr(HLF_WM)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_WM)]);
4841 }
4842
4843 screen_fill(row, row + 1, clen, (int)Columns, fillchar, fillchar, attr);
4844 }
4845
4846 win_redraw_last_status(topframe);
4847 free(buf);
4848}
4849
4850/*
4851 * Redraw the status line of window wp.
4852 *
4853 * If inversion is possible we use it. Else '=' characters are used.
4854 */
4855void win_redr_status(win_T *wp)
4856{
4857 int row;
4858 char_u *p;
4859 int len;
4860 int fillchar;
4861 int attr;
4862 int this_ru_col;
4863 static int busy = FALSE0;
4864
4865 /* It's possible to get here recursively when 'statusline' (indirectly)
4866 * invokes ":redrawstatus". Simply ignore the call then. */
4867 if (busy)
4868 return;
4869 busy = TRUE1;
4870
4871 wp->w_redr_status = FALSE0;
4872 if (wp->w_status_height == 0) {
4873 /* no status line, can only be last window */
4874 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
4875 } else if (!redrawing()
4876 /* don't update status line when popup menu is visible and may be
4877 * drawn over it */
4878 || pum_visible()
4879 ) {
4880 /* Don't redraw right now, do it later. */
4881 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
4882 } else if (*p_stl != NUL'\000' || *wp->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000') {
4883 /* redraw custom status line */
4884 redraw_custom_statusline(wp);
4885 } else {
4886 fillchar = fillchar_status(&attr, wp == curwin);
4887
4888 get_trans_bufname(wp->w_buffer);
4889 p = NameBuff;
4890 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
4891
4892 if (wp->w_buffer->b_help
4893 || wp->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw
4894 || bufIsChanged(wp->w_buffer)
4895 || wp->w_buffer->b_p_ro)
4896 *(p + len++) = ' ';
4897 if (wp->w_buffer->b_help) {
4898 STRCPY(p + len, _("[Help]"))strcpy((char *)(p + len), (char *)(gettext((char *)("[Help]")
)));
4899 len += (int)STRLEN(p + len)strlen((char *)(p + len));
4900 }
4901 if (wp->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw) {
4902 STRCPY(p + len, _("[Preview]"))strcpy((char *)(p + len), (char *)(gettext((char *)("[Preview]"
))));
4903 len += (int)STRLEN(p + len)strlen((char *)(p + len));
4904 }
4905 if (bufIsChanged(wp->w_buffer)) {
4906 STRCPY(p + len, "[+]")strcpy((char *)(p + len), (char *)("[+]"));
4907 len += 3;
4908 }
4909 if (wp->w_buffer->b_p_ro) {
4910 STRCPY(p + len, _("[RO]"))strcpy((char *)(p + len), (char *)(gettext((char *)("[RO]")))
);
4911 len += 4;
4912 }
4913
4914 this_ru_col = ru_col - (Columns - wp->w_width);
4915 if (this_ru_col < (wp->w_width + 1) / 2)
4916 this_ru_col = (wp->w_width + 1) / 2;
4917 if (this_ru_col <= 1) {
4918 p = (char_u *)"<"; /* No room for file name! */
4919 len = 1;
4920 } else if (has_mbyte) {
4921 int clen = 0, i;
4922
4923 /* Count total number of display cells. */
4924 clen = (int) mb_string2cells(p);
4925
4926 /* Find first character that will fit.
