4927 * Going from start to end is much faster for DBCS. */
4928 for (i = 0; p[i] != NUL'\000' && clen >= this_ru_col - 1;
4929 i += (*mb_ptr2len)(p + i))
4930 clen -= (*mb_ptr2cells)(p + i);
4931 len = clen;
4932 if (i > 0) {
4933 p = p + i - 1;
4934 *p = '<';
4935 ++len;
4936 }
4937
4938 } else if (len > this_ru_col - 1) {
4939 p += len - (this_ru_col - 1);
4940 *p = '<';
4941 len = this_ru_col - 1;
4942 }
4943
4944 row = wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height;
4945 screen_puts(p, row, wp->w_wincol, attr);
4946 screen_fill(row, row + 1, len + wp->w_wincol,
4947 this_ru_col + wp->w_wincol, fillchar, fillchar, attr);
4948
4949 if (get_keymap_str(wp, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096)
4950 && (int)(this_ru_col - len) > (int)(STRLEN(NameBuff)strlen((char *)(NameBuff)) + 1))
4951 screen_puts(NameBuff, row, (int)(this_ru_col - STRLEN(NameBuff)strlen((char *)(NameBuff))
4952 - 1 + wp->w_wincol), attr);
4953
4954 win_redr_ruler(wp, TRUE1);
4955 }
4956
4957 /*
4958 * May need to draw the character below the vertical separator.
4959 */
4960 if (wp->w_vsep_width != 0 && wp->w_status_height != 0 && redrawing()) {
4961 if (stl_connected(wp))
4962 fillchar = fillchar_status(&attr, wp == curwin);
4963 else
4964 fillchar = fillchar_vsep(&attr);
4965 screen_putchar(fillchar, wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height,
4966 W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width), attr);
4967 }
4968 busy = FALSE0;
4969}
4970
4971/*
4972 * Redraw the status line according to 'statusline' and take care of any
4973 * errors encountered.
4974 */
4975static void redraw_custom_statusline(win_T *wp)
4976{
4977 static int entered = FALSE0;
4978 int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
4979
4980 /* When called recursively return. This can happen when the statusline
4981 * contains an expression that triggers a redraw. */
4982 if (entered)
4983 return;
4984 entered = TRUE1;
4985
4986 called_emsg = FALSE0;
4987 win_redr_custom(wp, FALSE0);
4988 if (called_emsg) {
4989 /* When there is an error disable the statusline, otherwise the
4990 * display is messed up with errors and a redraw triggers the problem
4991 * again and again. */
4992 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"statusline", -1,
4993 (char_u *)"", OPT_FREE1 | (*wp->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000'
4994 ? OPT_LOCAL4 : OPT_GLOBAL2), SID_ERROR-5);
4995 }
4996 called_emsg |= save_called_emsg;
4997 entered = FALSE0;
4998}
4999
5000/*
5001 * Return TRUE if the status line of window "wp" is connected to the status
5002 * line of the window right of it. If not, then it's a vertical separator.
5003 * Only call if (wp->w_vsep_width != 0).
5004 */
5005int stl_connected(win_T *wp)
5006{
5007 frame_T *fr;
5008
5009 fr = wp->w_frame;
5010 while (fr->fr_parent != NULL((void*)0)) {
5011 if (fr->fr_parent->fr_layout == FR_COL2) {
5012 if (fr->fr_next != NULL((void*)0))
5013 break;
5014 } else {
5015 if (fr->fr_next != NULL((void*)0))
5016 return TRUE1;
5017 }
5018 fr = fr->fr_parent;
5019 }
5020 return FALSE0;
5021}
5022
5023
5024/*
5025 * Get the value to show for the language mappings, active 'keymap'.
5026 */
5027int
5028get_keymap_str (
5029 win_T *wp,
5030 char_u *buf, /* buffer for the result */
5031 int len /* length of buffer */
5032)
5033{
5034 char_u *p;
5035
5036 if (wp->w_buffer->b_p_iminsert != B_IMODE_LMAP1)
5037 return FALSE0;
5038
5039 {
5040 buf_T *old_curbuf = curbuf;
5041 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
5042 char_u *s;
5043
5044 curbuf = wp->w_buffer;
5045 curwin = wp;
5046 STRCPY(buf, "b:keymap_name")strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)("b:keymap_name")); /* must be writable */
5047 ++emsg_skip;
5048 s = p = eval_to_string(buf, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
5049 --emsg_skip;
5050 curbuf = old_curbuf;
5051 curwin = old_curwin;
5052 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || *p == NUL'\000') {
5053 if (wp->w_buffer->b_kmap_state & KEYMAP_LOADED2)
5054 p = wp->w_buffer->b_p_keymap;
5055 else
5056 p = (char_u *)"lang";
5057 }
5058 if ((int)(STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + 3) < len)
5059 sprintf((char *)buf, "<%s>", p);
5060 else
5061 buf[0] = NUL'\000';
5062 free(s);
5063 }
5064 return buf[0] != NUL'\000';
5065}
5066
5067/*
5068 * Redraw the status line or ruler of window "wp".
5069 * When "wp" is NULL redraw the tab pages line from 'tabline'.
5070 */
5071static void
5072win_redr_custom (
5073 win_T *wp,
5074 int draw_ruler /* TRUE or FALSE */
5075)
5076{
5077 static int entered = FALSE0;
5078 int attr;
5079 int curattr;
5080 int row;
5081 int col = 0;
5082 int maxwidth;
5083 int width;
5084 int n;
5085 int len;
5086 int fillchar;
5087 char_u buf[MAXPATHL4096];
5088 char_u *stl;
5089 char_u *p;
5090 struct stl_hlrec hltab[STL_MAX_ITEM80];
5091 struct stl_hlrec tabtab[STL_MAX_ITEM80];
5092 int use_sandbox = FALSE0;
5093 win_T *ewp;
5094 int p_crb_save;
5095
5096 /* There is a tiny chance that this gets called recursively: When
5097 * redrawing a status line triggers redrawing the ruler or tabline.
5098 * Avoid trouble by not allowing recursion. */
5099 if (entered)
5100 return;
5101 entered = TRUE1;
5102
5103 /* setup environment for the task at hand */
5104 if (wp == NULL((void*)0)) {
5105 /* Use 'tabline'. Always at the first line of the screen. */
5106 stl = p_tal;
5107 row = 0;
5108 fillchar = ' ';
5109 attr = hl_attr(HLF_TPF)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_TPF)];
5110 maxwidth = Columns;
5111 use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"tabline", 0);
5112 } else {
5113 row = wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height;
5114 fillchar = fillchar_status(&attr, wp == curwin);
5115 maxwidth = wp->w_width;
5116
5117 if (draw_ruler) {
5118 stl = p_ruf;
5119 /* advance past any leading group spec - implicit in ru_col */
5120 if (*stl == '%') {
5121 if (*++stl == '-')
5122 stl++;
5123 if (atoi((char *)stl))
5124 while (VIM_ISDIGIT(*stl)((unsigned)(*stl) - '0' < 10))
5125 stl++;
5126 if (*stl++ != '(')
5127 stl = p_ruf;
5128 }
5129 col = ru_col - (Columns - wp->w_width);
5130 if (col < (wp->w_width + 1) / 2)
5131 col = (wp->w_width + 1) / 2;
5132 maxwidth = wp->w_width - col;
5133 if (!wp->w_status_height) {
5134 row = Rows - 1;
5135 --maxwidth; /* writing in last column may cause scrolling */
5136 fillchar = ' ';
5137 attr = 0;
5138 }
5139
5140 use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"rulerformat", 0);
5141 } else {
5142 if (*wp->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000')
5143 stl = wp->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl;
5144 else
5145 stl = p_stl;
5146 use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"statusline",
5147 *wp->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl == NUL'\000' ? 0 : OPT_LOCAL4);
5148 }
5149
5150 col += wp->w_wincol;
5151 }
5152
5153 if (maxwidth <= 0)
5154 goto theend;
5155
5156 /* Temporarily reset 'cursorbind', we don't want a side effect from moving
5157 * the cursor away and back. */
5158 ewp = wp == NULL((void*)0) ? curwin : wp;
5159 p_crb_save = ewp->w_p_crbw_onebuf_opt.wo_crb;
5160 ewp->w_p_crbw_onebuf_opt.wo_crb = FALSE0;
5161
5162 /* Make a copy, because the statusline may include a function call that
5163 * might change the option value and free the memory. */
5164 stl = vim_strsave(stl);
5165 width = build_stl_str_hl(ewp, buf, sizeof(buf),
5166 stl, use_sandbox,
5167 fillchar, maxwidth, hltab, tabtab);
5168 free(stl);
5169 ewp->w_p_crbw_onebuf_opt.wo_crb = p_crb_save;
5170
5171 /* Make all characters printable. */
5172 p = transstr(buf);
5173 len = STRLCPY(buf, p, sizeof(buf))xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(p), (size_t)(sizeof(buf)));
5174 len = (size_t)len < sizeof(buf) ? len : (int)sizeof(buf) - 1;
5175 free(p);
5176
5177 /* fill up with "fillchar" */
5178 while (width < maxwidth && len < (int)sizeof(buf) - 1) {
5179 len += (*mb_char2bytes)(fillchar, buf + len);
5180 ++width;
5181 }
5182 buf[len] = NUL'\000';
5183
5184 /*
5185 * Draw each snippet with the specified highlighting.
5186 */
5187 curattr = attr;
5188 p = buf;
5189 for (n = 0; hltab[n].start != NULL((void*)0); n++) {
5190 int len = (int)(hltab[n].start - p);
5191 screen_puts_len(p, len, row, col, curattr);
5192 col += vim_strnsize(p, len);
5193 p = hltab[n].start;
5194
5195 if (hltab[n].userhl == 0)
5196 curattr = attr;
5197 else if (hltab[n].userhl < 0)
5198 curattr = syn_id2attr(-hltab[n].userhl);
5199 else if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && wp != curwin && wp->w_status_height != 0)
5200 curattr = highlight_stlnc[hltab[n].userhl - 1];
5201 else
5202 curattr = highlight_user[hltab[n].userhl - 1];
5203 }
5204 // Make sure to use an empty string instead of p, if p is beyond buf + len.
5205 screen_puts(p >= buf + len ? (char_u *)"" : p, row, col, curattr);
5206
5207 if (wp == NULL((void*)0)) {
5208 /* Fill the TabPageIdxs[] array for clicking in the tab pagesline. */
5209 col = 0;
5210 len = 0;
5211 p = buf;
5212 fillchar = 0;
5213 for (n = 0; tabtab[n].start != NULL((void*)0); n++) {
5214 len += vim_strnsize(p, (int)(tabtab[n].start - p));
5215 while (col < len)
5216 TabPageIdxs[col++] = fillchar;
5217 p = tabtab[n].start;
5218 fillchar = tabtab[n].userhl;
5219 }
5220 while (col < Columns)
5221 TabPageIdxs[col++] = fillchar;
5222 }
5223
5224theend:
5225 entered = FALSE0;
5226}
5227
5228
5229/*
5230 * Output a single character directly to the screen and update ScreenLines.
5231 */
5232void screen_putchar(int c, int row, int col, int attr)
5233{
5234 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
5235
5236 if (has_mbyte)
5237 buf[(*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf)] = NUL'\000';
5238 else {
5239 buf[0] = c;
5240 buf[1] = NUL'\000';
5241 }
5242 screen_puts(buf, row, col, attr);
5243}
5244
5245/*
5246 * Get a single character directly from ScreenLines into "bytes[]".
5247 * Also return its attribute in *attrp;
5248 */
5249void screen_getbytes(int row, int col, char_u *bytes, int *attrp)
5250{
5251 unsigned off;
5252
5253 /* safety check */
5254 if (ScreenLines != NULL((void*)0) && row < screen_Rows && col < screen_Columns) {
5255 off = LineOffset[row] + col;
5256 *attrp = ScreenAttrs[off];
5257 bytes[0] = ScreenLines[off];
5258 bytes[1] = NUL'\000';
5259
5260 if (enc_utf8 && ScreenLinesUC[off] != 0)
5261 bytes[utfc_char2bytes(off, bytes)] = NUL'\000';
5262 else if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && ScreenLines[off] == 0x8e) {
5263 bytes[0] = ScreenLines[off];
5264 bytes[1] = ScreenLines2[off];
5265 bytes[2] = NUL'\000';
5266 } else if (enc_dbcs && MB_BYTE2LEN(bytes[0])mb_bytelen_tab[bytes[0]] > 1) {
5267 bytes[1] = ScreenLines[off + 1];
5268 bytes[2] = NUL'\000';
5269 }
5270 }
5271}
5272
5273
5274/*
5275 * Return TRUE if composing characters for screen posn "off" differs from
5276 * composing characters in "u8cc".
5277 * Only to be used when ScreenLinesUC[off] != 0.
5278 */
5279static int screen_comp_differs(int off, int *u8cc)
5280{
5281 int i;
5282
5283 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i) {
5284 if (ScreenLinesC[i][off] != (u8char_T)u8cc[i])
5285 return TRUE1;
5286 if (u8cc[i] == 0)
5287 break;
5288 }
5289 return FALSE0;
5290}
5291
5292/*
5293 * Put string '*text' on the screen at position 'row' and 'col', with
5294 * attributes 'attr', and update ScreenLines[] and ScreenAttrs[].
5295 * Note: only outputs within one row, message is truncated at screen boundary!
5296 * Note: if ScreenLines[], row and/or col is invalid, nothing is done.
5297 */
5298void screen_puts(char_u *text, int row, int col, int attr)
5299{
5300 screen_puts_len(text, -1, row, col, attr);
5301}
5302
5303/*
5304 * Like screen_puts(), but output "text[len]". When "len" is -1 output up to
5305 * a NUL.
5306 */
5307void screen_puts_len(char_u *text, int textlen, int row, int col, int attr)
5308{
5309 unsigned off;
5310 char_u *ptr = text;
5311 int len = textlen;
5312 int c;
5313 unsigned max_off;
5314 int mbyte_blen = 1;
5315 int mbyte_cells = 1;
5316 int u8c = 0;
5317 int u8cc[MAX_MCO6];
5318 int clear_next_cell = FALSE0;
5319 int prev_c = 0; /* previous Arabic character */
5320 int pc, nc, nc1;
5321 int pcc[MAX_MCO6];
5322 int force_redraw_this;
5323 int force_redraw_next = FALSE0;
5324 int need_redraw;
5325
5326 if (ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0) || row >= screen_Rows) /* safety check */
5327 return;
5328 off = LineOffset[row] + col;
5329
5330 /* When drawing over the right halve of a double-wide char clear out the
5331 * left halve. Only needed in a terminal. */
5332 if (has_mbyte && col > 0 && col < screen_Columns
5333 && mb_fix_col(col, row) != col) {
5334 ScreenLines[off - 1] = ' ';
5335 ScreenAttrs[off - 1] = 0;
5336 if (enc_utf8) {
5337 ScreenLinesUC[off - 1] = 0;
5338 ScreenLinesC[0][off - 1] = 0;
5339 }
5340 /* redraw the previous cell, make it empty */
5341 screen_char(off - 1, row, col - 1);
5342 /* force the cell at "col" to be redrawn */
5343 force_redraw_next = TRUE1;
5344 }
5345
5346 max_off = LineOffset[row] + screen_Columns;
5347 while (col < screen_Columns
5348 && (len < 0 || (int)(ptr - text) < len)
5349 && *ptr != NUL'\000') {
5350 c = *ptr;
5351 /* check if this is the first byte of a multibyte */
5352 if (has_mbyte) {
5353 if (enc_utf8 && len > 0)
5354 mbyte_blen = utfc_ptr2len_len(ptr, (int)((text + len) - ptr));
5355 else
5356 mbyte_blen = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
5357 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && c == 0x8e)
5358 mbyte_cells = 1;
5359 else if (enc_dbcs != 0)
5360 mbyte_cells = mbyte_blen;
5361 else { /* enc_utf8 */
5362 if (len >= 0)
5363 u8c = utfc_ptr2char_len(ptr, u8cc,
5364 (int)((text + len) - ptr));
5365 else
5366 u8c = utfc_ptr2char(ptr, u8cc);
5367 mbyte_cells = utf_char2cells(u8c);
5368# ifdef UNICODE16
5369 /* Non-BMP character: display as ? or fullwidth ?. */
5370 if (u8c >= 0x10000) {
5371 u8c = (mbyte_cells == 2) ? 0xff1f : (int)'?';
5372 if (attr == 0)
5373 attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
5374 }
5375# endif
5376 if (p_arshape && !p_tbidi && arabic_char(u8c)) {
5377 /* Do Arabic shaping. */
5378 if (len >= 0 && (int)(ptr - text) + mbyte_blen >= len) {
5379 /* Past end of string to be displayed. */
5380 nc = NUL'\000';
5381 nc1 = NUL'\000';
5382 } else {
5383 nc = utfc_ptr2char_len(ptr + mbyte_blen, pcc,
5384 (int)((text + len) - ptr - mbyte_blen));
5385 nc1 = pcc[0];
5386 }
5387 pc = prev_c;
5388 prev_c = u8c;
5389 u8c = arabic_shape(u8c, &c, &u8cc[0], nc, nc1, pc);
5390 } else
5391 prev_c = u8c;
5392 if (col + mbyte_cells > screen_Columns) {
5393 /* Only 1 cell left, but character requires 2 cells:
5394 * display a '>' in the last column to avoid wrapping. */
5395 c = '>';
5396 mbyte_cells = 1;
5397 }
5398 }
5399 }
5400
5401 force_redraw_this = force_redraw_next;
5402 force_redraw_next = FALSE0;
5403
5404 need_redraw = ScreenLines[off] != c
5405 || (mbyte_cells == 2
5406 && ScreenLines[off + 1] != (enc_dbcs ? ptr[1] : 0))
5407 || (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932
5408 && c == 0x8e
5409 && ScreenLines2[off] != ptr[1])
5410 || (enc_utf8
5411 && (ScreenLinesUC[off] !=
5412 (u8char_T)(c < 0x80 && u8cc[0] == 0 ? 0 : u8c)
5413 || (ScreenLinesUC[off] != 0
5414 && screen_comp_differs(off, u8cc))))
5415 || ScreenAttrs[off] != attr
5416 || exmode_active;
5417
5418 if (need_redraw
5419 || force_redraw_this
5420 ) {
5421#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(UNIX)
5422 /* The bold trick makes a single row of pixels appear in the next
5423 * character. When a bold character is removed, the next
5424 * character should be redrawn too. This happens for our own GUI
5425 * and for some xterms. */
5426 if (need_redraw && ScreenLines[off] != ' ' && (
5427# ifdef UNIX
5428 term_is_xterm
5429# endif
5430 )) {
5431 int n = ScreenAttrs[off];
5432
5433 if (n > HL_ALL0x3f)
5434 n = syn_attr2attr(n);
5435 if (n & HL_BOLD0x02)
5436 force_redraw_next = TRUE1;
5437 }
5438#endif
5439 /* When at the end of the text and overwriting a two-cell
5440 * character with a one-cell character, need to clear the next
5441 * cell. Also when overwriting the left halve of a two-cell char
5442 * with the right halve of a two-cell char. Do this only once
5443 * (mb_off2cells() may return 2 on the right halve). */
5444 if (clear_next_cell)
5445 clear_next_cell = FALSE0;
5446 else if (has_mbyte
5447 && (len < 0 ? ptr[mbyte_blen] == NUL'\000'
5448 : ptr + mbyte_blen >= text + len)
5449 && ((mbyte_cells == 1 && (*mb_off2cells)(off, max_off) > 1)
5450 || (mbyte_cells == 2
5451 && (*mb_off2cells)(off, max_off) == 1
5452 && (*mb_off2cells)(off + 1, max_off) > 1)))
5453 clear_next_cell = TRUE1;
5454
5455 /* Make sure we never leave a second byte of a double-byte behind,
5456 * it confuses mb_off2cells(). */
5457 if (enc_dbcs
5458 && ((mbyte_cells == 1 && (*mb_off2cells)(off, max_off) > 1)
5459 || (mbyte_cells == 2
5460 && (*mb_off2cells)(off, max_off) == 1
5461 && (*mb_off2cells)(off + 1, max_off) > 1)))
5462 ScreenLines[off + mbyte_blen] = 0;
5463 ScreenLines[off] = c;
5464 ScreenAttrs[off] = attr;
5465 if (enc_utf8) {
5466 if (c < 0x80 && u8cc[0] == 0)
5467 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
5468 else {
5469 int i;
5470
5471 ScreenLinesUC[off] = u8c;
5472 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i) {
5473 ScreenLinesC[i][off] = u8cc[i];
5474 if (u8cc[i] == 0)
5475 break;
5476 }
5477 }
5478 if (mbyte_cells == 2) {
5479 ScreenLines[off + 1] = 0;
5480 ScreenAttrs[off + 1] = attr;
5481 }
5482 screen_char(off, row, col);
5483 } else if (mbyte_cells == 2) {
5484 ScreenLines[off + 1] = ptr[1];
5485 ScreenAttrs[off + 1] = attr;
5486 screen_char_2(off, row, col);
5487 } else if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && c == 0x8e) {
5488 ScreenLines2[off] = ptr[1];
5489 screen_char(off, row, col);
5490 } else
5491 screen_char(off, row, col);
5492 }
5493 if (has_mbyte) {
5494 off += mbyte_cells;
5495 col += mbyte_cells;
5496 ptr += mbyte_blen;
5497 if (clear_next_cell) {
5498 // This only happens at the end, display one space next.
5499 ptr = (char_u *)" ";
5500 len = -1;
5501 }
5502 } else {
5503 ++off;
5504 ++col;
5505 ++ptr;
5506 }
5507 }
5508
5509 /* If we detected the next character needs to be redrawn, but the text
5510 * doesn't extend up to there, update the character here. */
5511 if (force_redraw_next && col < screen_Columns) {
5512 if (enc_dbcs != 0 && dbcs_off2cells(off, max_off) > 1)
5513 screen_char_2(off, row, col);
5514 else
5515 screen_char(off, row, col);
5516 }
5517}
5518
5519/*
5520 * Prepare for 'hlsearch' highlighting.
5521 */
5522static void start_search_hl(void)
5523{
5524 if (p_hls && !no_hlsearch) {
5525 last_pat_prog(&search_hl.rm);
5526 search_hl.attr = hl_attr(HLF_L)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_L)];
5527 /* Set the time limit to 'redrawtime'. */
5528 search_hl.tm = profile_setlimit(p_rdt);
5529 }
5530}
5531
5532/*
5533 * Clean up for 'hlsearch' highlighting.
5534 */
5535static void end_search_hl(void)
5536{
5537 if (search_hl.rm.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
5538 vim_regfree(search_hl.rm.regprog);
5539 search_hl.rm.regprog = NULL((void*)0);
5540 }
5541}
5542
5543/*
5544 * Init for calling prepare_search_hl().
5545 */
5546static void init_search_hl(win_T *wp)
5547{
5548 matchitem_T *cur;
5549
5550 /* Setup for match and 'hlsearch' highlighting. Disable any previous
5551 * match */
5552 cur = wp->w_match_head;
5553 while (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
5554 cur->hl.rm = cur->match;
5555 if (cur->hlg_id == 0)
5556 cur->hl.attr = 0;
5557 else
5558 cur->hl.attr = syn_id2attr(cur->hlg_id);
5559 cur->hl.buf = wp->w_buffer;
5560 cur->hl.lnum = 0;
5561 cur->hl.first_lnum = 0;
5562 /* Set the time limit to 'redrawtime'. */
5563 cur->hl.tm = profile_setlimit(p_rdt);
5564 cur = cur->next;
5565 }
5566 search_hl.buf = wp->w_buffer;
5567 search_hl.lnum = 0;
5568 search_hl.first_lnum = 0;
5569 /* time limit is set at the toplevel, for all windows */
5570}
5571
5572/*
5573 * Advance to the match in window "wp" line "lnum" or past it.
5574 */
5575static void prepare_search_hl(win_T *wp, linenr_T lnum)
5576{
5577 matchitem_T *cur; /* points to the match list */
5578 match_T *shl; /* points to search_hl or a match */
5579 int shl_flag; /* flag to indicate whether search_hl
5580 has been processed or not */
5581 int n;
5582
5583 /*
5584 * When using a multi-line pattern, start searching at the top
5585 * of the window or just after a closed fold.
5586 * Do this both for search_hl and the match list.
5587 */
5588 cur = wp->w_match_head;
5589 shl_flag = FALSE0;
5590 while (cur != NULL((void*)0) || shl_flag == FALSE0) {
5591 if (shl_flag == FALSE0) {
5592 shl = &search_hl;
5593 shl_flag = TRUE1;
5594 } else
5595 shl = &cur->hl;
5596 if (shl->rm.regprog != NULL((void*)0)
5597 && shl->lnum == 0
5598 && re_multiline(shl->rm.regprog)) {
5599 if (shl->first_lnum == 0) {
5600 for (shl->first_lnum = lnum;
5601 shl->first_lnum > wp->w_topline; --shl->first_lnum)
5602 if (hasFoldingWin(wp, shl->first_lnum - 1,
5603 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), TRUE1, NULL((void*)0)))
5604 break;
5605 }
5606 if (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
5607 cur->pos.cur = 0;
5608 }
5609 bool_Bool pos_inprogress = true1; // mark that a position match search is
5610 // in progress
5611 n = 0;
5612 while (shl->first_lnum < lnum && (shl->rm.regprog != NULL((void*)0)
5613 || (cur != NULL((void*)0) && pos_inprogress))) {
5614 next_search_hl(wp, shl, shl->first_lnum, (colnr_T)n, cur);
5615 pos_inprogress = !(cur == NULL((void*)0) || cur->pos.cur == 0);
5616 if (shl->lnum != 0) {
5617 shl->first_lnum = shl->lnum
5618 + shl->rm.endpos[0].lnum
5619 - shl->rm.startpos[0].lnum;
5620 n = shl->rm.endpos[0].col;
5621 } else {
5622 ++shl->first_lnum;
5623 n = 0;
5624 }
5625 }
5626 }
5627 if (shl != &search_hl && cur != NULL((void*)0))
5628 cur = cur->next;
5629 }
5630}
5631
5632/*
5633 * Search for a next 'hlsearch' or match.
5634 * Uses shl->buf.
5635 * Sets shl->lnum and shl->rm contents.
5636 * Note: Assumes a previous match is always before "lnum", unless
5637 * shl->lnum is zero.
5638 * Careful: Any pointers for buffer lines will become invalid.
5639 */
5640static void
5641next_search_hl (
5642 win_T *win,
5643 match_T *shl, /* points to search_hl or a match */
5644 linenr_T lnum,
5645 colnr_T mincol, /* minimal column for a match */
5646 matchitem_T *cur /* to retrieve match positions if any */
5647)
5648{
5649 linenr_T l;
5650 colnr_T matchcol;
5651 long nmatched = 0;
5652
5653 if (shl->lnum != 0) {
5654 /* Check for three situations:
5655 * 1. If the "lnum" is below a previous match, start a new search.
5656 * 2. If the previous match includes "mincol", use it.
5657 * 3. Continue after the previous match.
5658 */
5659 l = shl->lnum + shl->rm.endpos[0].lnum - shl->rm.startpos[0].lnum;
5660 if (lnum > l)
5661 shl->lnum = 0;
5662 else if (lnum < l || shl->rm.endpos[0].col > mincol)
5663 return;
5664 }
5665
5666 /*
5667 * Repeat searching for a match until one is found that includes "mincol"
5668 * or none is found in this line.
5669 */
5670 called_emsg = FALSE0;
5671 for (;; ) {
5672 /* Stop searching after passing the time limit. */
5673 if (profile_passed_limit(shl->tm)) {
5674 shl->lnum = 0; /* no match found in time */
5675 break;
5676 }
5677 /* Three situations:
5678 * 1. No useful previous match: search from start of line.
5679 * 2. Not Vi compatible or empty match: continue at next character.
5680 * Break the loop if this is beyond the end of the line.
5681 * 3. Vi compatible searching: continue at end of previous match.
5682 */
5683 if (shl->lnum == 0)
5684 matchcol = 0;
5685 else if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_SEARCH'c') == NULL((void*)0)
5686 || (shl->rm.endpos[0].lnum == 0
5687 && shl->rm.endpos[0].col <= shl->rm.startpos[0].col)) {
5688 char_u *ml;
5689
5690 matchcol = shl->rm.startpos[0].col;
5691 ml = ml_get_buf(shl->buf, lnum, FALSE0) + matchcol;
5692 if (*ml == NUL'\000') {
5693 ++matchcol;
5694 shl->lnum = 0;
5695 break;
5696 }
5697 if (has_mbyte)
5698 matchcol += mb_ptr2len(ml);
5699 else
5700 ++matchcol;
5701 } else
5702 matchcol = shl->rm.endpos[0].col;
5703
5704 shl->lnum = lnum;
5705 if (shl->rm.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
5706 nmatched = vim_regexec_multi(&shl->rm, win, shl->buf, lnum, matchcol, &(shl->tm));
5707 if (called_emsg || got_int) {
5708 // Error while handling regexp: stop using this regexp.
5709 if (shl == &search_hl) {
5710 // don't free regprog in the match list, it's a copy
5711 vim_regfree(shl->rm.regprog);
5712 SET_NO_HLSEARCH(TRUE)no_hlsearch = (1); set_vim_var_nr( VV_HLSEARCH, !no_hlsearch);
5713 }
5714 shl->rm.regprog = NULL((void*)0);
5715 shl->lnum = 0;
5716 got_int = FALSE0; // avoid the "Type :quit to exit Vim" message
5717 break;
5718 }
5719 } else if (cur != NULL((void*)0)) {
5720 nmatched = next_search_hl_pos(shl, lnum, &(cur->pos), matchcol);
5721 }
5722 if (nmatched == 0) {
5723 shl->lnum = 0; /* no match found */
5724 break;
5725 }
5726 if (shl->rm.startpos[0].lnum > 0
5727 || shl->rm.startpos[0].col >= mincol
5728 || nmatched > 1
5729 || shl->rm.endpos[0].col > mincol) {
5730 shl->lnum += shl->rm.startpos[0].lnum;
5731 break; /* useful match found */
5732 }
5733 }
5734}
5735
5736static int
5737next_search_hl_pos(
5738 match_T *shl, // points to a match
5739 linenr_T lnum,
5740 posmatch_T *posmatch, // match positions
5741 colnr_T mincol // minimal column for a match
5742)
5743{
5744 int i;
5745 int bot = -1;
5746
5747 shl->lnum = 0;
5748 for (i = posmatch->cur; i < MAXPOSMATCH8; i++) {
5749 if (posmatch->pos[i].lnum == 0) {
5750 break;
5751 }
5752 if (posmatch->pos[i].col < mincol) {
5753 continue;
5754 }
5755 if (posmatch->pos[i].lnum == lnum) {
5756 if (shl->lnum == lnum) {
5757 // partially sort positions by column numbers
5758 // on the same line
5759 if (posmatch->pos[i].col < posmatch->pos[bot].col) {
5760 llpos_T tmp = posmatch->pos[i];
5761
5762 posmatch->pos[i] = posmatch->pos[bot];
5763 posmatch->pos[bot] = tmp;
5764 }
5765 } else {
5766 bot = i;
5767 shl->lnum = lnum;
5768 }
5769 }
5770 }
5771 posmatch->cur = 0;
5772 if (shl->lnum == lnum) {
5773 colnr_T start = posmatch->pos[bot].col == 0
5774 ? 0: posmatch->pos[bot].col - 1;
5775 colnr_T end = posmatch->pos[bot].col == 0
5776 ? MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL) : start + posmatch->pos[bot].len;
5777
5778 shl->rm.startpos[0].lnum = 0;
5779 shl->rm.startpos[0].col = start;
5780 shl->rm.endpos[0].lnum = 0;
5781 shl->rm.endpos[0].col = end;
5782 posmatch->cur = bot + 1;
5783 return true1;
5784 }
5785 return false0;
5786}
5787
5788
5789static void screen_start_highlight(int attr)
5790{
5791 attrentry_T *aep = NULL((void*)0);
5792
5793 screen_attr = attr;
5794 if (full_screen
5795 ) {
5796 {
5797 if (attr > HL_ALL0x3f) { /* special HL attr. */
5798 if (t_colors > 1)
5799 aep = syn_cterm_attr2entry(attr);
5800 else
5801 aep = syn_term_attr2entry(attr);
5802 if (aep == NULL((void*)0)) /* did ":syntax clear" */
5803 attr = 0;
5804 else
5805 attr = aep->ae_attr;
5806 }
5807 if ((attr & HL_BOLD0x02) && T_MD(term_strings[(int)(KS_MD)]) != NULL((void*)0)) /* bold */
5808 out_str(T_MD(term_strings[(int)(KS_MD)]));
5809 else if (aep != NULL((void*)0) && t_colors > 1 && aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color
5810 && cterm_normal_fg_bold)
5811 /* If the Normal FG color has BOLD attribute and the new HL
5812 * has a FG color defined, clear BOLD. */
5813 out_str(T_ME(term_strings[(int)(KS_ME)]));
5814 if ((attr & HL_STANDOUT0x20) && T_SO(term_strings[(int)(KS_SO)]) != NULL((void*)0)) /* standout */
5815 out_str(T_SO(term_strings[(int)(KS_SO)]));
5816 if ((attr & (HL_UNDERLINE0x08 | HL_UNDERCURL0x10)) && T_US(term_strings[(int)(KS_US)]) != NULL((void*)0))
5817 /* underline or undercurl */
5818 out_str(T_US(term_strings[(int)(KS_US)]));
5819 if ((attr & HL_ITALIC0x04) && T_CZH(term_strings[(int)(KS_CZH)]) != NULL((void*)0)) /* italic */
5820 out_str(T_CZH(term_strings[(int)(KS_CZH)]));
5821 if ((attr & HL_INVERSE0x01) && T_MR(term_strings[(int)(KS_MR)]) != NULL((void*)0)) /* inverse (reverse) */
5822 out_str(T_MR(term_strings[(int)(KS_MR)]));
5823
5824 /*
5825 * Output the color or start string after bold etc., in case the
5826 * bold etc. override the color setting.
5827 */
5828 if (aep != NULL((void*)0)) {
5829 if (t_colors > 1) {
5830 if (aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color)
5831 term_fg_color(aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color - 1);
5832 if (aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color)
5833 term_bg_color(aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color - 1);
5834 } else {
5835 if (aep->ae_u.term.start != NULL((void*)0))
5836 out_str(aep->ae_u.term.start);
5837 }
5838 }
5839 }
5840 }
5841}
5842
5843void screen_stop_highlight(void)
5844{
5845 int do_ME = FALSE0; /* output T_ME code */
5846
5847 if (screen_attr != 0
5848 ) {
5849 {
5850 if (screen_attr > HL_ALL0x3f) { /* special HL attr. */
5851 attrentry_T *aep;
5852
5853 if (t_colors > 1) {
5854 /*
5855 * Assume that t_me restores the original colors!
5856 */
5857 aep = syn_cterm_attr2entry(screen_attr);
5858 if (aep != NULL((void*)0) && (aep->ae_u.cterm.fg_color
5859 || aep->ae_u.cterm.bg_color))
5860 do_ME = TRUE1;
5861 } else {
5862 aep = syn_term_attr2entry(screen_attr);
5863 if (aep != NULL((void*)0) && aep->ae_u.term.stop != NULL((void*)0)) {
5864 if (STRCMP(aep->ae_u.term.stop, T_ME)strcmp((char *)(aep->ae_u.term.stop), (char *)((term_strings
[(int)(KS_ME)]))) == 0)
5865 do_ME = TRUE1;
5866 else
5867 out_str(aep->ae_u.term.stop);
5868 }
5869 }
5870 if (aep == NULL((void*)0)) /* did ":syntax clear" */
5871 screen_attr = 0;
5872 else
5873 screen_attr = aep->ae_attr;
5874 }
5875
5876 /*
5877 * Often all ending-codes are equal to T_ME. Avoid outputting the
5878 * same sequence several times.
5879 */
5880 if (screen_attr & HL_STANDOUT0x20) {
5881 if (STRCMP(T_SE, T_ME)strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_SE)])), (char *)((term_strings
[(int)(KS_ME)]))) == 0)
5882 do_ME = TRUE1;
5883 else
5884 out_str(T_SE(term_strings[(int)(KS_SE)]));
5885 }
5886 if (screen_attr & (HL_UNDERLINE0x08 | HL_UNDERCURL0x10)) {
5887 if (STRCMP(T_UE, T_ME)strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_UE)])), (char *)((term_strings
[(int)(KS_ME)]))) == 0)
5888 do_ME = TRUE1;
5889 else
5890 out_str(T_UE(term_strings[(int)(KS_UE)]));
5891 }
5892 if (screen_attr & HL_ITALIC0x04) {
5893 if (STRCMP(T_CZR, T_ME)strcmp((char *)((term_strings[(int)(KS_CZR)])), (char *)((term_strings
[(int)(KS_ME)]))) == 0)
5894 do_ME = TRUE1;
5895 else
5896 out_str(T_CZR(term_strings[(int)(KS_CZR)]));
5897 }
5898 if (do_ME || (screen_attr & (HL_BOLD0x02 | HL_INVERSE0x01)))
5899 out_str(T_ME(term_strings[(int)(KS_ME)]));
5900
5901 if (t_colors > 1) {
5902 /* set Normal cterm colors */
5903 if (cterm_normal_fg_color != 0)
5904 term_fg_color(cterm_normal_fg_color - 1);
5905 if (cterm_normal_bg_color != 0)
5906 term_bg_color(cterm_normal_bg_color - 1);
5907 if (cterm_normal_fg_bold)
5908 out_str(T_MD(term_strings[(int)(KS_MD)]));
5909 }
5910 }
5911 }
5912 screen_attr = 0;
5913}
5914
5915/*
5916 * Reset the colors for a cterm. Used when leaving Vim.
5917 * The machine specific code may override this again.
5918 */
5919void reset_cterm_colors(void)
5920{
5921 if (t_colors > 1) {
5922 /* set Normal cterm colors */
5923 if (cterm_normal_fg_color > 0 || cterm_normal_bg_color > 0) {
5924 out_str(T_OP(term_strings[(int)(KS_OP)]));
5925 screen_attr = -1;
5926 }
5927 if (cterm_normal_fg_bold) {
5928 out_str(T_ME(term_strings[(int)(KS_ME)]));
5929 screen_attr = -1;
5930 }
5931 }
5932}
5933
5934/*
5935 * Put character ScreenLines["off"] on the screen at position "row" and "col",
5936 * using the attributes from ScreenAttrs["off"].
5937 */
5938static void screen_char(unsigned off, int row, int col)
5939{
5940 int attr;
5941
5942 /* Check for illegal values, just in case (could happen just after
5943 * resizing). */
5944 if (row >= screen_Rows || col >= screen_Columns)
5945 return;
5946
5947 /* Outputting the last character on the screen may scrollup the screen.
5948 * Don't to it! Mark the character invalid (update it when scrolled up) */
5949 if (row == screen_Rows - 1 && col == screen_Columns - 1
5950 /* account for first command-line character in rightleft mode */
5951 && !cmdmsg_rl
5952 ) {
5953 ScreenAttrs[off] = (sattr_T)-1;
5954 return;
5955 }
5956
5957 /*
5958 * Stop highlighting first, so it's easier to move the cursor.
5959 */
5960 if (screen_char_attr != 0)
5961 attr = screen_char_attr;
5962 else
5963 attr = ScreenAttrs[off];
5964 if (screen_attr != attr)
5965 screen_stop_highlight();
5966
5967 windgoto(row, col);
5968
5969 if (screen_attr != attr)
5970 screen_start_highlight(attr);
5971
5972 if (enc_utf8 && ScreenLinesUC[off] != 0) {
5973 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
5974
5975 /* Convert UTF-8 character to bytes and write it. */
5976
5977 buf[utfc_char2bytes(off, buf)] = NUL'\000';
5978
5979 out_str(buf);
5980 if (utf_char2cells(ScreenLinesUC[off]) > 1)
5981 ++screen_cur_col;
5982 } else {
5983 out_flush_check();
5984 out_char(ScreenLines[off]);
5985 /* double-byte character in single-width cell */
5986 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && ScreenLines[off] == 0x8e)
5987 out_char(ScreenLines2[off]);
5988 }
5989
5990 screen_cur_col++;
5991}
5992
5993
5994/*
5995 * Used for enc_dbcs only: Put one double-wide character at ScreenLines["off"]
5996 * on the screen at position 'row' and 'col'.
5997 * The attributes of the first byte is used for all. This is required to
5998 * output the two bytes of a double-byte character with nothing in between.
5999 */
6000static void screen_char_2(unsigned off, int row, int col)
6001{
6002 /* Check for illegal values (could be wrong when screen was resized). */
6003 if (off + 1 >= (unsigned)(screen_Rows * screen_Columns))
6004 return;
6005
6006 /* Outputting the last character on the screen may scrollup the screen.
6007 * Don't to it! Mark the character invalid (update it when scrolled up) */
6008 if (row == screen_Rows - 1 && col >= screen_Columns - 2) {
6009 ScreenAttrs[off] = (sattr_T)-1;
6010 return;
6011 }
6012
6013 /* Output the first byte normally (positions the cursor), then write the
6014 * second byte directly. */
6015 screen_char(off, row, col);
6016 out_char(ScreenLines[off + 1]);
6017 ++screen_cur_col;
6018}
6019
6020/*
6021 * Draw a rectangle of the screen, inverted when "invert" is TRUE.
6022 * This uses the contents of ScreenLines[] and doesn't change it.
6023 */
6024void screen_draw_rectangle(int row, int col, int height, int width, int invert)
6025{
6026 int r, c;
6027 int off;
6028 int max_off;
6029
6030 /* Can't use ScreenLines unless initialized */
6031 if (ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0))
6032 return;
6033
6034 if (invert)
6035 screen_char_attr = HL_INVERSE0x01;
6036 for (r = row; r < row + height; ++r) {
6037 off = LineOffset[r];
6038 max_off = off + screen_Columns;
6039 for (c = col; c < col + width; ++c) {
6040 if (enc_dbcs != 0 && dbcs_off2cells(off + c, max_off) > 1) {
6041 screen_char_2(off + c, r, c);
6042 ++c;
6043 } else {
6044 screen_char(off + c, r, c);
6045 if (utf_off2cells(off + c, max_off) > 1)
6046 ++c;
6047 }
6048 }
6049 }
6050 screen_char_attr = 0;
6051}
6052
6053/*
6054 * Redraw the characters for a vertically split window.
6055 */
6056static void redraw_block(int row, int end, win_T *wp)
6057{
6058 int col;
6059 int width;
6060
6061
6062 if (wp == NULL((void*)0)) {
6063 col = 0;
6064 width = Columns;
6065 } else {
6066 col = wp->w_wincol;
6067 width = wp->w_width;
6068 }
6069 screen_draw_rectangle(row, col, end - row, width, FALSE0);
6070}
6071
6072/*
6073 * Fill the screen from 'start_row' to 'end_row', from 'start_col' to 'end_col'
6074 * with character 'c1' in first column followed by 'c2' in the other columns.
6075 * Use attributes 'attr'.
6076 */
6077void screen_fill(int start_row, int end_row, int start_col, int end_col, int c1, int c2, int attr)
6078{
6079 int row;
6080 int col;
6081 int off;
6082 int end_off;
6083 int did_delete;
6084 int c;
6085 int norm_term;
6086#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(UNIX)
6087 int force_next = FALSE0;
6088#endif
6089
6090 if (end_row > screen_Rows) /* safety check */
6091 end_row = screen_Rows;
6092 if (end_col > screen_Columns) /* safety check */
6093 end_col = screen_Columns;
6094 if (ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0)
6095 || start_row >= end_row
6096 || start_col >= end_col) /* nothing to do */
6097 return;
6098
6099 /* it's a "normal" terminal when not in a GUI or cterm */
6100 norm_term = (
6101 t_colors <= 1);
6102 for (row = start_row; row < end_row; ++row) {
6103 if (has_mbyte
6104 ) {
6105 /* When drawing over the right halve of a double-wide char clear
6106 * out the left halve. When drawing over the left halve of a
6107 * double wide-char clear out the right halve. Only needed in a
6108 * terminal. */
6109 if (start_col > 0 && mb_fix_col(start_col, row) != start_col)
6110 screen_puts_len((char_u *)" ", 1, row, start_col - 1, 0);
6111 if (end_col < screen_Columns && mb_fix_col(end_col, row) != end_col)
6112 screen_puts_len((char_u *)" ", 1, row, end_col, 0);
6113 }
6114 /*
6115 * Try to use delete-line termcap code, when no attributes or in a
6116 * "normal" terminal, where a bold/italic space is just a
6117 * space.
6118 */
6119 did_delete = FALSE0;
6120 if (c2 == ' '
6121 && end_col == Columns
6122 && can_clear(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)]))
6123 && (attr == 0
6124 || (norm_term
6125 && attr <= HL_ALL0x3f
6126 && ((attr & ~(HL_BOLD0x02 | HL_ITALIC0x04)) == 0)))) {
6127 /*
6128 * check if we really need to clear something
6129 */
6130 col = start_col;
6131 if (c1 != ' ') /* don't clear first char */
6132 ++col;
6133
6134 off = LineOffset[row] + col;
6135 end_off = LineOffset[row] + end_col;
6136
6137 /* skip blanks (used often, keep it fast!) */
6138 if (enc_utf8)
6139 while (off < end_off && ScreenLines[off] == ' '
6140 && ScreenAttrs[off] == 0 && ScreenLinesUC[off] == 0)
6141 ++off;
6142 else
6143 while (off < end_off && ScreenLines[off] == ' '
6144 && ScreenAttrs[off] == 0)
6145 ++off;
6146 if (off < end_off) { /* something to be cleared */
6147 col = off - LineOffset[row];
6148 screen_stop_highlight();
6149 term_windgoto(row, col); /* clear rest of this screen line */
6150 out_str(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)]));
6151 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
6152 col = end_col - col;
6153 while (col--) { /* clear chars in ScreenLines */
6154 ScreenLines[off] = ' ';
6155 if (enc_utf8)
6156 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
6157 ScreenAttrs[off] = 0;
6158 ++off;
6159 }
6160 }
6161 did_delete = TRUE1; /* the chars are cleared now */
6162 }
6163
6164 off = LineOffset[row] + start_col;
6165 c = c1;
6166 for (col = start_col; col < end_col; ++col) {
6167 if (ScreenLines[off] != c
6168 || (enc_utf8 && (int)ScreenLinesUC[off]
6169 != (c >= 0x80 ? c : 0))
6170 || ScreenAttrs[off] != attr
6171#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(UNIX)
6172 || force_next
6173#endif
6174 ) {
6175#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(UNIX)
6176 /* The bold trick may make a single row of pixels appear in
6177 * the next character. When a bold character is removed, the
6178 * next character should be redrawn too. This happens for our
6179 * own GUI and for some xterms. */
6180 if (
6181# ifdef UNIX
6182 term_is_xterm
6183# endif
6184 ) {
6185 if (ScreenLines[off] != ' '
6186 && (ScreenAttrs[off] > HL_ALL0x3f
6187 || ScreenAttrs[off] & HL_BOLD0x02))
6188 force_next = TRUE1;
6189 else
6190 force_next = FALSE0;
6191 }
6192#endif
6193 ScreenLines[off] = c;
6194 if (enc_utf8) {
6195 if (c >= 0x80) {
6196 ScreenLinesUC[off] = c;
6197 ScreenLinesC[0][off] = 0;
6198 } else
6199 ScreenLinesUC[off] = 0;
6200 }
6201 ScreenAttrs[off] = attr;
6202 if (!did_delete || c != ' ')
6203 screen_char(off, row, col);
6204 }
6205 ++off;
6206 if (col == start_col) {
6207 if (did_delete)
6208 break;
6209 c = c2;
6210 }
6211 }
6212 if (end_col == Columns)
6213 LineWraps[row] = FALSE0;
6214 if (row == Rows - 1) { /* overwritten the command line */
6215 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
6216 if (c1 == ' ' && c2 == ' ')
6217 clear_cmdline = FALSE0; /* command line has been cleared */
6218 if (start_col == 0)
6219 mode_displayed = FALSE0; /* mode cleared or overwritten */
6220 }
6221 }
6222}
6223
6224/*
6225 * Check if there should be a delay. Used before clearing or redrawing the
6226 * screen or the command line.
6227 */
6228void check_for_delay(int check_msg_scroll)
6229{
6230 if ((emsg_on_display || (check_msg_scroll && msg_scroll))
6231 && !did_wait_return
6232 && emsg_silent == 0) {
6233 out_flush();
6234 ui_delay(1000L, true1);
6235 emsg_on_display = FALSE0;
6236 if (check_msg_scroll)
6237 msg_scroll = FALSE0;
6238 }
6239}
6240
6241/*
6242 * screen_valid - allocate screen buffers if size changed
6243 * If "doclear" is TRUE: clear screen if it has been resized.
6244 * Returns TRUE if there is a valid screen to write to.
6245 * Returns FALSE when starting up and screen not initialized yet.
6246 */
6247int screen_valid(int doclear)
6248{
6249 screenalloc(doclear); /* allocate screen buffers if size changed */
6250 return ScreenLines != NULL((void*)0);
6251}
6252
6253/*
6254 * Resize the shell to Rows and Columns.
6255 * Allocate ScreenLines[] and associated items.
6256 *
6257 * There may be some time between setting Rows and Columns and (re)allocating
6258 * ScreenLines[]. This happens when starting up and when (manually) changing
6259 * the shell size. Always use screen_Rows and screen_Columns to access items
6260 * in ScreenLines[]. Use Rows and Columns for positioning text etc. where the
6261 * final size of the shell is needed.
6262 */
6263void screenalloc(bool_Bool doclear)
6264{
6265 int new_row, old_row;
6266 int outofmem = FALSE0;
6267 int len;
6268 schar_T *new_ScreenLines;
6269 u8char_T *new_ScreenLinesUC = NULL((void*)0);
6270 u8char_T *new_ScreenLinesC[MAX_MCO6];
6271 schar_T *new_ScreenLines2 = NULL((void*)0);
6272 int i;
6273 sattr_T *new_ScreenAttrs;
6274 unsigned *new_LineOffset;
6275 char_u *new_LineWraps;
6276 short *new_TabPageIdxs;
6277 static int entered = FALSE0; /* avoid recursiveness */
6278 static int done_outofmem_msg = FALSE0; /* did outofmem message */
6279 int retry_count = 0;
6280
6281retry:
6282 /*
6283 * Allocation of the screen buffers is done only when the size changes and
6284 * when Rows and Columns have been set and we have started doing full
6285 * screen stuff.
6286 */
6287 if ((ScreenLines != NULL((void*)0)
6288 && Rows == screen_Rows
6289 && Columns == screen_Columns
6290 && enc_utf8 == (ScreenLinesUC != NULL((void*)0))
6291 && (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932) == (ScreenLines2 != NULL((void*)0))
6292 && p_mco == Screen_mco
6293 )
6294 || Rows == 0
6295 || Columns == 0
6296 || (!full_screen && ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0)))
6297 return;
6298
6299 /*
6300 * It's possible that we produce an out-of-memory message below, which
6301 * will cause this function to be called again. To break the loop, just
6302 * return here.
6303 */
6304 if (entered)
6305 return;
6306 entered = TRUE1;
6307
6308 /*
6309 * Note that the window sizes are updated before reallocating the arrays,
6310 * thus we must not redraw here!
6311 */
6312 ++RedrawingDisabled;
6313
6314 win_new_shellsize(); /* fit the windows in the new sized shell */
6315
6316 comp_col(); /* recompute columns for shown command and ruler */
6317
6318 /*
6319 * We're changing the size of the screen.
6320 * - Allocate new arrays for ScreenLines and ScreenAttrs.
6321 * - Move lines from the old arrays into the new arrays, clear extra
6322 * lines (unless the screen is going to be cleared).
6323 * - Free the old arrays.
6324 *
6325 * If anything fails, make ScreenLines NULL, so we don't do anything!
6326 * Continuing with the old ScreenLines may result in a crash, because the
6327 * size is wrong.
6328 */
6329 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
6330 win_free_lsize(wp);
6331 }
6332 if (aucmd_win != NULL((void*)0))
6333 win_free_lsize(aucmd_win);
6334
6335 new_ScreenLines = xmalloc((size_t)((Rows + 1) * Columns * sizeof(schar_T)));
6336 memset(new_ScreenLinesC, 0, sizeof(u8char_T *) * MAX_MCO6);
6337 if (enc_utf8) {
6338 new_ScreenLinesUC = xmalloc(
6339 (size_t)((Rows + 1) * Columns * sizeof(u8char_T)));
6340 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
6341 new_ScreenLinesC[i] = xcalloc((Rows + 1) * Columns, sizeof(u8char_T));
6342 }
6343 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932)
6344 new_ScreenLines2 = xmalloc(
6345 (size_t)((Rows + 1) * Columns * sizeof(schar_T)));
6346 new_ScreenAttrs = xmalloc((size_t)((Rows + 1) * Columns * sizeof(sattr_T)));
6347 new_LineOffset = xmalloc((size_t)(Rows * sizeof(unsigned)));
6348 new_LineWraps = xmalloc((size_t)(Rows * sizeof(char_u)));
6349 new_TabPageIdxs = xmalloc((size_t)(Columns * sizeof(short)));
6350
6351 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
6352 win_alloc_lines(wp);
6353 }
6354 if (aucmd_win != NULL((void*)0) && aucmd_win->w_lines == NULL((void*)0)) {
6355 win_alloc_lines(aucmd_win);
6356 }
6357
6358 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
6359 if (new_ScreenLinesC[i] == NULL((void*)0))
6360 break;
6361 if (new_ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0)
6362 || (enc_utf8 && (new_ScreenLinesUC == NULL((void*)0) || i != p_mco))
6363 || (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && new_ScreenLines2 == NULL((void*)0))
6364 || new_ScreenAttrs == NULL((void*)0)
6365 || new_LineOffset == NULL((void*)0)
6366 || new_LineWraps == NULL((void*)0)
6367 || new_TabPageIdxs == NULL((void*)0)
6368 || outofmem) {
6369 if (ScreenLines != NULL((void*)0) || !done_outofmem_msg) {
6370 /* guess the size */
6371 do_outofmem_msg((Rows + 1) * Columns);
6372
6373 /* Remember we did this to avoid getting outofmem messages over
6374 * and over again. */
6375 done_outofmem_msg = TRUE1;
6376 }
6377 free(new_ScreenLines);
6378 new_ScreenLines = NULL((void*)0);
6379 free(new_ScreenLinesUC);
6380 new_ScreenLinesUC = NULL((void*)0);
6381 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i) {
6382 free(new_ScreenLinesC[i]);
6383 new_ScreenLinesC[i] = NULL((void*)0);
6384 }
6385 free(new_ScreenLines2);
6386 new_ScreenLines2 = NULL((void*)0);
6387 free(new_ScreenAttrs);
6388 new_ScreenAttrs = NULL((void*)0);
6389 free(new_LineOffset);
6390 new_LineOffset = NULL((void*)0);
6391 free(new_LineWraps);
6392 new_LineWraps = NULL((void*)0);
6393 free(new_TabPageIdxs);
6394 new_TabPageIdxs = NULL((void*)0);
6395 } else {
6396 done_outofmem_msg = FALSE0;
6397
6398 for (new_row = 0; new_row < Rows; ++new_row) {
6399 new_LineOffset[new_row] = new_row * Columns;
6400 new_LineWraps[new_row] = FALSE0;
6401
6402 /*
6403 * If the screen is not going to be cleared, copy as much as
6404 * possible from the old screen to the new one and clear the rest
6405 * (used when resizing the window at the "--more--" prompt or when
6406 * executing an external command, for the GUI).
6407 */
6408 if (!doclear) {
6409 (void)memset(new_ScreenLines + new_row * Columns,
6410 ' ', (size_t)Columns * sizeof(schar_T));
6411 if (enc_utf8) {
6412 (void)memset(new_ScreenLinesUC + new_row * Columns,
6413 0, (size_t)Columns * sizeof(u8char_T));
6414 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
6415 (void)memset(new_ScreenLinesC[i]
6416 + new_row * Columns,
6417 0, (size_t)Columns * sizeof(u8char_T));
6418 }
6419 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932)
6420 (void)memset(new_ScreenLines2 + new_row * Columns,
6421 0, (size_t)Columns * sizeof(schar_T));
6422 (void)memset(new_ScreenAttrs + new_row * Columns,
6423 0, (size_t)Columns * sizeof(sattr_T));
6424 old_row = new_row + (screen_Rows - Rows);
6425 if (old_row >= 0 && ScreenLines != NULL((void*)0)) {
6426 if (screen_Columns < Columns)
6427 len = screen_Columns;
6428 else
6429 len = Columns;
6430 /* When switching to utf-8 don't copy characters, they
6431 * may be invalid now. Also when p_mco changes. */
6432 if (!(enc_utf8 && ScreenLinesUC == NULL((void*)0))
6433 && p_mco == Screen_mco)
6434 memmove(new_ScreenLines + new_LineOffset[new_row],
6435 ScreenLines + LineOffset[old_row],
6436 (size_t)len * sizeof(schar_T));
6437 if (enc_utf8 && ScreenLinesUC != NULL((void*)0)
6438 && p_mco == Screen_mco) {
6439 memmove(new_ScreenLinesUC + new_LineOffset[new_row],
6440 ScreenLinesUC + LineOffset[old_row],
6441 (size_t)len * sizeof(u8char_T));
6442 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
6443 memmove(new_ScreenLinesC[i]
6444 + new_LineOffset[new_row],
6445 ScreenLinesC[i] + LineOffset[old_row],
6446 (size_t)len * sizeof(u8char_T));
6447 }
6448 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932 && ScreenLines2 != NULL((void*)0))
6449 memmove(new_ScreenLines2 + new_LineOffset[new_row],
6450 ScreenLines2 + LineOffset[old_row],
6451 (size_t)len * sizeof(schar_T));
6452 memmove(new_ScreenAttrs + new_LineOffset[new_row],
6453 ScreenAttrs + LineOffset[old_row],
6454 (size_t)len * sizeof(sattr_T));
6455 }
6456 }
6457 }
6458 /* Use the last line of the screen for the current line. */
6459 current_ScreenLine = new_ScreenLines + Rows * Columns;
6460 }
6461
6462 free_screenlines();
6463
6464 ScreenLines = new_ScreenLines;
6465 ScreenLinesUC = new_ScreenLinesUC;
6466 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
6467 ScreenLinesC[i] = new_ScreenLinesC[i];
6468 Screen_mco = p_mco;
6469 ScreenLines2 = new_ScreenLines2;
6470 ScreenAttrs = new_ScreenAttrs;
6471 LineOffset = new_LineOffset;
6472 LineWraps = new_LineWraps;
6473 TabPageIdxs = new_TabPageIdxs;
6474
6475 /* It's important that screen_Rows and screen_Columns reflect the actual
6476 * size of ScreenLines[]. Set them before calling anything. */
6477 screen_Rows = Rows;
6478 screen_Columns = Columns;
6479
6480 must_redraw = CLEAR50; /* need to clear the screen later */
6481 if (doclear)
6482 screenclear2();
6483
6484
6485 entered = FALSE0;
6486 --RedrawingDisabled;
6487
6488 /*
6489 * Do not apply autocommands more than 3 times to avoid an endless loop
6490 * in case applying autocommands always changes Rows or Columns.
6491 */
6492 if (starting == 0 && ++retry_count <= 3) {
6493 apply_autocmds(EVENT_VIMRESIZED, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
6494 /* In rare cases, autocommands may have altered Rows or Columns,
6495 * jump back to check if we need to allocate the screen again. */
6496 goto retry;
6497 }
6498}
6499
6500void free_screenlines(void)
6501{
6502 int i;
6503
6504 free(ScreenLinesUC);
6505 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco; ++i)
6506 free(ScreenLinesC[i]);
6507 free(ScreenLines2);
6508 free(ScreenLines);
6509 free(ScreenAttrs);
6510 free(LineOffset);
6511 free(LineWraps);
6512 free(TabPageIdxs);
6513}
6514
6515void screenclear(void)
6516{
6517 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
6518 screenalloc(false0); /* allocate screen buffers if size changed */
6519 screenclear2(); /* clear the screen */
6520}
6521
6522static void screenclear2(void)
6523{
6524 int i;
6525
6526 if (starting == NO_SCREEN2 || ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0)
6527 )
6528 return;
6529
6530 screen_attr = -1; /* force setting the Normal colors */
6531 screen_stop_highlight(); /* don't want highlighting here */
6532
6533
6534 /* blank out ScreenLines */
6535 for (i = 0; i < Rows; ++i) {
6536 lineclear(LineOffset[i], (int)Columns);
6537 LineWraps[i] = FALSE0;
6538 }
6539
6540 if (can_clear(T_CL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CL)]))) {
6541 out_str(T_CL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CL)])); /* clear the display */
6542 clear_cmdline = FALSE0;
6543 mode_displayed = FALSE0;
6544 } else {
6545 /* can't clear the screen, mark all chars with invalid attributes */
6546 for (i = 0; i < Rows; ++i)
6547 lineinvalid(LineOffset[i], (int)Columns);
6548 clear_cmdline = TRUE1;
6549 }
6550
6551 screen_cleared = TRUE1; /* can use contents of ScreenLines now */
6552
6553 win_rest_invalid(firstwin);
6554 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
6555 redraw_tabline = TRUE1;
6556 if (must_redraw == CLEAR50) /* no need to clear again */
6557 must_redraw = NOT_VALID40;
6558 compute_cmdrow();
6559 msg_row = cmdline_row; /* put cursor on last line for messages */
6560 msg_col = 0;
6561 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
6562 msg_scrolled = 0; /* can't scroll back */
6563 msg_didany = FALSE0;
6564 msg_didout = FALSE0;
6565}
6566
6567/*
6568 * Clear one line in ScreenLines.
6569 */
6570static void lineclear(unsigned off, int width)
6571{
6572 (void)memset(ScreenLines + off, ' ', (size_t)width * sizeof(schar_T));
6573 if (enc_utf8)
6574 (void)memset(ScreenLinesUC + off, 0,
6575 (size_t)width * sizeof(u8char_T));
6576 (void)memset(ScreenAttrs + off, 0, (size_t)width * sizeof(sattr_T));
6577}
6578
6579/*
6580 * Mark one line in ScreenLines invalid by setting the attributes to an
6581 * invalid value.
6582 */
6583static void lineinvalid(unsigned off, int width)
6584{
6585 (void)memset(ScreenAttrs + off, -1, (size_t)width * sizeof(sattr_T));
6586}
6587
6588/*
6589 * Copy part of a Screenline for vertically split window "wp".
6590 */
6591static void linecopy(int to, int from, win_T *wp)
6592{
6593 unsigned off_to = LineOffset[to] + wp->w_wincol;
6594 unsigned off_from = LineOffset[from] + wp->w_wincol;
6595
6596 memmove(ScreenLines + off_to, ScreenLines + off_from,
6597 wp->w_width * sizeof(schar_T));
6598 if (enc_utf8) {
6599 int i;
6600
6601 memmove(ScreenLinesUC + off_to, ScreenLinesUC + off_from,
6602 wp->w_width * sizeof(u8char_T));
6603 for (i = 0; i < p_mco; ++i)
6604 memmove(ScreenLinesC[i] + off_to, ScreenLinesC[i] + off_from,
6605 wp->w_width * sizeof(u8char_T));
6606 }
6607 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932)
6608 memmove(ScreenLines2 + off_to, ScreenLines2 + off_from,
6609 wp->w_width * sizeof(schar_T));
6610 memmove(ScreenAttrs + off_to, ScreenAttrs + off_from,
6611 wp->w_width * sizeof(sattr_T));
6612}
6613
6614/*
6615 * Return TRUE if clearing with term string "p" would work.
6616 * It can't work when the string is empty or it won't set the right background.
6617 */
6618int can_clear(char_u *p)
6619{
6620 return *p != NUL'\000' && (t_colors <= 1
6621 || cterm_normal_bg_color == 0 || *T_UT(term_strings[(int)(KS_UT)]) != NUL'\000');
6622}
6623
6624/*
6625 * Reset cursor position. Use whenever cursor was moved because of outputting
6626 * something directly to the screen (shell commands) or a terminal control
6627 * code.
6628 */
6629void screen_start(void)
6630{
6631 screen_cur_row = screen_cur_col = 9999;
6632}
6633
6634/*
6635 * Move the cursor to position "row","col" in the screen.
6636 * This tries to find the most efficient way to move, minimizing the number of
6637 * characters sent to the terminal.
6638 */
6639void windgoto(int row, int col)
6640{
6641 sattr_T *p;
6642 int i;
6643 int plan;
6644 int cost;
6645 int wouldbe_col;
6646 int noinvcurs;
6647 char_u *bs;
6648 int goto_cost;
6649 int attr;
6650
6651#define GOTO_COST7 7 /* assume a term_windgoto() takes about 7 chars */
6652#define HIGHL_COST5 5 /* assume unhighlight takes 5 chars */
6653
6654#define PLAN_LE1 1
6655#define PLAN_CR2 2
6656#define PLAN_NL3 3
6657#define PLAN_WRITE4 4
6658 /* Can't use ScreenLines unless initialized */
6659 if (ScreenLines == NULL((void*)0))
6660 return;
6661
6662 if (col != screen_cur_col || row != screen_cur_row) {
6663 /* Check for valid position. */
6664 if (row < 0) /* window without text lines? */
6665 row = 0;
6666 if (row >= screen_Rows)
6667 row = screen_Rows - 1;
6668 if (col >= screen_Columns)
6669 col = screen_Columns - 1;
6670
6671 /* check if no cursor movement is allowed in highlight mode */
6672 if (screen_attr && *T_MS(term_strings[(int)(KS_MS)]) == NUL'\000')
6673 noinvcurs = HIGHL_COST5;
6674 else
6675 noinvcurs = 0;
6676 goto_cost = GOTO_COST7 + noinvcurs;
6677
6678 /*
6679 * Plan how to do the positioning:
6680 * 1. Use CR to move it to column 0, same row.
6681 * 2. Use T_LE to move it a few columns to the left.
6682 * 3. Use NL to move a few lines down, column 0.
6683 * 4. Move a few columns to the right with T_ND or by writing chars.
6684 *
6685 * Don't do this if the cursor went beyond the last column, the cursor
6686 * position is unknown then (some terminals wrap, some don't )
6687 *
6688 * First check if the highlighting attributes allow us to write
6689 * characters to move the cursor to the right.
6690 */
6691 if (row >= screen_cur_row && screen_cur_col < Columns) {
6692 /*
6693 * If the cursor is in the same row, bigger col, we can use CR
6694 * or T_LE.
6695 */
6696 bs = NULL((void*)0); /* init for GCC */
6697 attr = screen_attr;
6698 if (row == screen_cur_row && col < screen_cur_col) {
6699 /* "le" is preferred over "bc", because "bc" is obsolete */
6700 if (*T_LE(term_strings[(int)(KS_LE)]))
6701 bs = T_LE(term_strings[(int)(KS_LE)]); /* "cursor left" */
6702 else
6703 bs = T_BC(term_strings[(int)(KS_BC)]); /* "backspace character (old) */
6704 if (*bs)
6705 cost = (screen_cur_col - col) * (int)STRLEN(bs)strlen((char *)(bs));
6706 else
6707 cost = 999;
6708 if (col + 1 < cost) { /* using CR is less characters */
6709 plan = PLAN_CR2;
6710 wouldbe_col = 0;
6711 cost = 1; /* CR is just one character */
6712 } else {
6713 plan = PLAN_LE1;
6714 wouldbe_col = col;
6715 }
6716 if (noinvcurs) { /* will stop highlighting */
6717 cost += noinvcurs;
6718 attr = 0;
6719 }
6720 }
6721 /*
6722 * If the cursor is above where we want to be, we can use CR LF.
6723 */
6724 else if (row > screen_cur_row) {
6725 plan = PLAN_NL3;
6726 wouldbe_col = 0;
6727 cost = (row - screen_cur_row) * 2; /* CR LF */
6728 if (noinvcurs) { /* will stop highlighting */
6729 cost += noinvcurs;
6730 attr = 0;
6731 }
6732 }
6733 /*
6734 * If the cursor is in the same row, smaller col, just use write.
6735 */
6736 else {
6737 plan = PLAN_WRITE4;
6738 wouldbe_col = screen_cur_col;
6739 cost = 0;
6740 }
6741
6742 /*
6743 * Check if any characters that need to be written have the
6744 * correct attributes. Also avoid UTF-8 characters.
6745 */
6746 i = col - wouldbe_col;
6747 if (i > 0)
6748 cost += i;
6749 if (cost < goto_cost && i > 0) {
6750 /*
6751 * Check if the attributes are correct without additionally
6752 * stopping highlighting.
6753 */
6754 p = ScreenAttrs + LineOffset[row] + wouldbe_col;
6755 while (i && *p++ == attr)
6756 --i;
6757 if (i != 0) {
6758 /*
6759 * Try if it works when highlighting is stopped here.
6760 */
6761 if (*--p == 0) {
6762 cost += noinvcurs;
6763 while (i && *p++ == 0)
6764 --i;
6765 }
6766 if (i != 0)
6767 cost = 999; /* different attributes, don't do it */
6768 }
6769 if (enc_utf8) {
6770 /* Don't use an UTF-8 char for positioning, it's slow. */
6771 for (i = wouldbe_col; i < col; ++i)
6772 if (ScreenLinesUC[LineOffset[row] + i] != 0) {
6773 cost = 999;
6774 break;
6775 }
6776 }
6777 }
6778
6779 /*
6780 * We can do it without term_windgoto()!
6781 */
6782 if (cost < goto_cost) {
6783 if (plan == PLAN_LE1) {
6784 if (noinvcurs)
6785 screen_stop_highlight();
6786 while (screen_cur_col > col) {
6787 out_str(bs);
6788 --screen_cur_col;
6789 }
6790 } else if (plan == PLAN_CR2) {
6791 if (noinvcurs)
6792 screen_stop_highlight();
6793 out_char('\r');
6794 screen_cur_col = 0;
6795 } else if (plan == PLAN_NL3) {
6796 if (noinvcurs)
6797 screen_stop_highlight();
6798 while (screen_cur_row < row) {
6799 out_char('\n');
6800 ++screen_cur_row;
6801 }
6802 screen_cur_col = 0;
6803 }
6804
6805 i = col - screen_cur_col;
6806 if (i > 0) {
6807 /*
6808 * Use cursor-right if it's one character only. Avoids
6809 * removing a line of pixels from the last bold char, when
6810 * using the bold trick in the GUI.
6811 */
6812 if (T_ND(term_strings[(int)(KS_ND)])[0] != NUL'\000' && T_ND(term_strings[(int)(KS_ND)])[1] == NUL'\000') {
6813 while (i-- > 0)
6814 out_char(*T_ND(term_strings[(int)(KS_ND)]));
6815 } else {
6816 int off;
6817
6818 off = LineOffset[row] + screen_cur_col;
6819 while (i-- > 0) {
6820 if (ScreenAttrs[off] != screen_attr)
6821 screen_stop_highlight();
6822 out_flush_check();
6823 out_char(ScreenLines[off]);
6824 if (enc_dbcs == DBCS_JPNU9932
6825 && ScreenLines[off] == 0x8e)
6826 out_char(ScreenLines2[off]);
6827 ++off;
6828 }
6829 }
6830 }
6831 }
6832 } else
6833 cost = 999;
6834
6835 if (cost >= goto_cost) {
6836 if (noinvcurs)
6837 screen_stop_highlight();
6838 if (row == screen_cur_row && (col > screen_cur_col) &&
6839 *T_CRI(term_strings[(int)(KS_CRI)]) != NUL'\000')
6840 term_cursor_right(col - screen_cur_col);
6841 else
6842 term_windgoto(row, col);
6843 }
6844 screen_cur_row = row;
6845 screen_cur_col = col;
6846 }
6847}
6848
6849/*
6850 * Set cursor to its position in the current window.
6851 */
6852void setcursor(void)
6853{
6854 if (redrawing()) {
6855 validate_cursor();
6856 windgoto(curwin->w_winrow + curwin->w_wrow,
6857 curwin->w_wincol + (
6858 /* With 'rightleft' set and the cursor on a double-wide
6859 * character, position it on the leftmost column. */
6860 curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ? ((int)curwin->w_width - curwin->w_wcol - (
6861 (has_mbyte
6862 && (*mb_ptr2cells)(get_cursor_pos_ptr()) == 2
6863 && vim_isprintc(gchar_cursor())) ? 2 :
6864 1)) :
6865 curwin->w_wcol));
6866 }
6867}
6868
6869/*
6870 * insert 'line_count' lines at 'row' in window 'wp'
6871 * if 'invalid' is TRUE the wp->w_lines[].wl_lnum is invalidated.
6872 * if 'mayclear' is TRUE the screen will be cleared if it is faster than
6873 * scrolling.
6874 * Returns FAIL if the lines are not inserted, OK for success.
6875 */
6876int win_ins_lines(win_T *wp, int row, int line_count, int invalid, int mayclear)
6877{
6878 int did_delete;
6879 int nextrow;
6880 int lastrow;
6881 int retval;
6882
6883 if (invalid)
6884 wp->w_lines_valid = 0;
6885
6886 if (wp->w_height < 5)
6887 return FAIL0;
6888
6889 if (line_count > wp->w_height - row)
6890 line_count = wp->w_height - row;
6891
6892 retval = win_do_lines(wp, row, line_count, mayclear, FALSE0);
6893 if (retval != MAYBE2)
6894 return retval;
6895
6896 /*
6897 * If there is a next window or a status line, we first try to delete the
6898 * lines at the bottom to avoid messing what is after the window.
6899 * If this fails and there are following windows, don't do anything to avoid
6900 * messing up those windows, better just redraw.
6901 */
6902 did_delete = FALSE0;
6903 if (wp->w_next != NULL((void*)0) || wp->w_status_height) {
6904 if (screen_del_lines(0, wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height - line_count,
6905 line_count, (int)Rows, FALSE0, NULL((void*)0)) == OK1)
6906 did_delete = TRUE1;
6907 else if (wp->w_next)
6908 return FAIL0;
6909 }
6910 /*
6911 * if no lines deleted, blank the lines that will end up below the window
6912 */
6913 if (!did_delete) {
6914 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
6915 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
6916 nextrow = wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height + wp->w_status_height;
6917 lastrow = nextrow + line_count;
6918 if (lastrow > Rows)
6919 lastrow = Rows;
6920 screen_fill(nextrow - line_count, lastrow - line_count,
6921 wp->w_wincol, (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width),
6922 ' ', ' ', 0);
6923 }
6924
6925 if (screen_ins_lines(0, wp->w_winrow + row, line_count, (int)Rows, NULL((void*)0))
6926 == FAIL0) {
6927 /* deletion will have messed up other windows */
6928 if (did_delete) {
6929 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
6930 win_rest_invalid(W_NEXT(wp)((wp)->w_next));
6931 }
6932 return FAIL0;
6933 }
6934
6935 return OK1;
6936}
6937
6938/*
6939 * delete "line_count" window lines at "row" in window "wp"
6940 * If "invalid" is TRUE curwin->w_lines[] is invalidated.
6941 * If "mayclear" is TRUE the screen will be cleared if it is faster than
6942 * scrolling
6943 * Return OK for success, FAIL if the lines are not deleted.
6944 */
6945int win_del_lines(win_T *wp, int row, int line_count, int invalid, int mayclear)
6946{
6947 int retval;
6948
6949 if (invalid)
6950 wp->w_lines_valid = 0;
6951
6952 if (line_count > wp->w_height - row)
6953 line_count = wp->w_height - row;
6954
6955 retval = win_do_lines(wp, row, line_count, mayclear, TRUE1);
6956 if (retval != MAYBE2)
6957 return retval;
6958
6959 if (screen_del_lines(0, wp->w_winrow + row, line_count,
6960 (int)Rows, FALSE0, NULL((void*)0)) == FAIL0)
6961 return FAIL0;
6962
6963 /*
6964 * If there are windows or status lines below, try to put them at the
6965 * correct place. If we can't do that, they have to be redrawn.
6966 */
6967 if (wp->w_next || wp->w_status_height || cmdline_row < Rows - 1) {
6968 if (screen_ins_lines(0, wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height - line_count,
6969 line_count, (int)Rows, NULL((void*)0)) == FAIL0) {
6970 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
6971 win_rest_invalid(wp->w_next);
6972 }
6973 }
6974 /*
6975 * If this is the last window and there is no status line, redraw the
6976 * command line later.
6977 */
6978 else
6979 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
6980 return OK1;
6981}
6982
6983/*
6984 * Common code for win_ins_lines() and win_del_lines().
6985 * Returns OK or FAIL when the work has been done.
6986 * Returns MAYBE when not finished yet.
6987 */
6988static int win_do_lines(win_T *wp, int row, int line_count, int mayclear, int del)
6989{
6990 int retval;
6991
6992 if (!redrawing() || line_count <= 0)
6993 return FAIL0;
6994
6995 /* only a few lines left: redraw is faster */
6996 if (mayclear && Rows - line_count < 5
6997 && wp->w_width == Columns
6998 ) {
6999 screenclear(); /* will set wp->w_lines_valid to 0 */
7000 return FAIL0;
7001 }
7002
7003 /*
7004 * Delete all remaining lines
7005 */
7006 if (row + line_count >= wp->w_height) {
7007 screen_fill(wp->w_winrow + row, wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height,
7008 wp->w_wincol, (int)W_ENDCOL(wp)(wp->w_wincol + wp->w_width),
7009 ' ', ' ', 0);
7010 return OK1;
7011 }
7012
7013 /*
7014 * when scrolling, the message on the command line should be cleared,
7015 * otherwise it will stay there forever.
7016 */
7017 clear_cmdline = TRUE1;
7018
7019 /*
7020 * If the terminal can set a scroll region, use that.
7021 * Always do this in a vertically split window. This will redraw from
7022 * ScreenLines[] when t_CV isn't defined. That's faster than using
7023 * win_line().
7024 * Don't use a scroll region when we are going to redraw the text, writing
7025 * a character in the lower right corner of the scroll region causes a
7026 * scroll-up in the DJGPP version.
7027 */
7028 if (scroll_region
7029 || wp->w_width != Columns
7030 ) {
7031 if (scroll_region && (wp->w_width == Columns || *T_CSV(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSV)]) != NUL'\000'))
7032 scroll_region_set(wp, row);
7033 if (del)
7034 retval = screen_del_lines(wp->w_winrow + row, 0, line_count,
7035 wp->w_height - row, FALSE0, wp);
7036 else
7037 retval = screen_ins_lines(wp->w_winrow + row, 0, line_count,
7038 wp->w_height - row, wp);
7039 if (scroll_region && (wp->w_width == Columns || *T_CSV(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSV)]) != NUL'\000'))
7040 scroll_region_reset();
7041 return retval;
7042 }
7043
7044 if (wp->w_next != NULL((void*)0) && p_tf) /* don't delete/insert on fast terminal */
7045 return FAIL0;
7046
7047 return MAYBE2;
7048}
7049
7050/*
7051 * window 'wp' and everything after it is messed up, mark it for redraw
7052 */
7053static void win_rest_invalid(win_T *wp)
7054{
7055 while (wp != NULL((void*)0)) {
7056 redraw_win_later(wp, NOT_VALID40);
7057 wp->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
7058 wp = wp->w_next;
7059 }
7060 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1;
7061}
7062
7063/*
7064 * The rest of the routines in this file perform screen manipulations. The
7065 * given operation is performed physically on the screen. The corresponding
7066 * change is also made to the internal screen image. In this way, the editor
7067 * anticipates the effect of editing changes on the appearance of the screen.
7068 * That way, when we call screenupdate a complete redraw isn't usually
7069 * necessary. Another advantage is that we can keep adding code to anticipate
7070 * screen changes, and in the meantime, everything still works.
7071 */
7072
7073/*
7074 * types for inserting or deleting lines
7075 */
7076#define USE_T_CAL1 1
7077#define USE_T_CDL2 2
7078#define USE_T_AL3 3
7079#define USE_T_CE4 4
7080#define USE_T_DL5 5
7081#define USE_T_SR6 6
7082#define USE_NL7 7
7083#define USE_T_CD8 8
7084#define USE_REDRAW9 9
7085
7086/*
7087 * insert lines on the screen and update ScreenLines[]
7088 * 'end' is the line after the scrolled part. Normally it is Rows.
7089 * When scrolling region used 'off' is the offset from the top for the region.
7090 * 'row' and 'end' are relative to the start of the region.
7091 *
7092 * return FAIL for failure, OK for success.
7093 */
7094int
7095screen_ins_lines (
7096 int off,
7097 int row,
7098 int line_count,
7099 int end,
7100 win_T *wp /* NULL or window to use width from */
7101)
7102{
7103 int i;
7104 int j;
7105 unsigned temp;
7106 int cursor_row;
7107 int type;
7108 int result_empty;
7109 int can_ce = can_clear(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)]));
7110
7111 /*
7112 * FAIL if
7113 * - there is no valid screen
7114 * - the screen has to be redrawn completely
7115 * - the line count is less than one
7116 * - the line count is more than 'ttyscroll'
7117 */
7118 if (!screen_valid(TRUE1) || line_count <= 0 || line_count > p_ttyscroll)
7119 return FAIL0;
7120
7121 /*
7122 * There are seven ways to insert lines:
7123 * 0. When in a vertically split window and t_CV isn't set, redraw the
7124 * characters from ScreenLines[].
7125 * 1. Use T_CD (clear to end of display) if it exists and the result of
7126 * the insert is just empty lines
7127 * 2. Use T_CAL (insert multiple lines) if it exists and T_AL is not
7128 * present or line_count > 1. It looks better if we do all the inserts
7129 * at once.
7130 * 3. Use T_CDL (delete multiple lines) if it exists and the result of the
7131 * insert is just empty lines and T_CE is not present or line_count >
7132 * 1.
7133 * 4. Use T_AL (insert line) if it exists.
7134 * 5. Use T_CE (erase line) if it exists and the result of the insert is
7135 * just empty lines.
7136 * 6. Use T_DL (delete line) if it exists and the result of the insert is
7137 * just empty lines.
7138 * 7. Use T_SR (scroll reverse) if it exists and inserting at row 0 and
7139 * the 'da' flag is not set or we have clear line capability.
7140 * 8. redraw the characters from ScreenLines[].
7141 *
7142 * Careful: In a hpterm scroll reverse doesn't work as expected, it moves
7143 * the scrollbar for the window. It does have insert line, use that if it
7144 * exists.
7145 */
7146 result_empty = (row + line_count >= end);
7147 if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_width != Columns && *T_CSV(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSV)]) == NUL'\000')
7148 type = USE_REDRAW9;
7149 else if (can_clear(T_CD(term_strings[(int)(KS_CD)])) && result_empty)
7150 type = USE_T_CD8;
7151 else if (*T_CAL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CAL)]) != NUL'\000' && (line_count > 1 || *T_AL(term_strings[(int)(KS_AL)]) == NUL'\000'))
7152 type = USE_T_CAL1;
7153 else if (*T_CDL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CDL)]) != NUL'\000' && result_empty && (line_count > 1 || !can_ce))
7154 type = USE_T_CDL2;
7155 else if (*T_AL(term_strings[(int)(KS_AL)]) != NUL'\000')
7156 type = USE_T_AL3;
7157 else if (can_ce && result_empty)
7158 type = USE_T_CE4;
7159 else if (*T_DL(term_strings[(int)(KS_DL)]) != NUL'\000' && result_empty)
7160 type = USE_T_DL5;
7161 else if (*T_SR(term_strings[(int)(KS_SR)]) != NUL'\000' && row == 0 && (*T_DA(term_strings[(int)(KS_DA)]) == NUL'\000' || can_ce))
7162 type = USE_T_SR6;
7163 else
7164 return FAIL0;
7165
7166 /*
7167 * For clearing the lines screen_del_lines() is used. This will also take
7168 * care of t_db if necessary.
7169 */
7170 if (type == USE_T_CD8 || type == USE_T_CDL2 ||
7171 type == USE_T_CE4 || type == USE_T_DL5)
7172 return screen_del_lines(off, row, line_count, end, FALSE0, wp);
7173
7174 /*
7175 * If text is retained below the screen, first clear or delete as many
7176 * lines at the bottom of the window as are about to be inserted so that
7177 * the deleted lines won't later surface during a screen_del_lines.
7178 */
7179 if (*T_DB(term_strings[(int)(KS_DB)]))
7180 screen_del_lines(off, end - line_count, line_count, end, FALSE0, wp);
7181
7182
7183
7184 if (*T_CCS(term_strings[(int)(KS_CCS)]) != NUL'\000') /* cursor relative to region */
7185 cursor_row = row;
7186 else
7187 cursor_row = row + off;
7188
7189 /*
7190 * Shift LineOffset[] line_count down to reflect the inserted lines.
7191 * Clear the inserted lines in ScreenLines[].
7192 */
7193 row += off;
7194 end += off;
7195 for (i = 0; i < line_count; ++i) {
7196 if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_width != Columns) {
7197 /* need to copy part of a line */
7198 j = end - 1 - i;
7199 while ((j -= line_count) >= row)
7200 linecopy(j + line_count, j, wp);
7201 j += line_count;
7202 if (can_clear((char_u *)" "))
7203 lineclear(LineOffset[j] + wp->w_wincol, wp->w_width);
7204 else
7205 lineinvalid(LineOffset[j] + wp->w_wincol, wp->w_width);
7206 LineWraps[j] = FALSE0;
7207 } else {
7208 j = end - 1 - i;
7209 temp = LineOffset[j];
7210 while ((j -= line_count) >= row) {
7211 LineOffset[j + line_count] = LineOffset[j];
7212 LineWraps[j + line_count] = LineWraps[j];
7213 }
7214 LineOffset[j + line_count] = temp;
7215 LineWraps[j + line_count] = FALSE0;
7216 if (can_clear((char_u *)" "))
7217 lineclear(temp, (int)Columns);
7218 else
7219 lineinvalid(temp, (int)Columns);
7220 }
7221 }
7222
7223 screen_stop_highlight();
7224 windgoto(cursor_row, 0);
7225
7226 /* redraw the characters */
7227 if (type == USE_REDRAW9)
7228 redraw_block(row, end, wp);
7229 else if (type == USE_T_CAL1) {
7230 term_append_lines(line_count);
7231 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7232 } else {
7233 for (i = 0; i < line_count; i++) {
7234 if (type == USE_T_AL3) {
7235 if (i && cursor_row != 0)
7236 windgoto(cursor_row, 0);
7237 out_str(T_AL(term_strings[(int)(KS_AL)]));
7238 } else /* type == USE_T_SR */
7239 out_str(T_SR(term_strings[(int)(KS_SR)]));
7240 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7241 }
7242 }
7243
7244 /*
7245 * With scroll-reverse and 'da' flag set we need to clear the lines that
7246 * have been scrolled down into the region.
7247 */
7248 if (type == USE_T_SR6 && *T_DA(term_strings[(int)(KS_DA)])) {
7249 for (i = 0; i < line_count; ++i) {
7250 windgoto(off + i, 0);
7251 out_str(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)]));
7252 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7253 }
7254 }
7255
7256 return OK1;
7257}
7258
7259/*
7260 * delete lines on the screen and update ScreenLines[]
7261 * 'end' is the line after the scrolled part. Normally it is Rows.
7262 * When scrolling region used 'off' is the offset from the top for the region.
7263 * 'row' and 'end' are relative to the start of the region.
7264 *
7265 * Return OK for success, FAIL if the lines are not deleted.
7266 */
7267int
7268screen_del_lines (
7269 int off,
7270 int row,
7271 int line_count,
7272 int end,
7273 int force, /* even when line_count > p_ttyscroll */
7274 win_T *wp /* NULL or window to use width from */
7275)
7276{
7277 int j;
7278 int i;
7279 unsigned temp;
7280 int cursor_row;
7281 int cursor_end;
7282 int result_empty; /* result is empty until end of region */
7283 int can_delete; /* deleting line codes can be used */
7284 int type;
7285
7286 /*
7287 * FAIL if
7288 * - there is no valid screen
7289 * - the screen has to be redrawn completely
7290 * - the line count is less than one
7291 * - the line count is more than 'ttyscroll'
7292 */
7293 if (!screen_valid(TRUE1) || line_count <= 0 ||
7294 (!force && line_count > p_ttyscroll))
7295 return FAIL0;
7296
7297 /*
7298 * Check if the rest of the current region will become empty.
7299 */
7300 result_empty = row + line_count >= end;
7301
7302 /*
7303 * We can delete lines only when 'db' flag not set or when 'ce' option
7304 * available.
7305 */
7306 can_delete = (*T_DB(term_strings[(int)(KS_DB)]) == NUL'\000' || can_clear(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)])));
7307
7308 /*
7309 * There are six ways to delete lines:
7310 * 0. When in a vertically split window and t_CV isn't set, redraw the
7311 * characters from ScreenLines[].
7312 * 1. Use T_CD if it exists and the result is empty.
7313 * 2. Use newlines if row == 0 and count == 1 or T_CDL does not exist.
7314 * 3. Use T_CDL (delete multiple lines) if it exists and line_count > 1 or
7315 * none of the other ways work.
7316 * 4. Use T_CE (erase line) if the result is empty.
7317 * 5. Use T_DL (delete line) if it exists.
7318 * 6. redraw the characters from ScreenLines[].
7319 */
7320 if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_width != Columns && *T_CSV(term_strings[(int)(KS_CSV)]) == NUL'\000')
7321 type = USE_REDRAW9;
7322 else if (can_clear(T_CD(term_strings[(int)(KS_CD)])) && result_empty)
7323 type = USE_T_CD8;
7324 else if (row == 0 && (
7325 /* On the Amiga, somehow '\n' on the last line doesn't always scroll
7326 * up, so use delete-line command */
7327 line_count == 1 ||
7328 *T_CDL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CDL)]) == NUL'\000'))
7329 type = USE_NL7;
7330 else if (*T_CDL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CDL)]) != NUL'\000' && line_count > 1 && can_delete)
7331 type = USE_T_CDL2;
7332 else if (can_clear(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)])) && result_empty
7333 && (wp == NULL((void*)0) || wp->w_width == Columns)
7334 )
7335 type = USE_T_CE4;
7336 else if (*T_DL(term_strings[(int)(KS_DL)]) != NUL'\000' && can_delete)
7337 type = USE_T_DL5;
7338 else if (*T_CDL(term_strings[(int)(KS_CDL)]) != NUL'\000' && can_delete)
7339 type = USE_T_CDL2;
7340 else
7341 return FAIL0;
7342
7343
7344
7345 if (*T_CCS(term_strings[(int)(KS_CCS)]) != NUL'\000') { /* cursor relative to region */
7346 cursor_row = row;
7347 cursor_end = end;
7348 } else {
7349 cursor_row = row + off;
7350 cursor_end = end + off;
7351 }
7352
7353 /*
7354 * Now shift LineOffset[] line_count up to reflect the deleted lines.
7355 * Clear the inserted lines in ScreenLines[].
7356 */
7357 row += off;
7358 end += off;
7359 for (i = 0; i < line_count; ++i) {
7360 if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_width != Columns) {
7361 /* need to copy part of a line */
7362 j = row + i;
7363 while ((j += line_count) <= end - 1)
7364 linecopy(j - line_count, j, wp);
7365 j -= line_count;
7366 if (can_clear((char_u *)" "))
7367 lineclear(LineOffset[j] + wp->w_wincol, wp->w_width);
7368 else
7369 lineinvalid(LineOffset[j] + wp->w_wincol, wp->w_width);
7370 LineWraps[j] = FALSE0;
7371 } else {
7372 /* whole width, moving the line pointers is faster */
7373 j = row + i;
7374 temp = LineOffset[j];
7375 while ((j += line_count) <= end - 1) {
7376 LineOffset[j - line_count] = LineOffset[j];
7377 LineWraps[j - line_count] = LineWraps[j];
7378 }
7379 LineOffset[j - line_count] = temp;
7380 LineWraps[j - line_count] = FALSE0;
7381 if (can_clear((char_u *)" "))
7382 lineclear(temp, (int)Columns);
7383 else
7384 lineinvalid(temp, (int)Columns);
7385 }
7386 }
7387
7388 screen_stop_highlight();
7389
7390 /* redraw the characters */
7391 if (type == USE_REDRAW9)
7392 redraw_block(row, end, wp);
7393 else if (type == USE_T_CD8) { /* delete the lines */
7394 windgoto(cursor_row, 0);
7395 out_str(T_CD(term_strings[(int)(KS_CD)]));
7396 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7397 } else if (type == USE_T_CDL2) {
7398 windgoto(cursor_row, 0);
7399 term_delete_lines(line_count);
7400 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7401 }
7402 /*
7403 * Deleting lines at top of the screen or scroll region: Just scroll
7404 * the whole screen (scroll region) up by outputting newlines on the
7405 * last line.
7406 */
7407 else if (type == USE_NL7) {
7408 windgoto(cursor_end - 1, 0);
7409 for (i = line_count; --i >= 0; )
7410 out_char('\n'); /* cursor will remain on same line */
7411 } else {
7412 for (i = line_count; --i >= 0; ) {
7413 if (type == USE_T_DL5) {
7414 windgoto(cursor_row, 0);
7415 out_str(T_DL(term_strings[(int)(KS_DL)])); /* delete a line */
7416 } else { /* type == USE_T_CE */
7417 windgoto(cursor_row + i, 0);
7418 out_str(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)])); /* erase a line */
7419 }
7420 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7421 }
7422 }
7423
7424 /*
7425 * If the 'db' flag is set, we need to clear the lines that have been
7426 * scrolled up at the bottom of the region.
7427 */
7428 if (*T_DB(term_strings[(int)(KS_DB)]) && (type == USE_T_DL5 || type == USE_T_CDL2)) {
7429 for (i = line_count; i > 0; --i) {
7430 windgoto(cursor_end - i, 0);
7431 out_str(T_CE(term_strings[(int)(KS_CE)])); /* erase a line */
7432 screen_start(); /* don't know where cursor is now */
7433 }
7434 }
7435
7436
7437 return OK1;
7438}
7439
7440/*
7441 * show the current mode and ruler
7442 *
7443 * If clear_cmdline is TRUE, clear the rest of the cmdline.
7444 * If clear_cmdline is FALSE there may be a message there that needs to be
7445 * cleared only if a mode is shown.
7446 * Return the length of the message (0 if no message).
7447 */
7448int showmode(void)
7449{
7450 int need_clear;
7451 int length = 0;
7452 int do_mode;
7453 int attr;
7454 int nwr_save;
7455 int sub_attr;
7456
7457 do_mode = ((p_smd && msg_silent == 0)
7458 && ((State & INSERT0x10)
7459 || restart_edit
7460 || VIsual_active
7461 ));
7462 if (do_mode || Recording) {
7463 /*
7464 * Don't show mode right now, when not redrawing or inside a mapping.
7465 * Call char_avail() only when we are going to show something, because
