7466 * it takes a bit of time.
7467 */
7468 if (!redrawing() || (char_avail() && !KeyTyped) || msg_silent != 0) {
7469 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1; /* show mode later */
7470 return 0;
7471 }
7472
7473 nwr_save = need_wait_return;
7474
7475 /* wait a bit before overwriting an important message */
7476 check_for_delay(FALSE0);
7477
7478 /* if the cmdline is more than one line high, erase top lines */
7479 need_clear = clear_cmdline;
7480 if (clear_cmdline && cmdline_row < Rows - 1)
7481 msg_clr_cmdline(); /* will reset clear_cmdline */
7482
7483 /* Position on the last line in the window, column 0 */
7484 msg_pos_mode();
7485 cursor_off();
7486 attr = hl_attr(HLF_CM)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_CM)]; /* Highlight mode */
7487 if (do_mode) {
7488 MSG_PUTS_ATTR("--", attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)("--"), (attr));
7489 // CTRL-X in Insert mode
7490 if (edit_submode != NULL((void*)0) && !shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
7491 /* These messages can get long, avoid a wrap in a narrow
7492 * window. Prefer showing edit_submode_extra. */
7493 length = (Rows - msg_row) * Columns - 3;
7494 if (edit_submode_extra != NULL((void*)0))
7495 length -= vim_strsize(edit_submode_extra);
7496 if (length > 0) {
7497 if (edit_submode_pre != NULL((void*)0))
7498 length -= vim_strsize(edit_submode_pre);
7499 if (length - vim_strsize(edit_submode) > 0) {
7500 if (edit_submode_pre != NULL((void*)0))
7501 msg_puts_attr(edit_submode_pre, attr);
7502 msg_puts_attr(edit_submode, attr);
7503 }
7504 if (edit_submode_extra != NULL((void*)0)) {
7505 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(" ", attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(" "), (attr)); /* add a space in between */
7506 if ((int)edit_submode_highl < (int)HLF_COUNT)
7507 sub_attr = hl_attr(edit_submode_highl)highlight_attr[(int)(edit_submode_highl)];
7508 else
7509 sub_attr = attr;
7510 msg_puts_attr(edit_submode_extra, sub_attr);
7511 }
7512 }
7513 length = 0;
7514 } else {
7515 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7516 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" VREPLACE"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" VREPLACE"))), (attr
));
7517 else if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7518 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" REPLACE"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" REPLACE"))), (attr
));
7519 else if (State & INSERT0x10) {
7520 if (p_ri)
7521 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" REVERSE"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" REVERSE"))), (attr
));
7522 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" INSERT"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" INSERT"))), (attr
));
7523 } else if (restart_edit == 'I')
7524 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" (insert)"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" (insert)"))), (attr
));
7525 else if (restart_edit == 'R')
7526 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" (replace)"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" (replace)"))), (attr
));
7527 else if (restart_edit == 'V')
7528 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" (vreplace)"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" (vreplace)"))), (
attr));
7529 if (p_hkmap)
7530 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" Hebrew"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" Hebrew"))), (attr
));
7531 if (p_fkmap)
7532 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(farsi_text_5, attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(farsi_text_5), (attr));
7533 if (State & LANGMAP0x20) {
7534 if (curwin->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab)
7535 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" Arabic"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" Arabic"))), (attr
));
7536 else
7537 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" (lang)"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" (lang)"))), (attr
));
7538 }
7539 if ((State & INSERT0x10) && p_paste)
7540 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(" (paste)"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(" (paste)"))), (attr
));
7541
7542 if (VIsual_active) {
7543 char *p;
7544
7545 /* Don't concatenate separate words to avoid translation
7546 * problems. */
7547 switch ((VIsual_select ? 4 : 0)
7548 + (VIsual_mode == Ctrl_V22) * 2
7549 + (VIsual_mode == 'V')) {
7550 case 0: p = N_(" VISUAL")" VISUAL"; break;
7551 case 1: p = N_(" VISUAL LINE")" VISUAL LINE"; break;
7552 case 2: p = N_(" VISUAL BLOCK")" VISUAL BLOCK"; break;
7553 case 4: p = N_(" SELECT")" SELECT"; break;
7554 case 5: p = N_(" SELECT LINE")" SELECT LINE"; break;
7555 default: p = N_(" SELECT BLOCK")" SELECT BLOCK"; break;
7556 }
7557 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_(p), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(p))), (attr));
7558 }
7559 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(" --", attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(" --"), (attr));
7560 }
7561
7562 need_clear = TRUE1;
7563 }
7564 if (Recording
7565 && edit_submode == NULL((void*)0) /* otherwise it gets too long */
7566 ) {
7567 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_("recording"), attr)msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("recording"))), (attr
));
7568 need_clear = TRUE1;
7569 }
7570
7571 mode_displayed = TRUE1;
7572 if (need_clear || clear_cmdline)
7573 msg_clr_eos();
7574 msg_didout = FALSE0; /* overwrite this message */
7575 length = msg_col;
7576 msg_col = 0;
7577 need_wait_return = nwr_save; /* never ask for hit-return for this */
7578 } else if (clear_cmdline && msg_silent == 0)
7579 /* Clear the whole command line. Will reset "clear_cmdline". */
7580 msg_clr_cmdline();
7581
7582 /* In Visual mode the size of the selected area must be redrawn. */
7583 if (VIsual_active)
7584 clear_showcmd();
7585
7586 /* If the last window has no status line, the ruler is after the mode
7587 * message and must be redrawn */
7588 if (redrawing()
7589 && lastwin->w_status_height == 0
7590 )
7591 win_redr_ruler(lastwin, TRUE1);
7592 redraw_cmdline = FALSE0;
7593 clear_cmdline = FALSE0;
7594
7595 return length;
7596}
7597
7598/*
7599 * Position for a mode message.
7600 */
7601static void msg_pos_mode(void)
7602{
7603 msg_col = 0;
7604 msg_row = Rows - 1;
7605}
7606
7607/*
7608 * Delete mode message. Used when ESC is typed which is expected to end
7609 * Insert mode (but Insert mode didn't end yet!).
7610 * Caller should check "mode_displayed".
7611 */
7612void unshowmode(int force)
7613{
7614 /*
7615 * Don't delete it right now, when not redrawing or inside a mapping.
7616 */
7617 if (!redrawing() || (!force && char_avail() && !KeyTyped))
7618 redraw_cmdline = TRUE1; /* delete mode later */
7619 else {
7620 msg_pos_mode();
7621 if (Recording)
7622 MSG_PUTS_ATTR(_("recording"), hl_attr(HLF_CM))msg_puts_attr((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("recording"))), (highlight_attr
[(int)(HLF_CM)]));
7623 msg_clr_eos();
7624 }
7625}
7626
7627/*
7628 * Draw the tab pages line at the top of the Vim window.
7629 */
7630static void draw_tabline(void)
7631{
7632 int tabcount = 0;
7633 int tabwidth;
7634 int col = 0;
7635 int scol = 0;
7636 int attr;
7637 win_T *wp;
7638 win_T *cwp;
7639 int wincount;
7640 int modified;
7641 int c;
7642 int len;
7643 int attr_sel = hl_attr(HLF_TPS)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_TPS)];
7644 int attr_nosel = hl_attr(HLF_TP)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_TP)];
7645 int attr_fill = hl_attr(HLF_TPF)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_TPF)];
7646 char_u *p;
7647 int room;
7648 int use_sep_chars = (t_colors < 8
7649 );
7650
7651 redraw_tabline = FALSE0;
7652
7653
7654 if (tabline_height() < 1)
7655 return;
7656
7657
7658 /* Init TabPageIdxs[] to zero: Clicking outside of tabs has no effect. */
7659 for (scol = 0; scol < Columns; ++scol)
7660 TabPageIdxs[scol] = 0;
7661
7662 /* Use the 'tabline' option if it's set. */
7663 if (*p_tal != NUL'\000') {
7664 int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
7665
7666 /* Check for an error. If there is one we would loop in redrawing the
7667 * screen. Avoid that by making 'tabline' empty. */
7668 called_emsg = FALSE0;
7669 win_redr_custom(NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
7670 if (called_emsg)
7671 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"tabline", -1,
7672 (char_u *)"", OPT_FREE1, SID_ERROR-5);
7673 called_emsg |= save_called_emsg;
7674 } else {
7675 FOR_ALL_TABS(tp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) {
7676 ++tabcount;
7677 }
7678
7679 tabwidth = (Columns - 1 + tabcount / 2) / tabcount;
7680 if (tabwidth < 6)
7681 tabwidth = 6;
7682
7683 attr = attr_nosel;
7684 tabcount = 0;
7685 scol = 0;
7686
7687 FOR_ALL_TABS(tp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) {
7688 if (col >= Columns - 4) {
7689 break;
7690 }
7691
7692 scol = col;
7693
7694 if (tp->tp_topframe == topframe)
7695 attr = attr_sel;
7696 if (use_sep_chars && col > 0)
7697 screen_putchar('|', 0, col++, attr);
7698
7699 if (tp->tp_topframe != topframe)
7700 attr = attr_nosel;
7701
7702 screen_putchar(' ', 0, col++, attr);
7703
7704 if (tp == curtab) {
7705 cwp = curwin;
7706 wp = firstwin;
7707 } else {
7708 cwp = tp->tp_curwin;
7709 wp = tp->tp_firstwin;
7710 }
7711
7712 modified = FALSE0;
7713 for (wincount = 0; wp != NULL((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next, ++wincount)
7714 if (bufIsChanged(wp->w_buffer))
7715 modified = TRUE1;
7716 if (modified || wincount > 1) {
7717 if (wincount > 1) {
7718 vim_snprintf((char *)NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, "%d", wincount);
7719 len = (int)STRLEN(NameBuff)strlen((char *)(NameBuff));
7720 if (col + len >= Columns - 3)
7721 break;
7722 screen_puts_len(NameBuff, len, 0, col,
7723 hl_combine_attr(attr, hl_attr(HLF_T)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_T)])
7724 );
7725 col += len;
7726 }
7727 if (modified)
7728 screen_puts_len((char_u *)"+", 1, 0, col++, attr);
7729 screen_putchar(' ', 0, col++, attr);
7730 }
7731
7732 room = scol - col + tabwidth - 1;
7733 if (room > 0) {
7734 /* Get buffer name in NameBuff[] */
7735 get_trans_bufname(cwp->w_buffer);
7736 shorten_dir(NameBuff);
7737 len = vim_strsize(NameBuff);
7738 p = NameBuff;
7739 if (has_mbyte)
7740 while (len > room) {
7741 len -= ptr2cells(p);
7742 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
7743 }
7744 else if (len > room) {
7745 p += len - room;
7746 len = room;
7747 }
7748 if (len > Columns - col - 1)
7749 len = Columns - col - 1;
7750
7751 screen_puts_len(p, (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)), 0, col, attr);
7752 col += len;
7753 }
7754 screen_putchar(' ', 0, col++, attr);
7755
7756 /* Store the tab page number in TabPageIdxs[], so that
7757 * jump_to_mouse() knows where each one is. */
7758 ++tabcount;
7759 while (scol < col)
7760 TabPageIdxs[scol++] = tabcount;
7761 }
7762
7763 if (use_sep_chars)
7764 c = '_';
7765 else
7766 c = ' ';
7767 screen_fill(0, 1, col, (int)Columns, c, c, attr_fill);
7768
7769 /* Put an "X" for closing the current tab if there are several. */
7770 if (first_tabpage->tp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
7771 screen_putchar('X', 0, (int)Columns - 1, attr_nosel);
7772 TabPageIdxs[Columns - 1] = -999;
7773 }
7774 }
7775
7776 /* Reset the flag here again, in case evaluating 'tabline' causes it to be
7777 * set. */
7778 redraw_tabline = FALSE0;
7779}
7780
7781/*
7782 * Get buffer name for "buf" into NameBuff[].
7783 * Takes care of special buffer names and translates special characters.
7784 */
7785void get_trans_bufname(buf_T *buf)
7786{
7787 if (buf_spname(buf) != NULL((void*)0))
7788 STRLCPY(NameBuff, buf_spname(buf), MAXPATHL)xstrlcpy((char *)(NameBuff), (char *)(buf_spname(buf)), (size_t
)(4096));
7789 else
7790 home_replace(buf, buf->b_fname, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, TRUE1);
7791 trans_characters(NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096);
7792}
7793
7794/*
7795 * Get the character to use in a status line. Get its attributes in "*attr".
7796 */
7797static int fillchar_status(int *attr, int is_curwin)
7798{
7799 int fill;
7800 if (is_curwin) {
7801 *attr = hl_attr(HLF_S)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_S)];
7802 fill = fill_stl;
7803 } else {
7804 *attr = hl_attr(HLF_SNC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_SNC)];
7805 fill = fill_stlnc;
7806 }
7807 /* Use fill when there is highlighting, and highlighting of current
7808 * window differs, or the fillchars differ, or this is not the
7809 * current window */
7810 if (*attr != 0 && ((hl_attr(HLF_S)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_S)] != hl_attr(HLF_SNC)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_SNC)]
7811 || !is_curwin || firstwin == lastwin)
7812 || (fill_stl != fill_stlnc)))
7813 return fill;
7814 if (is_curwin)
7815 return '^';
7816 return '=';
7817}
7818
7819/*
7820 * Get the character to use in a separator between vertically split windows.
7821 * Get its attributes in "*attr".
7822 */
7823static int fillchar_vsep(int *attr)
7824{
7825 *attr = hl_attr(HLF_C)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_C)];
7826 if (*attr == 0 && fill_vert == ' ')
7827 return '|';
7828 else
7829 return fill_vert;
7830}
7831
7832/*
7833 * Return TRUE if redrawing should currently be done.
7834 */
7835int redrawing(void)
7836{
7837 return !RedrawingDisabled
7838 && !(p_lz && char_avail() && !KeyTyped && !do_redraw);
7839}
7840
7841/*
7842 * Return TRUE if printing messages should currently be done.
7843 */
7844int messaging(void)
7845{
7846 return !(p_lz && char_avail() && !KeyTyped);
7847}
7848
7849/*
7850 * Show current status info in ruler and various other places
7851 * If always is FALSE, only show ruler if position has changed.
7852 */
7853void showruler(int always)
7854{
7855 if (!always && !redrawing())
7856 return;
7857 if (pum_visible()) {
7858 /* Don't redraw right now, do it later. */
7859 curwin->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
7860 return;
7861 }
7862 if ((*p_stl != NUL'\000' || *curwin->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000') && curwin->w_status_height) {
7863 redraw_custom_statusline(curwin);
7864 } else
7865 win_redr_ruler(curwin, always);
7866
7867 if (need_maketitle
7868 || (p_icon && (stl_syntax & STL_IN_ICON1))
7869 || (p_title && (stl_syntax & STL_IN_TITLE2))
7870 )
7871 maketitle();
7872 /* Redraw the tab pages line if needed. */
7873 if (redraw_tabline)
7874 draw_tabline();
7875}
7876
7877static void win_redr_ruler(win_T *wp, int always)
7878{
7879 /* If 'ruler' off or redrawing disabled, don't do anything */
7880 if (!p_ru)
7881 return;
7882
7883 /*
7884 * Check if cursor.lnum is valid, since win_redr_ruler() may be called
7885 * after deleting lines, before cursor.lnum is corrected.
7886 */
7887 if (wp->w_cursor.lnum > wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count)
7888 return;
7889
7890 /* Don't draw the ruler while doing insert-completion, it might overwrite
7891 * the (long) mode message. */
7892 if (wp == lastwin && lastwin->w_status_height == 0)
7893 if (edit_submode != NULL((void*)0))
7894 return;
7895 /* Don't draw the ruler when the popup menu is visible, it may overlap. */
7896 if (pum_visible())
7897 return;
7898
7899 if (*p_ruf) {
7900 int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
7901
7902 called_emsg = FALSE0;
7903 win_redr_custom(wp, TRUE1);
7904 if (called_emsg)
7905 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"rulerformat", -1,
7906 (char_u *)"", OPT_FREE1, SID_ERROR-5);
7907 called_emsg |= save_called_emsg;
7908 return;
7909 }
7910
7911 /*
7912 * Check if not in Insert mode and the line is empty (will show "0-1").
7913 */
7914 int empty_line = FALSE0;
7915 if (!(State & INSERT0x10)
7916 && *ml_get_buf(wp->w_buffer, wp->w_cursor.lnum, FALSE0) == NUL'\000')
7917 empty_line = TRUE1;
7918
7919 /*
7920 * Only draw the ruler when something changed.
7921 */
7922 validate_virtcol_win(wp);
7923 if ( redraw_cmdline
7924 || always
7925 || wp->w_cursor.lnum != wp->w_ru_cursor.lnum
7926 || wp->w_cursor.col != wp->w_ru_cursor.col
7927 || wp->w_virtcol != wp->w_ru_virtcol
7928 || wp->w_cursor.coladd != wp->w_ru_cursor.coladd
7929 || wp->w_topline != wp->w_ru_topline
7930 || wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count != wp->w_ru_line_count
7931 || wp->w_topfill != wp->w_ru_topfill
7932 || empty_line != wp->w_ru_empty) {
7933 cursor_off();
7934
7935 int width;
7936 int row;
7937 int fillchar;
7938 int attr;
7939 int off;
7940
7941 if (wp->w_status_height) {
7942 row = wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height;
7943 fillchar = fillchar_status(&attr, wp == curwin);
7944 off = wp->w_wincol;
7945 width = wp->w_width;
7946 } else {
7947 row = Rows - 1;
7948 fillchar = ' ';
7949 attr = 0;
7950 width = Columns;
7951 off = 0;
7952 }
7953
7954 /* In list mode virtcol needs to be recomputed */
7955 colnr_T virtcol = wp->w_virtcol;
7956 if (wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && lcs_tab1 == NUL'\000') {
7957 wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = FALSE0;
7958 getvvcol(wp, &wp->w_cursor, NULL((void*)0), &virtcol, NULL((void*)0));
7959 wp->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = TRUE1;
7960 }
7961
7962#define RULER_BUF_LEN70 70
7963 char_u buffer[RULER_BUF_LEN70];
7964
7965 /*
7966 * Some sprintfs return the length, some return a pointer.
7967 * To avoid portability problems we use strlen() here.
7968 */
7969 vim_snprintf((char *)buffer, RULER_BUF_LEN70, "%" PRId64"l" "d" ",",
7970 (wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY1) ? (int64_t)0L
7971 : (int64_t)wp->w_cursor.lnum);
7972 size_t len = STRLEN(buffer)strlen((char *)(buffer));
7973 col_print(buffer + len, RULER_BUF_LEN70 - len,
7974 empty_line ? 0 : (int)wp->w_cursor.col + 1,
7975 (int)virtcol + 1);
7976
7977 /*
7978 * Add a "50%" if there is room for it.
7979 * On the last line, don't print in the last column (scrolls the
7980 * screen up on some terminals).
7981 */
7982 int i = (int)STRLEN(buffer)strlen((char *)(buffer));
7983 get_rel_pos(wp, buffer + i + 1, RULER_BUF_LEN70 - i - 1);
7984 int o = i + vim_strsize(buffer + i + 1);
7985 if (wp->w_status_height == 0) /* can't use last char of screen */
7986 ++o;
7987 int this_ru_col = ru_col - (Columns - width);
7988 if (this_ru_col < 0)
7989 this_ru_col = 0;
7990 /* Never use more than half the window/screen width, leave the other
7991 * half for the filename. */
7992 if (this_ru_col < (width + 1) / 2)
7993 this_ru_col = (width + 1) / 2;
7994 if (this_ru_col + o < width) {
7995 while (this_ru_col + o < width) {
7996 if (has_mbyte)
7997 i += (*mb_char2bytes)(fillchar, buffer + i);
7998 else
7999 buffer[i++] = fillchar;
8000 ++o;
8001 }
8002 get_rel_pos(wp, buffer + i, RULER_BUF_LEN70 - i);
8003 }
8004 /* Truncate at window boundary. */
8005 if (has_mbyte) {
8006 o = 0;
8007 for (i = 0; buffer[i] != NUL'\000'; i += (*mb_ptr2len)(buffer + i)) {
8008 o += (*mb_ptr2cells)(buffer + i);
8009 if (this_ru_col + o > width) {
8010 buffer[i] = NUL'\000';
8011 break;
8012 }
8013 }
8014 } else if (this_ru_col + (int)STRLEN(buffer)strlen((char *)(buffer)) > width)
8015 buffer[width - this_ru_col] = NUL'\000';
8016
8017 screen_puts(buffer, row, this_ru_col + off, attr);
8018 i = redraw_cmdline;
8019 screen_fill(row, row + 1,
8020 this_ru_col + off + (int)STRLEN(buffer)strlen((char *)(buffer)),
8021 (int)(off + width),
8022 fillchar, fillchar, attr);
8023 /* don't redraw the cmdline because of showing the ruler */
8024 redraw_cmdline = i;
8025 wp->w_ru_cursor = wp->w_cursor;
8026 wp->w_ru_virtcol = wp->w_virtcol;
8027 wp->w_ru_empty = empty_line;
8028 wp->w_ru_topline = wp->w_topline;
8029 wp->w_ru_line_count = wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count;
8030 wp->w_ru_topfill = wp->w_topfill;
8031 }
8032}
8033
8034/*
8035 * Return the width of the 'number' and 'relativenumber' column.
8036 * Caller may need to check if 'number' or 'relativenumber' is set.
8037 * Otherwise it depends on 'numberwidth' and the line count.
8038 */
8039int number_width(win_T *wp)
8040{
8041 int n;
8042 linenr_T lnum;
8043
8044 if (wp->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu && !wp->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu)
8045 /* cursor line shows "0" */
8046 lnum = wp->w_height;
8047 else
8048 /* cursor line shows absolute line number */
8049 lnum = wp->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count;
8050
8051 if (lnum == wp->w_nrwidth_line_count)
8052 return wp->w_nrwidth_width;
8053 wp->w_nrwidth_line_count = lnum;
8054
8055 n = 0;
8056 do {
8057 lnum /= 10;
8058 ++n;
8059 } while (lnum > 0);
8060
8061 /* 'numberwidth' gives the minimal width plus one */
8062 if (n < wp->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw - 1)
8063 n = wp->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw - 1;
8064
8065 wp->w_nrwidth_width = n;
8066 return n;
8067}
8068
8069/*
8070 * Return the current cursor column. This is the actual position on the
8071 * screen. First column is 0.
8072 */
8073int screen_screencol(void)
8074{
8075 return screen_cur_col;
8076}
8077
8078/*
8079 * Return the current cursor row. This is the actual position on the screen.
8080 * First row is 0.
8081 */
8082int screen_screenrow(void)
8083{
8084 return screen_cur_row;
8085}
8086
